results.description:
Proposed Itinerary (actual trip depends on interest & campsite availability).

Thursday: Carpool departure from NYC by Noon. Arrive Whispering Pines campground by 5pm. Dinner in town.

Friday: Hike Gothics. 7am start. 10-mile round trip, 10-hour day. 4,000ft ascent. Intermediate/advanced hike.

Saturday: Hike a second peak or spend the day on Mirror Lake/Lake Placid (group vote).

Sunday: 9am departure for NYC.

Requirements to make this trip happen:
We need a car+driver!
We need enough tents to accommodate everyone.

Things to keep in mind:
It will rain and you must be able to tolerate getting wet.
Must have hiking boots. Poles and water reservoirs highly recommended.
Whispering Pines campsite bathroom/shower facilities are gross but usable.
Wine/beer/campfires/campsite-cooking are all welcome and expected.
Souvenir shopping/restaurant dining/Olympic ski-lift tour are all plausible evening adventures if we have more than one car or all campers are in agreement.
results.name: Adirondacks 3 Nights - Last Minute Getaway

results.description:
The streets of Lower Manhattan are alive in history and in daily activity. What began as a small trading outpost has grown to house institutions like the New York Stock Exchange and the World Trade Center. On this tour you experience the most historical site in all of the United States and others of immeasurable historical significance. The information presented will unveil new realities and perceptions that typically lay unseen.

Itinerary:
• Alexander Hamilton U.S Customs House
• Wall Street Bull
• Trinity Church
• New York Stock Exchange
• Federal Hall
• World Trade Center
• St. Paul’s Chapel
• And Much More

Reservations:
Please RSVP. If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:

Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins in front of the National Museum of the American Indian at 1 Bowling Green) map here. Tour concludes at City Hall Park map here.

Cost:
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You do not have to pay this. Your guide is compensated with your gratuities. Monetary contributions are collected anonymously at the end. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

results.description:
Sounds of the City: Slick Rick

Slick Rick

<a>OVERVIEW</a>

NJPAC in Association with the Universal Hip Hop Museum presents The Golden Era with Slick Rick.

Special Guest include:

Kurtis Blow

Afrika Bambaataa’s Soul Sonic Force

T La Rock

Evitan featuring Dres of Black Sheep and Jarobi of Tribe Called Quest

Mad Ism featuring Channel Live of BDP and Do It All of Lords of the Underground

DJ Kaos

Co-Hosted by Hakim Green, aka Channel Live, and DJ Wallah

British-American rapper Slick Rick, whose many hot releases include “Children’s Story” and “La Di Da Di” (with Doug E. Fresh), demonstrates his brilliant wordplay, dead-on pop culture references and hilarious one-liners at Sounds of the City. Admission is free!

Known as MC Ricky D in the Eighties, he and then-partner Doug E. Fresh released a series of acclaimed recordings, including “The Show.” He was scouted by Def Jam Records, which resulted in the success of his multiplatinum debut album The Great Adventures of Slick Rick.

Best known for his British accent and storytelling innovations, Slick Rick is one of the architects of hip-hop whose music has been sampled more than 600 times and interpolated by such artists as Nas, TLC, Snoop Dogg and Beyoncé.

In partnership with Harlem Chamber of Commerce

results.description:
Come enjoy a  sunset concert overlooking our beautiful Hudson River  on the west lawn at the historical Lyndhurst Castle!  

 A blast from the past!! All are welcome, not for singles only.


Concert is from  6:30 pm - 8:00 pm | $10 per car parking.  Come early for picnic and short river walk! In case of rain the meetup event will be cancelled but the concert will still be held in the tent at the Carriage House Courtyard for those interested. Always check the day of an event for any changes. For more info call[masked]

Shunzo Ohno Group check them out at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3b8ut9JUoMM

HUNGRY? THIRSTY? Caperberry Event Catering will be offering a selection of artisan sandwiches, chopped salads with your choice of toppings, childrens menu, snacks and  drinks for you to purchase prior to the start of the summer jazz concert performance. www.caperberryevents.com  or bring your own picnic dinner and something to share. 

 DON'T FORGET TO BRING A LAWN CHAIR, BLANKET, BUGSPRAY, SUN PROTECTION, FLASHLIGHT, WATER ETC. 

LOOK FOR THE MEETUP SIGN.  COME EARLY TO PICNIC AND OR FOR A SHORT SCENIC  RIVER WALK BELOW THE CASTLE on a paved trail with a moderate incline.(about 25 min)

DIRECTIONS BELOW:

DIRECTIONS

Lyndhurst is located at 635 South Broadway, Tarrytown, NY 10591, one half mile south of the Tappan Zee bridge on Route 9. Lyndhurst is approximately 24 miles north of Midtown Manhattan.

BY CAR

From Westbound 287 (from Eastern Westchester/Connecticut):
• Take 287 west/87 North to the last exit before the Tappan Zee Bridge, exit 9 off of the NY State Thruway, marked Route 9 Tarrytown. Take a left onto 119 at the first stoplight and a left (south) onto Route 9 at the second stoplight. The Lyndhurst gates are ½ mile on the right hand (river) side of the road.

From Eastbound 287 (from Rockland/New Jersey):
• Take 287 east across the Tappan Zee Bridge. Immediately after the tollbooth, take the first exit, Exit 9. Turn left (south) onto Route 9 and proceed ½ mile to the Lyndhurst gates on the right hand (river) side of the road.

From New York City’s East Side:
• Drive north on the East River Drive, across the Willis Avenue Bridge onto the Major Deegan Expressway North. Follow the Deegan to the NY State Thruway (I-87) to Westbound 287 (Tappan Zee Bridge). Follow westbound 287 directions above.

From New York City’s West Side:
• Drive North on the West Side Highway to the Henry Hudson north to the Saw Mill Parkway north to the NY State Thruway (I-87) North to 287 West (Tappan Zee Bridge). Follow westbound 287 directions above.

From Connecticut:
• Take either I-95, I-684, or the Merritt Parkway south to 287 West (to the Tappan Zee Bridge). Follow westbound 287 directions above.

From Long Island:
Take either:
• The Whitestone or Throgs Neck Bridge to the new England Thruway (I-95). Take Exit 21 onto 287 west (to the Tappan Zee Bridge). Follow westbound 287 directions above.
–OR–
• The Triboro Bridge to the Major Deegan north and the NY State Thruway (I-87) to 287 West (to the Tappan Zee Bridge). Follow westbound 287 directions above.

BY TRAIN

From Grand Central Terminal in New York City:

• Take the Metro North – Hudson Line north to Tarrytown.
Taxis are available at the train station.

Metro-North Getaway Fares
Lyndhurst is easily accessible from Grand Central Terminal and is the closest Hudson Valley mansion to New York City. Metro-North offers discounted admission to Lyndhurst when purchased together with a Metro-North train ticket. Tickets can be purchased to the Tarrytown station or the Irvington Station. At the Tarrytown station, taxi cabs are regularly available in the parking lot directly across the street from the train station. Alternatively, walkers or bikers may purchase tickets to the Irvington station and walk up Main Street, taking a left onto the Old Croton Acqueduct in the High School parking lot and continue for ten minutes until reaching Lyndhurst. For more information and to purchase a joint train fare/admission ticket, please click here.

results.description:
Join Erika Bloom Pilates and YOGASMOGA for a free pilates class at the South Street Seaport August 13, at 5:30 p.m. Erika Bloom has been studying Pilates for 20 years and teaching in New York City for close to 15 years. A former professional dancer, she performed internationally with various ballet and modern dance companies for almost 10 years.

In addition to Pilates, Erika has studied many holistic body methods including Klein, Alexander, Feldenkrais, and yoga. She brings her knowledge of these methods and her experience with the body through dance into her teaching. Since leaving the dance world, Erika has embraced athletics and has found this varied knowledge instrumental in helping a wide range of clients.

Erika’s certifications include Pilates Mat, 500+ hour Pilates Apparatus, Protocols of Osteoporosis, Muscle Imbalance Assessment and Correction, Nutrition, and Gait Analysis through the Physical Mind Institute. She is certified in Postnatal and baby yoga through Jyothi Larson and is a certified Yoga Therapist through Arturo Peal and Cheri Clampett. She also has extensive training and clinical experience in scoliosis correction, injury rehabilitation and prevention, fascia massage and Rolfing, spinal manipulation, and sports conditioning.

YOGASMOGA in partnership with South Street Seaport and Pop Up Mob is hosting its first ever pop up shop in New York City. As a New York based company we are very excited to have the opportunity to host three events a week on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays while our pop up is open from August 1st - September 10th.

Please RSVP at [masked]!

We're happy to be back at E's Bar as they have been tremendous hosts for the group on many past occasions! 

Join us Thursday, August 13, 2015 from 5:30-7:30PM. Come into the bar and look for the group. All drinks and food items are à la carte. RSVP via Meetup. Tweet @nealstimler and contact me via Meetup with your questions or concerns.


Our special guests are Jeffrey Inscho and the Pittsburgh Crew from the City of Champions. You can follow him (@staticmade) on Twitter and (@museopunk) on Instagram. Jeffrey is a creative technologist, currently leading digital and emerging media initiatives at Carnegie Museums of Pittsburgh. Among his many projects include reviving Andy Warhol's experiments with digital art from a 1980s Amiga 1000 and authoring "More than a Museum," a versioned and open-source digital strategy repository for The Andy Warhol Museum in Pittsburgh, PA, USA via GitHub. He's also the co-host of the beloved podcast series, Museopunks, done in collaboration with Suse Cairns. 

Jeffrey will be joined by the Pittsburgh Crew including: Brad Stephenson (@BStephenson), Drew McDermott
(@Kiwi_Birds), Regina M. Russian (@Regina_McD), Neil Kulas (@_kulas) and more. See you there!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

15 minutes of Body weight and DB Strength Training.

* This class is appropriate for all skill levels.

Who is this for?

Stretch and Strength is a great class for people seeking a lower intensity class as a part of their fitness strategy.

A great addition/ supplemental class for high intensity "Achievers".

Great for beginning exercisers to build a strong base of core, balance and support to enable them to live with less pain and improve functions of daily living.

A great class for GOLFERS. Golf Fitness will improve your felxibility and balance and power to increase clubhead speed and reduce post round pain.

This is a Placeholder only. Registration required. Please RSVP here. 

About the event:  

Data science is rapidly growing, so are the complexities, tools and techniques. To help data scientists stay ahead they need to have access to better networks. "Data Scientist Networking Gala" is a first step towards building  useful networks, that we could all leverage for helping us grow.

Time for us all to take a deep breath, pause for a moment and meet the fellow data scientists. The evening will be packed with networking, raffles and fun.

Date & Time: August 13th, 2015. 6:00pm - 8:00pm

Venue: 1010Data - 750 Third Avenue, 4th Floor New York, NY 10017

Agenda:

• 6:00pm - 6:20pm : Introduction to Analytics.Club & Welcome note from Gala Host

• 6:20pm - 8:00pm : Networking session & refreshments

Registration: Register here. (Required)

Additional Information: Visit Gala Page.

Our Gala Host:

1010data has created the fastest database in the world via an easy-to-use, spreadsheet-like interface to make big data discovery easy across retail, consumer packaged goods, financial services, healthcare and telecom.

Founded in 2000, our passion lies in providing actionable insight from massive amounts of data more quickly, easily and inexpensively than any other solution.

With more than 20 trillion rows of data currently under management, 1010data is designed to scale to the largest volumes of granular data, the most disparate and varied data sets, and the biggest user populations. All while delivering lightning-quick system performance. http://1010data.com

How you could help: 

Spread the word on the event so we could maximize the outreach and invite as many great data science professionals as possible.

• First Signup. 

• Share with your peers.

For any questions please email: [masked]


About the AnalyticsAwarenessWeek:

"Analytics for the 99%" is a line that we hold very close to our core belief. But it's always easier said than done. So, we put together Analytics Awareness Week to facilitate dialog, awareness and networking within our rapidly growing data community. Such interaction between data science professionals and businesses will surface several opportunities that lies in the data science community. 

Goal: To build networks and outreach to help promote and provide "Analytics for the 99%".


<a href="mailto:[masked]"></a>

results.description:
It's time to get kicking. Kick your neighbor. Kick your brother. Kick the big red ball. Just don't kick your dog. Game. On.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of kickball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game with rules similar to baseball -- except instead of using a bat to hit a little ball, you use your feet to kick a ball about 10x the size of a baseball. Kick the ball, run to the base, avoid getting your ball caught mid-air or yourself tagged out. Easy. And no athletic skill is necessary, just the ability to kick! Go out and practice now to get ready. Kick the postman when he delivers your bills. Kick that neighbor who won't turn down his stereo. Just get kicking!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/64476072/Kickball%20Rules.pdf.</a>

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be kicking and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Kickball for Grownups (Co-ed)

results.description:
Twitter: @NycDataSci

Are you a technically-oriented person looking to get into the data engineering field? Train to become a data engineer. Opportunities for data engineers continue to grow, and the need for data engineers will continue for years to come.

As the amount of data grows, so does the need for distributed systems that make it possible to analyze and draw insights from the data. The data engineer is frequently the key figure in making this “big data” available. In many instances, without the data engineer, there can be no data science.

Join the open house to learn more about our 6-Week Data Engineering bootcamp. (Apply Before August 21st, 2015)

====================================

The Founder of the school, Vivian Zhang, along with the COO, Janet Kamin, will be hosting. You're Invited! Save the date. Come have an after-work drink with members of the NYC Data Science community. Learn how you can bring your data scientist goals to life.

Drop in any time between 6:00 - 8:00 pm!

Meet our instructors, alumni, and staff. Learn what it means to be a Data Science student, and check out our alumni's final projects. Get introductions to our upcoming course offerings or have a 1-on-1 chat with our admissions rep to find the right course for you. Learn about the NYC Open Data Group, NYC Data Science Academy and the benefits of becoming a member of the school and meetup!

Have questions? Need help with something you are working on? Come check out NYC Data Science Academy's weekly office hours! Our talented teachers will be on hand to help and answer your questions. If you have specific question, please leave it in the comment section. So we can get prepared to help you out!

Please note that all exits are final. There is no reentry.

One ticket per person

Tours cost $20 for adults and $15 for seniors, children and youth. Tours are nonrefundable and take place rain or shine. For more details about the tours, click here.

results.description:
As seen in the CNBC Documentary The Bitcoin Uprising.


Enter “The Nakamoto Circle of All Satoshi Squares” aka the World’s Largest Direct Sellers-to-Buyers Bitcoin Trading Pit! 

Starting at 6:00 p.m. Bitcoin Center NYC welcomes Satoshi Square for a night of spontaneous Bitcoin trading in a LIVE open outcry trading pit. Buy or sell Bitcoins with Satoshi Square and others, or just observe and enjoy a party among fellow Bitcoin enthusiasts. Open bar!

This event is perfect for expert and novice traders as well as exhibitors, vendors, hardware and software developers, educators, students, media, and anyone wanting to be acquainted with the technology. Talk to our experts and get feedback concerning Bitcoin-related startups, as we are an incubator for these. Gaze upon MiningBot and Cash2BTC, two examples of path-breaking Bitcoin hardware the center co-developed. Meet or become a center sponsor and get exposure among the right audience and media!

No matter the focus of your Bitcoin interest or your expertise level, you are welcome. Bring a friend who might have read or heard something about Bitcoin. With our assistance he or she will leave with a better understanding and their first electronic or paper wallet. 

All trading is organic, spontaneous, and occurs directly between sellers and buyers. There are no intermediaries, and no fees as we are neither a trading floor nor a brokerage. Drinks and hospitality are courtesy of Bitcoin Center NYC. 

Details follow. See you there!

Every Monday & Thursday Night

6:00 p.m. to 11:00 p.m.

World’s Largest Direct Sellers-to-Buyers Trading Pit aka

‘The Nakamoto Circle of All Satoshi Squares’

Bitcoin Center NYC

40 Broad Street

New York, NY 10004

Jeff Manson has been trading since 1997. His experience is broad-based, and he actively trades equities, futures, commodities, bonds, currencies, E-Mini’s, and options. Jeff is the author of two trading books and has designed and individually conducted courses for large groups of traders. He has also conducted several online chat rooms and morning webinars to support the students he has shared his methodology with. He has been a speaker to Investment Groups, Trading Investment Conference and Private Seminars with over 95% of students rating the courses and lectures as “excellent.”

Jeff uses his trading methodology and personal trading experience to teach students how to use broad market analysis, fundamental and technical analysis, chart pattern recognition and a step by step trading plan.

Jeff will discuss using Fibonacci Retracements and Extensions as Odds Enhancers for Core Strategy of Supply and Demand. This will help you enter positions and set your targets. Please call to register[masked]-9600.

results.description:
Updated March 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside as a backup.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
Arduino Essentials  is designed to take you beyond  the basics and get you ready to start working on your own  Arduino project.   This six week course will equip tech-friendly beginners with the confidence and skills to use the Arduino platform in multiple future projects.

This is a hands-on course which is designed around a sample project that you build and take home with you at the end of the six weeks.  Each session will focus on a different essential a skill and help you overcome several ‘hurdles’  that have been observed to discourage  those who attempt to solve problems using Arduino. 

Cost: $225 for the full six week course

***Prepayment is required for this course.  One you respond yes on meetup we will reach out to you with payment options.



Digital I/O

• Switches and pull-up resistors

• Driving LED’s

• Power considerations

• Experiment: combination lock

Analog I/O

• What is an ADC

• PWM

• Experiment: Thermometer with color output

Program Flow Control

• FOR

• IF

• SWITCH CASE

• DELAY

• Experiment: Illumination level and/or Mood Lamp

Serial Communication

• Using the Serial Monitor

• Experiment: Bidirectional Communication

Interface and Drivers

• Bipolar Transistors and MOSFETs

• Driver chips (ULN2003, ULN2804, LB1205)

• Stepper shields

• H Bridge shields

• Experiment: Small Motor control.
results.name: Arduino Essentials - It's time to move beyond blink (4 of 6 Sessions)

results.description:
Better than the gym Thursdays!

[masked], [masked] are the exact GPS Coordinates for the trail head.  The lower lot is technically right across the street from 64 Skyline Drive address.

Fast night hike.  6 ish miles (been known to reach 7.33 ;-), with about a 900 ft elevation gain

We will meet at the LOWER lot of skyline drive in Oakland at 6:15pm on Thursday evening. This will be approximately a 2 - 3 hour hike.

We will take the blue trail to Ramapo Lake then decide if we take the white trail that leads us to some great views of the sunset and NYC.  We can walk through the Van Slyke Castle. http://theoaklandjournal.com/oaklandnj/hike-into-history/">http://theoaklandjournal.com/oaklandnj/hike-into-history/</a> and decide our descent and length of the hike from here.  Most likely we'll take the white to yellow and back to blue and out. This route will change from week to week depending on group so please have a map or gps.

http://www.state.nj.us/dep/parksandforests/parks/maps/NYNJTC_NJParkMaps-RamapoMtn_2015-85x11.pdf"></a>" class="linkified">http://www.state.nj.us/dep/parksandforests/parks/maps/NYNJTC_NJParkMaps-RamapoMtn_2015-85x11.pdf;

Bring headlamps, maps and water. Have fun!

http://www.tickencounter.org

results.description:
Twitter: @NycDataSci 

Check out NYC Data Science Academy's latest offering!

• 6 week Hadoop and spark workday night class</a> starts on Aug 11th.

• <a href="http://nycdatascience.com/data-engineering-bootcamp/">6 week full time Data Engineering bootcamp starts on Aug 24th.

• 12 week full time Data Science Bootcamp starts on Sept 21st.


========================================

Topic: Pierre will speak about the Medicare open data and its potential applications. In particular, we will have a look at outliers and fraud as well as the impact of companies payments on doctor prescriptions. The whole data wrangling and modellig will be done using sql and python.

Speaker Bio: Pierre Gutierrez is a senior Data Scientist at Dataiku (www.dataiku.com). He has experience in several topics such as fraud detection, predictive maintenance, recommender systems, smart cities or healthcare.

Schedule: Door opens at 6:00pm. We serve pizza and beer from 6:00-6:30pm. Event starts on 6:30pm.

Pre requites : You should have a very basic understanding of SQL and Python or R.

Preparation : Please have a running postgresql db running and a R/Python environment. Ipython notebook or jupyter (https://jupyter.org/) would be perfect. It would be better to have a basic understanding of the medicare data available here : http://www.cms.gov/OpenPayments/Explore-the-Data/Dataset-Downloads.html Looking at this video might also help : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mtlYQIDLdc8
results.name: Hands-on workshop on analysing medicare data with postgresql and python

Let’s pedal over to Randall’s for some playtime on the Island! We are going to take advantage of the recently installed grills and picnic tables for an easy evening BBQ – we will put some miles in first to work up an appetite.

The following will be provided: Mini Disposable BBQ Grill for vegetarian items, Charcoal, lighter fluid, and cooking utensils. Bring your own contribution (for example hot dog/burger buns, quick cooking items like burger patties, sausages, cheese slices, chips, beverages). We will pit stop at a store on the way to the Island for last minute items.

We will do our best to stick together and always ask a volunteer to ride as sweep but please have someone’s number to call if you get separated from the group. There are a few stretches where everyone will be invited to pedal at their preferred pace and mass up points will be called out along the route…so grab your bike and bring your frien


WHEN: Meet up at 6:30 pm, Wheels down at 7:00 pm!

MEET-UP: USS Maine National Monument, Columbus Circle
1849 Broadway, NY, NY 10023
http://goo.gl/maps/qUIEL

STOP 1: Pioneer Supermarket
256 Saint Ann's Avenue, Bronx, NY 10454
http://www.pioneersupermarkets.com/

END SPOT: Randall’s Island Park
1 Randall’s Island Park, New York, NY 10035
http://www.nycgovparks.org/parks/randalls-island

ROUTE: </a>TB
DISTANCE: <20


Ever endeavoring to turn social cyclists into cycling commuters.
The goals are to ride bikes and hang out with friends that love riding bikes.

Feel free to contact us with any questions/concerns.
[masked]

CAUTION: If you like to ride ahead of the lead, please be sure to test the route for your own safety and for the safety of anyone that doesn't know the route and follows you. Feel free to ride ahead on bridges as we always mass up on the other side.

WHAT YOU NEED:

NYC Department of Transportation Bicycle Laws, Rules & Regulations require: White headlight and red taillight must be used from dusk to dawn, bell or other audible signal (not whistle), working brakes, and reflective tires and/or other reflective devices.

Social Cycling NYC strongly recommends that every cyclist: Follows NYC DOT rules, EXPECTS all cyclists to accept personal responsibility for their own actions (or lack thereof), and recommends cyclists bring/use bikes, helmets, locks, IDs, money for food and drinks, and cycling friends!

HOW: WE ride AS traffic and NOT AGAINST it. We stop at red lights, yield the right of way and let cars pass as best we can. We don't block intersections. We are nice to both our fellow riders and the other traffic on the road. LISTEN TO the volunteers helping to lead the ride. They are some nice people and have your best interests in mind. If you have any questions about the rules, please check here: <a href="http://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nyc.gov%2Fhtml%2Flook%2Fhtml%2Fcyclist%2Fcyclist_safety_text.shtml%23sec6&h=VAQGBZC4z&enc=AZNVZGgmjeL_MHG6Fn9Jq-j8mvCUJaeCx4seSoDvy73t5fi1nNdi8jAyMdsqDzomg_Y&s=1">http://www.nyc.gov/html/look/html/cyclist/cyclist_safety_text.shtml#sec6

REMINDER: The goal is to create a safe environment for all riders, but we cannot control, nor do we desire to, every rider's behavior. We promote personal responsibility and all riders are responsible for themselves. If you choose to ride with us, then you accept the risks inherent in riding a bicycle with a large group of other people riding bicycles.

Social Cycling New York City is modeled after Social Cycling Austin.https://www.facebook.com/socialcyclingaustin/info

You are invited to join other busy New York City professionals to network at your own speed during the casual networking happy hour at Gastro Bar or take on the challenge of our fast-paced "Speed Networking" session!

Summer is in full swing and so we are mixing business with pleasure by bringing like-minded professionals together at one of Manhattan's best after work venues!

ALL INDUSTRIES ARE WELCOMED!

What is Speed Networking?

Speed Networking is a fun and highly effective mechanism for generating new business contacts in a small period of time. Whether you are an introvert or extrovert, young in your career or experienced – you will enjoy meeting people in this type of format. Eventsy is a firm believer in putting people face-to-face to facilitate direct conversation. In just a few minutes, participants will share business cards, history and offer new contacts with valuable information about their business and/or profession. After the official Speed Networking sessions are over, participants are encouraged to continue networking throughout the evening.

results.description:
RSVP now for Demo Day 7 ($10, payable in advance)*


What is Demo Day? Presenters get 5 minutes to present a news-oriented project, and 5 minutes to answer questions from the audience. It's a fast-paced, fun evening, and we hope you'll be a part of it. 

The lightning talks for Demo Day will include:

• Atlas Obscura's Guide to Literary Road Trips, with Richard Kreitner @richardkreitner


• A look behind Stimme.de's Operation Sawfish, a 70th anniversary commemoration of a massive WWII air raid over Heilbronn, Germany, with Vanessa Wormer @remrow

• The decision tree that decides on the best maps to make given a dataset for CartoDB's One-Click Mapping, with Andy Eschbacher @MrEPhysics

• Dailygraphics, NPR Visuals' rig for deploying daily graphics projects in responsive iframe, with Alyson Hurt from NPR Visuals @alykat

• Mapshaper, an open source alternative to GIS software for editing map data, with Matthew Bloch from The New York Times@grammata

• censusAmericans, personalizing the U.S. Census on Twitter, with Jia Zhang, intern at FiveThirtyEight @jiazhang

*Refund policy: Cancel at least 24 hours before the event (that is, no later than 6:30 p.m. Aug. 12) to receive a full refund. We cannot issue refunds after that. 

Schedule:

6:30 p.m.: Doors, dinner + socializing

~7:00 p.m.: Demos/lightning talks begin

~8:15 p.m.: Hiring announcements, networking and socializing

A big thanks to Pivotal Labs for hosting us. Want to host a Hacks/Hackers NYC event? Email us at nyc[at]hackshackers[dot]com.


Read more about our previous Demo Days:

• Demo Day 6

• Demo Day 5

• Demo Day 4 

• Demo Day 3

• Demo Day 2

• Demo Day 1

results.description: The North Face has joined the free fitness movement with the Mountain Athletics program. The workouts focus on strength, work capacity, and plyometric agility (making it a great source for cross training!). Each session is led by two of The North Face pro trainers and is attended by goal oriented local athletes. FREE and open to all levels. Don't miss out! bit.ly/thurs_ma_nyc

results.description:
Every Thursday we host our evening calisthenics training class.  This class focuses on building a solid foundation in the basics through fun and demanding routines as well as progressions towards advanced movements and techniques. All content is designed for anyone of any level to fully participate. The group setting adds further challenges to the workout while offering encouragement, motivation, and camaraderie between everyone involved.

Walk ups always welcome, RSVP's appreciated ;)

$20.00 per person
results.name: Bodyweight Training Class

results.description:
I give gay history walking tours of Greenwich Village for my company, Oscar Wilde Tours, and if people are interested, I'd be happy to give one for the LGBT History and Culture meet-up group. Here is the blurb from my website (http://oscarwildetours.com):

On this tour, we venture into the heart of the Village, where the Stonewall riots took place in 1969 and the first Gay Pride parade started a year later. But the Village's gay history goes back a century before that, to Walt Whitman's time. Like Paris' Left Bank, the Village has been the center of all of the city's many countercultures and artistic movements, from the Bohemians of the World War I period to the Beats, the Abstract Expressionists, the New York School, Pop Art, the creators of Off (and Off-Off) Broadway, and of course the gay liberation movement. We see the places where Villagers have lived and loved, including the sites of the drag shows and gay bars which have dotted the Village for 150 years. The list of LGBT greats we discover reads like a history of American culture: Herman Melville and Henry James, Edna St. Vincent Millay, Eleanor Roosevelt, James Baldwin, Allen Ginsberg, Andy Warhol, as well as a host of other famous names including gay icon Billie Holiday.
results.name: Explore the gay history of Greenwich Village

results.description:
As it is always, the topic is a placeholder for the month's conversation. Do not be limited by it, but do think about it. 

This month's topic is: how to define the computational era. I recently found out that the period for Modern art lasted from 1860 - 1970. Then there must be a new period after it, and a new period maybe not in terms of art only.

I will call it the computational era for now. 

What is the nature of this period?
results.name: Discussion: How to define the computational era

results.description:
[Note: This screening HAD been sold out, but now has been moved to a larger auditorium at the same theater to accomodate the high demand. So if you got a "Sold Out" message before, you may once again order tickets. Don't wait, tickets may sell out again.]

PlantPure Nation is coming to NYC on Thursday, August 13th for its official national release screening!

This film documentary follows the heroic efforts of Dr. T. Colin Campbell (author of the The China Study and subject of Forks Over Knives) and others to influence public policy to support a plant-based diet.  Their plan, which was very enthusiastically received by the Kentucky state legislature, then met with the determined efforts of agribusiness to tear it down.

Please encourage a non-veg friend to join you for the evening. It's a great way to introduce people to the work for Dr. T. Colin Campbell and whole food plant-based eating/living!

Film synopsis:

The documentary film PlantPure Nation tells the story of three people on a quest to spread the message of one of the most important health breakthroughs of all time. After renowned nutritional scientist and bestselling author T. Colin Campbell gives a stirring speech on the floor of the Kentucky House of Representatives, his son, Nelson, and Kentucky State Representative Tom Riner work together to propose a pilot program documenting the health benefits of a plant-based diet. Once the legislation goes into Committee, agribusiness lobbyists attempt to kill the plan.

Movie website: http://plantpurenation.com/the-film/

Screening Info:

Date: Thursday, August 13, 2015

Time: Please arrive at 6:30pm for the 7:00pm screening

Location: City Cinemas Village East

181 Second Ave. (corner of E. 12th St.)
New York, NY 10003

Ticket price: $14.00 + $1.35 Fandango charge

***Please purchase your ticket in advance at the link below. This show may sell out.***</a>

<a href="https://www.fandango.com/citycinemasvillageeast_aaecf/theaterpage?date=08/13/2015">https://www.fandango.com/citycinemasvillageeast_aaecf/theaterpage?date=08/13/2015

Where to Meet: Our Meetup group will be meeting directly in front of the theater at 6:30pm. I will be holding a "VEG MEETUP" sign in front of the theater. At 6:40pm we will all go inside the theater and get seats together for the 7:00pm showing. If you want to sit with our group, don't be late.

I am personally very excited about this movie, and am eagerly looking forward to seeing it.

David

P.S. After the movie, I am sure that many of us will go out to an informal vegan dinner.  Please come along if you wish.
results.how_to_find_us: How to find us: We'll meet directly in front of the theater at 6:30pm. I will be holding a "VEG MEETUP" sign in front of the theater. At 6:40pm we will all go inside the theater and get seats together for the 7:00pm showing.
results.name: (More Tickets Added!) PlantPure Nation - National Release Screening!

Pricing: First class – FREE
$18.00 / class (pay as you go)
$150.00 for 10 class card (must be used within 6 months)
(Cash/Check/Credit Card/PayPal Accepted)


Teacher: Nancie Celini

Dr. Nancie Celini is our founding teacher. She is a Registered Yoga Teacher (RYT, Yoga Alliance) and holds a masters and doctorate in public health. With years of fitness training and a black belt in martial arts her strong teaching background and love of yoga has inspired her to craft a program for everyone. Nancie developed Just Breathe while studying Karate. The simple act of breathing, correctly, can make a vast difference in being able to flow through the events of life or feeling stuck and frustrated. When you feel anxious, sad or frustrated, Just Breathe!

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language.

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Ages Women 25 - 37, Men 25 - 39

This speed dating event is for intellectually-oriented single professionals with advanced degrees. Women stay seated as men switch tables every five minutes. You'll chat with around 15 potential love interests, and the next day, we will inform you of any matches (the people you picked who also picked you).

We expect up to 10 men and 10 women to participate, and each date will be for 5 minutes.

results.description:
The long promised drawing class with instruction!
In this class, We'll be doing plenty of drawing from the model, as well as discussing some of the sticking points an artist has to deal with, with lots of individual attention.

My approach is to offer both general and individual suggestions and observations. Everyone has a different way of approaching, and understanding what they see, as well as their own unique style. I'll be approaching this class with your specific goals in mind. (Nothing more frustrating than a teacher who can only teach you his way to draw--we all have our own!)

We'll have a nude model doing both short and long poses, and we'll discuss some of the different materials and methods as well. Please bring your favorite art supplies, but a newsprint pad (approx 12"x14") and pressed charcoal or Conte crayon is recommended.


A little about me:
I'm a lifelong artist. I spent 20 years in advertising as a graphic designer. I'm also a life member of the Art Student's League and have studied with such luminaries as Gustav Rehberger, Nathan Cabot Hale, Thomas Fogarty Jr., Gary Fagin, Han He Ping and others.
For the last few years, I've pursued a practice in the personal development field helping clients find specific solutions to meet their needs, and it's with the same focus on each individual's needs and motivations that I'll be approaching this class.
results.name: Beginner's Figure Drawing Class (With instruction!) 8/13, 7pm.

results.description:
Join us for Freegan Film Night featuring Cowspiracy: The Sustainability Secret. Freegan snacks will be available. We’ll watch the movie, enjoy some food, and share our thoughts.


"Cowspiracy: The Sustainability Secret is a groundbreaking feature-length environmental documentary following intrepid filmmaker Kip Andersen as he uncovers the most destructive industry facing the planet today – and investigates why the world’s leading environmental organizations are too afraid to talk about it. Animal agriculture is the leading cause of deforestation, water consumption and pollution, is responsible for more greenhouse gases than the transportation industry, and is a primary driver of rainforest destruction, species extinction, habitat loss, topsoil erosion, ocean “dead zones,” and virtually every other environmental ill. Yet it goes on, almost entirely unchallenged."


Doors will open at 7pm and the film will begin at 7:30pm.  NOTE: Last time we showed a film in this location, the AC was on full blast, and it was cold in the room, so come prepared in case that's the situation again...
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the Assembly Hall at Judson Memorial Church (239 Thompson Street, New York, NY 10012). Ring the buzzer for the Assembly Hall when you arrive.
results.name: Freegan Film Night: Cowspiracy

results.description:
In addition to the regularly scheduled volleyball this Thursday, if anybody is interested, I will be offering a skills clinic to work on contacting the ball more effectively for hitting and passing, and also will spend a few minutes doing a basic blocking drill that will teach better footwork and help people work together as a unit. If you are interested in doing this, I would request that you sign up for this in addition to signing up for Thursday's volleyball so we can keep the head count accurate. The skills clinic would run for about 45 minutes to an hour or so. I don't think anybody wants to put up with me for longer than that... :)

For those who do the clinic, if you're happy with what we cover, I'll request $5 in addition to the regular $10 for the evening. If we have good turnout, I'll poll those interested and every 6 weeks or so will offer another skills clinic to provide opportunity for players to work on various aspects of their game.

-Roman

Brief resume:
Been coaching high school, college, and Junior Olympic teams since the early 1990s. Played at the Open level for beach and grass in San Diego in the mid to late 1990s. Played AA indoor as a Middle, Outside Hitter, and Opposite for various teams in the 1990s and early 2000s before officially getting old. I still love the game, and enjoy sharing what I can offer in a fast paced, enthusiastic, and supportive learning environment.

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for three years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!

results.description:
Women’s New Moon Healing Sanctuary- the Exploration of Venus with Essential Oils, Shamanic Drum Mediation, Vegan Chocolate, and More!

Venus is a goddess who embodies love, desire, sexuality, fertility, and wealth. On this new moon under the powerful 40 day stretch of Venus retrograde, we will explore such aspects of Venus within, healing our hearts and our relationships preventing us from being our most illuminated and blissful selves.

Temptation, illusion, and misguided relationships may come to the forefront during this 40 day span; in this sacred circles we will acknowledge this present energy and dissolve any deception or unwise dreams.

Additionally we will incorporate organic essential oils with special guest Lindai Schwartz for healing and for connection to the Venus within you!

All goddesses are welcome to join this expansive evening.


The program will include:
• Opening Ceremony
• Healing Shamanic Drum Journeying
• Learning about Essential Oils
• Heart Opening Vegan Chocolate
• Community LOVE & more!

When: Thursday August 13th 2015

Time: 7-9:00 pm

*Please be respectful and arrive on time as we will open ceremony promptly.

Where: Jeanette Stoner Studio
83 Leonard Street 5th Floor
Tribeca NYC

Cost: $25 or two for $40 if one brings a friend.

RSVP for one: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=2YC8XWYVCQJXQ

RSVP for two: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=UXF88JWC2AFFW


Sarah Eve is a culinary shaman, making magic in the kitchen and healing from the heart. She is a certified Usui Reiki master and practicing shaman with a deep love of the healing arts. Sarah Eve began her shamanic studies with Izhak Beery and followed with the late Ipupiara, a Makunaiman of the Ure-e-wau-wau Amazonian tribe. She has completed workshops with Tom Cowan and the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers. The path of healing also led her to work closely with the Santo Daime community, John of God, and crystal energy work in Brazil. Other international trips including Mexico and Central America, Europe, Israel, and Southeast Asia, she encountered sacred spiritual practices and healers in which she is blessed to share and teach. She completed her 200 & 500 hour yoga training with Sri Dharma Mittra. Integrating her experience also as a vegan chef, she uses food as another medicinal tool in achieving whole body health. She assists in creating a safe space in which you can heal you. www.sarahevecardell.com

Lindai Schwarz is a Holistic Health Coach and Reiki Master. Her goal is to help her clients get over specific health challenges and improve their overall health condition. Massage, aromatherapy, energy healing, treatments with essential oils, and nutrition/dietary counseling are part of her holistic approach. Every client's specific needs are met with an individualized solution. Her clients not only achieve a better state of health but are also able to maintain this newly gained healthy balance in their daily lives! One of Lindai’s passions is educating about aromatherapy and how using essential oils on a daily basis can enhance and change your life dramatically. Essential oils address all levels: the physical, emotional, mental and spiritual. The oils can easily be integrated to tackle the challenges you encounter in different moments of your life.
In tonight’s workshop Lindai will share wonderful essential oils that are especially good for women; addressing femininity, sensuality, self-worth, clarity, empowerment, hormonal balance, relationship and love life. You will learn how to find out which essential oils are best for you, different application methods and how to safely use the oils for yourself and others. Www.bodyworkny.com

All text, images, and products presented are copyright. Copyright © 2015 Sarah Eve Cardell. All rights reserved.
results.name: Women’s New Moon Healing Sanctuary- Exploring Venus w/ Essential Oils & More!!

results.description:
Women’s New Moon Healing Sanctuary- the Exploration of Venus with Essential Oils, Shamanic Drum Mediation, Vegan Chocolate, and More!

Venus is a goddess who embodies love, desire, sexuality, fertility, and wealth. On this new moon under the powerful 40 day stretch of Venus retrograde, we will explore such aspects of Venus within, healing our hearts and our relationships preventing us from being our most illuminated and blissful selves.

Temptation, illusion, and misguided relationships may come to the forefront during this 40 day span; in this sacred circles we will acknowledge this present energy and dissolve any deception or unwise dreams.

Additionally we will incorporate organic essential oils with special guest Lindai Schwartz for healing and for connection to the Venus within you!

All goddesses are welcome to join this expansive evening.


The program will include:
• Opening Ceremony
• Healing Shamanic Drum Journeying
• Learning about Essential Oils
• Heart Opening Vegan Chocolate
• Community LOVE & more!

When: Thursday August 13th 2015

Time: 7-9:00 pm

*Please be respectful and arrive on time as we will open ceremony promptly.

Where: Jeanette Stoner Studio
83 Leonard Street 5th Floor
Tribeca NYC

Cost: $25 or two for $40 if one brings a friend.

RSVP for one: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=2YC8XWYVCQJXQ

RSVP for two: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=UXF88JWC2AFFW


Sarah Eve is a culinary shaman, making magic in the kitchen and healing from the heart. She is a certified Usui Reiki master and practicing shaman with a deep love of the healing arts. Sarah Eve began her shamanic studies with Izhak Beery and followed with the late Ipupiara, a Makunaiman of the Ure-e-wau-wau Amazonian tribe. She has completed workshops with Tom Cowan and the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers. The path of healing also led her to work closely with the Santo Daime community, John of God, and crystal energy work in Brazil. Other international trips including Mexico and Central America, Europe, Israel, and Southeast Asia, she encountered sacred spiritual practices and healers in which she is blessed to share and teach. She completed her 200 & 500 hour yoga training with Sri Dharma Mittra. Integrating her experience also as a vegan chef, she uses food as another medicinal tool in achieving whole body health. She assists in creating a safe space in which you can heal you. www.sarahevecardell.com

results.description:
TICKETS ON EVENTBRITE

---------------------------------------

Please note that you must have a ticket from Eventbrite to attend.

RSVP'ing on Meetup alone will not get you in.

UX Workshop with FiftyThree

An evening of hands-on UX design with some of the best in the business.

Price: $20


This is a special User Experience (UX) workshop that we're putting together with some great folks at FiftyThree, makers of the popular Paper app and the finest stylus you'll ever use: Pencil. Some of the designers at FiftyThree are going to share their knowledge about UX with us, and we'll have a chance to check out their beautiful office. 

Space is very limited for this event - we want to keep the workshop format intimate. This is also the first time we've done a workshop like this, and we're excited to have the pros at FiftyThree to host us for it. Hope you can join!


Connect

We post discounts & freebies here:

Our Newsletter • Designers + Geeks Facebook • @DesignersGeeks


Satisfaction Guarantee

We organize this group to promote innovation, creativity, and the benefits of new technology. If you purchase a ticket and aren't happy with the experience, can't make it, or decide that you don't want to support the community for any reason, we're happy to refund your money.

Please note that if you do need to cancel your reservation, we request that you do so at least 24 hours before the event so that the tickets can be shared with others who may be waiting.

group.name: #1 NYC Singles Group - Meet, Mix, & Mingle

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Preview: http://archive.wired.com/wired/archive/2.01/microserfs_pr.html

For this meetup's book, we've picked a novel that's critical of the previous iteration of "tech culture".  "Microserfs" tells the story of Microsoft employees who set off to start a new company, hoping they'll find meaning (and lives) through their startup.  This book might serve as a reminder that even in the fast-moving tech world, some things don't really change.
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet on the second floor, which is empty early in the evening.

Upon arrival, you will be treated to the VIP celebrity experience. Walk the red carpet, feel the flash of the paparazzi, and be captivated by the sounds of our special guest DJ as you dance the night away. 

Also, enjoy complimentary Hors d’oeuvres & VIP Swag Bags. Goldbar is even spicing up the menu with a 2 for 1 special for the designer cocktail, the Crimson.

results.description:
Back to France again, to explore one of my favorite regions, the Loire Valley.  I’d like to warn potential attendees up front that if you favor big, high-extraction, high-alcohol, high-tannin fruit bombs, you might give this dinner a pass.  This is old-world winemaking in a northerly climate, where achieving full ripeness can be a challenge—the resulting wines are subtle, sometimes austere, definitely intended to go with food rather than dazzle critics bestowing 100-point-scale ratings.  (Or as Jancis Robinson says about the Clau de Nell Grolleau, “insider’s wines” that can be “hard work”!) 

A vast region of France falls into the category of “Loire Valley.”  The Loire is the longest river in France, and the wine regions alongside it range from Muscadet at the mouth of the river, on the Atlantic Coast, to the Sauvignon-dominated Upper Loire, home of Sancerre and Pouilly-Fumé, more than 300 miles inland.  In between are Touraine and Anjou, which produce a wide variety of white, red, rosé, sparkling, and sweet wines, usually unblended single-varietal wines with little or no oak influence, to highlight the grapes that grow best here.

If I poured all the wines that I’d like to include in a Loire tasting, the bottles would outnumber the attendees.  So I decided to narrow the focus down to Touraine and Anjou, where I think the most distinctive wines come from.  Nevertheless, I’m going a bit overboard, with eight bottles plus a bonus dessert wine.  I’m undercharging a bit for this event, on the assumption that I’ll be taking home significant leftovers.

REGIONS AND APPELLATIONS (FROM WEST TO EAST)

Anjou:  Situated around the city of Angers, this region in the western end of the central Loire (far enough west to get some maritime influence) was long known primarily for rather undistinguished Rosé d’Anjou.  But there are three noteworthy appellations in the region making white, red, and sweet wines.

Savennières:  A tiny appellation making some of the world’s best Chenin Blanc wines.  Long ago it was made in a sweet style, but today almost all of it is anything but—a formidably austere, concentrated, minerally dry wine that is often considered tart and unapproachable in its youth.  Restrictive yield limits contribute to the concentration.  We’ll be trying an example from 2007, made by Damien Laureau, a rising star of the appellation.

Saumur-Champigny:  A red-wine appellation created in 1957 to distinguish the wines from standard Saumur.  It’s situated on a plateau of well-drained, porous tuffeau rock and produces Cabernet Franc–based wines that have become classic Paris bistro wines—fruity, easy drinking, best drunk on the young side.  We’ll be trying a Saumur-Champigny by Clos Cristal, a historic property that is owned by the Saumur hospital (reminiscent of the Hospices de Beaune).  A remarkable feature of this property is a set of stone walls with holes in them through which the vines grow, keeping the roots cool and maximizing sun exposure for the grapes on the other side.   


Côteaux du Layon:  An appellation for sweet wines made from botrytized Chenin Blanc grapes.  The appellation is large and quality is variable, but superior wines come from subappellations Bonnezeaux and Quarts de Chaume.  The vineyards’ proximity to rivers encourages the formation of “noble rot,” and the best wines are labeled “Sélection des Grains Nobles,” meaning the harvest is done manually in multiple stages, with pickers only collecting rot-affected grapes containing concentrated sugars.  We’ll try a mature Sélection des Grains Nobles by Philippe Delesvaux.

Touraine:  This is the very center of the Loire region, situated around the city of Tours, distinguished by a cool, continental climate and tuffeau soils.  Here are the major appellations.

Bourgueil:  An almost exclusively red appellation (a small amount of rosé is produced) on the north bank of the Loire.  Cabernet Franc is grown on gravelly soils on south-facing slopes, resulting in fairly ripe, fruity wines that, like Saumur-Champigny, are Paris bistro standards. 

Chinon:  Across the river south of Bourgueil is Chinon, arguably the most famous of the Loire reds (although white and rosé wines are made also).  Styles vary with the terrain, with light wines coming from sand and gravel vineyards, and fuller-bodied versions from limestone slopes.  All tend to feature an appealing combination of fruit and pencil-lead minerality. 

Vouvray:  An ancient and highly respected appellation, producing world-class Chenin Blanc in a variety of styles, from bone-dry to sweet, plus sparkling.  The area is situated on a tuffeau plateau interspersed with small rivers and streams that moderate the continental climate.  The wines are long-lived and are a pure expression of Chenin Blanc fruit, with floral, apple, and beeswax notes—neutral oak and steel are used, and aging is primarily in bottle.  To contrast with the more mature Savennières, we will try a youthful dry Vouvray by Huët, one of the most admired winemakers of the appellation.

Cour-Cheverny:  This is an interesting rarity from Touraine—a small appellation producing white wines from the nearly extinct Romorantin grape, which produces wines with herbaceous, floral, and citrus notes.  I’m actually not sure I’ve ever tried Romorantin before, so I’m looking forward to tasting this mature example by Cazin, the most reputable maker in the appellation.

Also included in the tasting are two wines from more general appellations—Vin de Pays du Loire and Côteaux du Loir (not a typo—the Loir is a tributary of the larger Loire).  And these wines are made from grapes that are less noble than Chenin Blanc and Cabernet Franc, but they are distinct to the Loire region and can excel when carefully made.  Grolleau is, frankly, the trash grape of the Loire Valley.  Vigorous and productive, it is widely grown and made into indifferent rosé.  But Clau de Nell makes it into a rich red with surprising concentration.  I tried it at a trade wine tasting and found myself returning to it to try it again—it was probably the most interesting and surprising wine I tasted all day.  Pineau d’Aunis is an ancient variety that is declining in the Loire Valley, but it can produce a red wine with interesting peppery spice.  Bellivière’s Rouge Gorge is probably the most prestigious bottling of Pineau d’Aunis around. 

Appropriately enough, we’ll be trying these ultra-French, classic bistro wines at Saint George bistro in Hastings, where they will seat us in a private upstairs dining room.

http://saintgeorgebistro.com/

2008 François Cazin le Petit Chambord Cour-Cheverny Cuvée Renaissance  $33 

Wine Advocate 90 – From ripe and – by the taste of it – subtly-desiccated fruit, Cazin’s subtly sweet yet persistently bright 2008 Cour-Cheverny Cuvée Renaissance smells of pineapple, lemon, hedge flowers, almond extract; offers prickly citrus zest, pungent white pepper, piquant toasted nuts, and suggestions of crushed stone to complement its juicy palate appeal, and finishes with bittersweet, insistently tart persistence. There have been more profound exemplars of this cuvée but seldom one so likely to find immediate and exemplary employment at table. That said, you can expect this to be well worth following for at least 8-10 years.

2007 Damien Laureau Savennières le Bel Ouvrage  $41

Tanzer 93 – Bright gold. Wild, highly aromatic scents of singed orange, pear skin, magnolia, lemongrass, honey and vanilla bean. Broad, deeply concentrated citrus and orchard fruit flavors are braced by dusty minerality, with the exotic vanilla note joined by touches of mace and candied ginger. The floral element comes back on the finish, which is impressively pure, penetrating and persistent. Lots going on now but this will be even better with a few years of bottle age.

2013 Domaine Huët Vouvray Sec Le Haut Lieu  $27

Wine Spectator 92 – This is very expressive, with chutney, warmed apple, piecrust, orange blossom and honeysuckle notes all woven together and carrying through the quinine-fueled finish. Shows superb density and length for the vintage. Best from 2015 through 2022.

2011 Hospices de Saumur Clos Cristal Saumur-Champigny  $28 

Wine Enthusiast 88 – The Hospices de Saumur is a charitable foundation, and Clos Cristal is a donated vineyard owned by the hospital. This young, fruity 2011 shows some rough, rustic edges while also giving full, red berry fruits and some tight tannins. For aging over the next 2–3 years when it will smooth out.

From Grapes White Plains: “An utterly remarkable Saumur-Champigny called Clos Cristal. Now imported into the United States, it is unconditionally the finest Cabernet Franc from the Loire aside from the three Clos Rougeard wines it has been my joy to taste. . . . Made from 40-50 year old vines. Spicy aroma redolent of dark berries just getting to full ripeness. Rich entry, clean palate impression with the ripe fruit surrounded by superb Cab Franc acidity, Tannins are resolved. A fine example of Saumur red wine. Perfect with grilled meats.”

2009 Couly-Dutheil Chinon Clos de l’Écho  $33 

Guide Hachette des Vins 2012 ★★– Fleuron du domaine, le Clos de l’Écho rouge appartient jadis à la famille de Rabelais. Sa robe pourpre, tirant sur le noir, son nez alliant les fleurs, les fruits noirs et la torréfaction, son attaque soyeuse et sa structure dense lui valent également deux étoiles.  Cette bouteille de garde pourra attendre cinq ans.

(The jewel of the estate, the Clos de l'Echo was once owned by the family of Rabelais. Its purple color, almost black, its nose combining flowers, black fruit and torrefaction, its silky attack, and its dense structure also earned it two stars. This ageworthy bottle can be held for five years.) 

2012 Yannick Amirault Bourgueil La Coudraye  $23

Guide Hachette des Vins 2015 ★★–  Sur 6 hectares de terres sablonneuses, les Amirault ont vendangé à la main des cabernets d’âge mur (35 ans) et les ont élevés un an en fût.  Le résultat?  Un vin en robe rubis qui libère de fins arômes de fruits rouges et noirs.  La bouche n’est pas en reste puisqu’elle associe un joli fruité à un léger boisé aux nuances de caramel.  Un ensemble élégant épaulé par des tanins fondus.

(On 6 hectares of sandy land, the Amiraults have harvested old-vine Cabernet Franc [35 years] by hand and matured it one year in barrels. The result? A ruby-red wine that releases fine aromas of red and black fruits. The palate is not to be outdone as it combines pretty fruit with light oak and a slight caramel nuance. An elegant ensemble supported by soft tannins.)

2011 Anne-Claude Leflaive Clau de Nell Vin de Pays de Loire Grolleau  $38 

Jancis Robinson 15/20 – Very natural indeed! Hard work on the end. A real insider's wine. Pretty hard work. Should be served cool.

Wine Advocate 87 – The inky colored 2011 Grolleau is from 60- to 90-year-old goblet vines on a silty-clay terroir, comprising grit and red flint on tufa (limestone). Aged for 12 months on fine lees in fifth-use Burgundy casks and another 12 months on fine lees in vats, the unfined and unfiltered wine shows an attractive, well-balanced bouquet of red and black forest fruits (including elderberries and sloes) intertwined with delicious floral and earthy/fungous aromas. It is a fresh, straight, rather light to medium-bodied, meaty and slightly spicy wine with an accentuated acidity and an unpretentious expression of fruit. The ripe, meaty tannins are exclusively from the skins and give this attractive red a serious expression and a good structure. This wine should be served at 16°C.

Domaine la Bellivière Le Rouge Gorge Côteaux du Loir Pineau d’Aunis 2013  $40 

Not rated.  From Decanter: “Pineau d’Aunis, an underrated and underused Loire variety, is exciting and peppery. Crunchy tannins, great freshness of acidity, pomegranate and violet notes and freshly ground black pepper.”  100% old-vine Pineau d’Aunis.

BONUS DESSERT WINE

2006 Philippe Delesvaux Côteaux du Layon Sélection de Grains Nobles

Wine Advocate 94 – Delesvaux’s 2006 Côteaux du Layon Sélection de Grains Nobles is scented with ripe peach, green tea, quince preserves, and salted caramel. With a striking combination of juicy brightness and confitured richness, its torrified elements (including singed sugar cookies) beautifully balanced by salt, quinine, and cooling herbal notes, this displays a levity and lusciousness are rare in its vintage, and indeed in today’s Côteaux du Layon as a whole. Notes of candied orange peel accompany the fruit preserves, herbal essences, caramelization and salinity in a lingering, uplifting, indeed – despite the wine’s huge residual sugar – downright invigorating finish. This should be worth following for at least 25 years.
results.name: Loire Valley

In Fantastic Mr. Fox Mr. and Mrs. Fox live an idyllic home life with their son Ash and visiting young nephew Kristopherson. But after 12 years, the bucolic existence proves too much for Mr Fox's wild animal instincts. Soon he slips back into his old ways as a sneaky chicken thief and in doing so, endangers not only his beloved family, but the whole animal community.

results.description:
Please join us on Thursday evening for a 6 mile, casual-pace loop run.

We will meet just inside the 52nd Street entrance to Windmuller Park at 7:15pm and head out for a 6ish mile loop through Woodside, Sunnyside, LIC, and Greenpoint, before returning to the start. We won't set a minimum pace requirement for this run. But, please be sure that you can comfortably run a full 6 miles without stopping before deciding to participate.

For our evening runs, we will wait up to 10 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. This can mean we will wait for 2 minutes or 10. Please be prompt. 

If there is interest after we complete our run, we may venture to a pub for snacks and/or beverages.

Note that this run is held rain, snow or shine. In the event of very nasty weather or hazardous conditions, notice will be posted online, and all who RSVP will receive an email alert advising of any change in plans. 

- - - - - - 
 Please see our full calendar of events
http://www.woodsidesunnysiderunners.com/events/calendar/
connect with us on Google+
http://www.google.com/+WoodsideSunnysideRunners
like us on Facebook
https://www.facebook.com/WoodsideSunnysideRunners
and follow us on Instagram
https://instagram.com/woodsidesunnysiderunners/
