https://www.facebook.com/DavidCamposKizomba
https://www.facebook.com/groups/dance2heartbeatnyc/</a>;

VIDEO LINK : http://www.youtube.com/user/sbsdancefusion/videos?shelf_id=1&view=0&sort=p

What is Kizomba – The Origin

Kizomba is a breath whose rhythm is a beating heart, and where the perfect connection between two dancers gives birth to harmony, exaltation of senses and sensuality" D. Campos

Kizomba (a word meaning "Party" in angola ) takes its origin from the Angolan dance Semba, which is also the origin of the Brazilian Samba.
It appeared at the end of 70’s – 80’s, while the young Angolans, although very attached to their traditional dance,sought a new musical identity, and finally found their inspiration and new voice at a concert given by Kassav, a famous French Caribbean Zouk band. Kizomba was born out of this new generation’s desire to bring a touch of sensuality and sweetness to their national Semba.
The influence of the Angolan Kizomba soon spread to all the African Lusophone countries such as Guinea Bisau, Cape Verde, Mozambique. From there the dance quickly found its ticket to Europe via Portugal, where it further developed, by all these Artists, teachers, choregraphers coming from these Luso-African countries.
As it rapidly gained popularity, Portugal exported Kizomba to various countries in Europe such as France, Spain, Poland, Belgium, Danemark and England. 
Today it is rare to find a Latin dance party without Kizomba represented, as well as salsa or bachata.
This "African Tango Zouk", also called "Tango Lusophone" continues to conquer a growing audience of passionate dancers, eager for beauty of gesture and sensuality, but also the indispensable complexity of exchange and trust present in each motions of Kizomba.
This young dance of barely thirty years is booming today, and constantly evolving.
"Kizomba is a tribute to sensuality, an ode to love and sharing. A moment when the woman's beauty, enhanced by her partner, must embody all its essence. " D. Campos
Be the pioneers here in the U.S. of a dance that will become soon a must for your dancing nightlife !!

The annual BBQ picnic in the summer, which is usually on the Sunday a week before Labor day. This year will be August 30th. This is a massive event with barbecued sausages and lamb, games for the kids like sack races, egg and spoon and three-legged race, a gumboot throwing competition and a tug-of-war between the North and South islands, and a lolly scramble for the kids at the end.

We have a Christmas party in December (usually the first or second Saturday), and a number of other events besides. Please go to http://www.kiwiclubny... for more details, or email [masked]. And you can follow us on Facebook and Twitter (@KiwiClubNY)

You can join the Kiwi Club of NY online at http://kiwiclubny.org/amember/signup.php The membership cost is very reasonable and entitles you to members only prices for the summer picnic, the Christmas party in December, and other events during the year.

results.description:
Now you can take a live Insanity class at Clove Lakes Park by Certified Insanity Fitness Instructor.   Bring a guest your first visit and your first class is 1/2 off.
This revolutionary cardio-based total-body conditioning program is based on the principles of MAX interval training. INSANITY pushes the participants to new training heights, resulting in more calories burned, faster results and more efficient metabolism. This interval training is the pinnacle of cardio training. You don't have to be in extreme shape - levels of each exercise are provided.
Insanity's not your traditional interval workout. It replaces traditional moderate-intensity exercise with maximum-intensity exercise, and trades short intervals of intensity for short periods of rest. The secret? Long periods of explosive intensity. You’ll do cardio and plyometric drills with intervals of strength, power, resistance, and core training. With Insanity, you can burn up to 1,000 calories in an hour. Participants experience faster increases in cardiovascular fitness and burn carbohydrates and fat more efficiently.

Class Description:
PLYOMETRICS for insane legs and gluts, UPPER BODY RESISTANCE for sculpted arms, shoulders, chest, and back. PURE CARDIO for crazy fat burn and CARDIO ABS with intensive core work so you can get awesome abs. 50 minutes: All Levels Welcome!
☆☆☆$10.00 for a limited time only☆☆☆

results.description:
Be aware: There is no entry system at Mark's apartment, so knock on the door or a window to the left of the door, and if no one answers, call[masked]-3368.

This group is dedicated exclusively to novels. Please read the Novel Group Intro and FAQ before attending. Be prepared to read back through previous chapters of a novel-in-progress before committing to this group. Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Friday, eleven days prior to the Meetup. On that day, I'll send out an email listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order, with a link to the Google Drive folder where the stories live. That list will also appear under Discussions and will be edited as changes occur.

To submit, Email your submission to [masked]

SUBJECT: The Title of the group you're submitting to and your name. EXAMPLE: Cam's Novel Group December 8th, Spidercam

MESSAGE: Name, Title, Word Count, any additional info. EXAMPLE: Spidercam, Glory Chapter 2, 7,000 words. This is a rewrite.

Send to [masked]

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.name: Brad's Novel Group

results.description:
Come AWOL with us! (After Work Origami Lovers)


After a long week what could be better than meeting with friends and potential new friends to fold your work week away! Come fold with us at AWOL!

Its a lot of fun and more intimate than our once a month big meetings. A great place to learn some new models and also get help on models you're been stuck on. Bring your latest folds and creations for show and tell and your favorite models to teach and learn.

This meeting is free and open to all level of folders from beginners to advanced. bring paper and your books and also there will always be free paper available to share so you can just show up and fold!


please try to RSVP so others will know you will be there.

hope to see you there! happy folding!!

Due to the closing of Cosi at 23rd around 9pm. At this time this group will be meeting at Panera Breads near 28th and 29th, with a backup location meeting of Argo Tea near FIT. Panera closes at 10pm, and Argo closes at 11pm. 

Also I usually get there a bit earlier, so please look for paper folders, or at least the presence of paper. 

-Linda

NOTE: Please try to RSVP if possible so others will know you will be there. Thanks.

results.description:
We are a group of coders and designers who meet monthly in Fair Lawn. The knowledge of this group is very broad ranging, and there's room at for all interests and levels of web or technology involvement. We welcome new faces.

During the evening participants break out into small groups as people find the conversations that fit their interest and need for knowledge, or desire to share.

Members program in a variety of platforms including LAMP, Java, .Net and mobile. We code, in various languages and development environments; some work in CMS and database management

Panera Bread has decent free Wifi, so bring your laptop!

Kimi Wei, Organizer
http://www.meetup.com/njcode/members/33849
results.name: Metro Jersey Tech Convergence

results.description:
A group of professional designers, programmers and bloggers meets in Fair Lawn monthly. Come to a meeting and help shape the discussion. There's room for all interests and levels of web, design or technology involvement. Discussions take on shape according to who shows up any particular month. We meet at Panera Bread to take advantage of the free Wifi and the great onion soup! Bring your iphone or laptop and feel free to bring a friend!

Looking forward to seeing you at a meeting soon!

Kimi Wei thewei.com
Contact me via Meetup organizer link.

Meeting Attendance Fees No fee for web and technology professionals. Individuals NOT web or technology professionals pay an attendance fee of $10. FAQ about this policy. Employment agents and direct employers:
Company agents looking to hire and headhunters may attend a meeting for up to 30 minutes without paying a fee. This should give you time to assess member's interest in networking with you and to hand out cards. If you would like to make a presentation or sponsor the group for a meeting or series of meetings please contact me. New or existing company looking for freelancers or wanting site critiques
For a $50 fee you may attend a meeting and interact casually with group members for about an hour, but you may not solicit targeted advice about your project or website at that meeting. If you want the group to provide a site critique, or you need help with solutions for your site/project please contact me to set up a brainstorming session. Cost will be discussed at that time.

results.description:
Welcome to Tropix on the Mile — the hottest, nicest and classiest place on the South Shore! Kick your feet up in the sand , Enjoy the music and space for mingling while dancing into the  night!

South Beach meets Vegas meets Nautical Mile!

Welcomes ....Disco Unlimited for Special Dance Party Mingle on the Miles Premier Waterside Venue......  In a few words if you have never seen them they are amazing.....  And the Sista's are adorable .....the sound and the show is the Tri States Biggest Wow....

Bring yourself, your bffl , your date but don't miss this show

When you enter the Disco Unlimited Universe, you are instantly transported to a time when Saturday nights meant white suits, platform shoes and your very best dance moves. And dance you will – when you experience the arena performance of Disco Unlimited. This group has fast become the hottest disco show and dance band on the East Coast.
Capturing a time in music that to this day has not been matched, Disco Unlimited will exhilarate you with their powerful vocals, tight harmonies and dance grooves all coupled with a synchronized stage and light show that will turn any venue into a concert level production and the best of disco nights.
With Disco Unlimited you are getting a live, artist quality performance at every show. Close your eyes and you will truly believe you are listening to the original artists. Disco Unlimited is a group of 6 unique and experienced musicians fully equipped to meet your live entertainment needs. Disco Unlimited will have everyone getting their boogie on!

Tropix the Largest Dance Floor on the Mile

No Cover Charge 

Tropix on the Mile 395 Woodcleft Ave
   
  (516) 623-TROP / (516)[masked]
results.name: Summer ....Special Event ...Disco Unlimited Party at Tropix on the Mile

results.description:
TANGO INTENSIVE WORKSHOP & GUIDED PRACTICA  - INT/ADV  Levels

Let's meet up and dance Argentine Tango!!!    

Our goal is to keep learning the most effective methods available to achieve the quality in our movement that is dynamic but also natural.   It is a fun and dedicated group of 15 to 20 students each week.

We work for TWO HOURS in intensive techniques that will help leaders to MAINTAIN A COMFORTABLE EMBRACE throughout your dance, help followers to NOT ANTICIPATE and and as a leader communicate clearly your intent. We also dedicate some time to clean up bad habits on your posture, steps, and embrace.

For more information about this event and other classes, please visit our website www.maytevicens.com or write us an e-mail at <a>[masked]</a>

I hope to see you @ the dance floor!!

Mucho Amor,

Mayte Vicens

What's up guys, we will be discussing how to deal with a very common challenge in dating: rejections.

I will give you some ideas on how to shift your mindset and actions to better handle these inevitable challenges.


After the talk (about 10-15 minutes), we will split up and socialize.

We are meeting on the outside deck, at the bar to the left. (Not the inside bar)

Note: 230 Fifth is a popular rooftop lounge. You are responsible for your own entry. I recommend you wear a collared shirt and nice shoes to get in.

See you there!

Justin

(Check out our Weekend Coaching Programs in NYC)

PS let me know any questions in the comments

results.description:
OneTaste New York Orgasmic Lecture Series! 

I was out of control. I broke all rules and violated all societal norms there were to violate.  I dated a married man, I myself was married and about to be divorced.  I was hungry. 

I thought that all I wanted is this man or the connection I had with him. He seemed to be the representation of the life that I wanted and thought I needed.  I was lost, out of control, out of my mind, with no direction or manual on how to stop this crazy machine that seem to take over me.  I was obsessed and may be even possessed. 

When he was around, I was happy. When he was not, I was miserable and lost. It seemed like all my turn-on and ability to be happy in life depended on him and his presence.  

One day it all ended.  I got divorces and lost my love affair in the same breath. With that, I started to rearranged my whole life.  I promised never to fall in love again in the way that it was and in the way that it happened.  There has to be more to love than a stale, sexless marriage of duty and devotion or an obsessive escapade that takes over me and ends in heartbreak and disappointment. 

The truth was, I didn’t know what I wanted.  I started searching. This was a place where I began the path to waking up. I embarked on the journey of self-discovery and working with my consciousness to find the part of me who knew exactly what she wanted, what she needed and how to feel fulfilled. I learned about Orgasmic Meditation and my life has changed how I looked at relationships and at love all together. 

Although I craved romance and love, the kind of love I received was not what I expected. Soon I learned that the type of love and attention I thought I needed was different from the love and attention I wanted.

I will not lecture to you against love. This lecture is more about how love makes us who we are, and who we can become. In fact, I’m here to tell you who we are and who we become depends on how we use love to keep growing and expanding our level of awareness into ourselves and relating to others. As my teacher, Nicole Daedone mentioned to me, love and relationships of the blessed few is like Bikram – the bad news is you’ll never become great at it, and the good news, well, that’s the good news too. It’s all a practice.  It’s the way to keep working on myself and challenge myself and my partner to become the best that I can possibly be.  


Doors for this event close at 8:10

COST TO ATTEND IS $10

For questions feel free to contact Sasha at [masked] or call her at[masked] 3876.
results.name: Freedom from Addicted Love - A lecture

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
NEW CLASS STARTS TODAY

Pool 1 

This is pool session one for new students starting their diving course and a continuation of Lessons.

Your Journey to Adventure starts today. After a brief presentation we will gear up and get started in the pool.

The 3 Simple Steps to SCUBA Certification  

1. eLearning: Cyber Edu. Master the academic information. Traditionally, this required several hours of formal classroom training. Now, through on-line training, you can complete this phase through self-study, at your own pace, in the convenience of your home or office. 

2. Pool Sessions: The next step will be to complete your in-water skill-development training. This takes place in a swimming pool or similar body of confined water, under the supervision of an Instructor.

3. Get Certified: Complete the required certification dives under the supervision of an Instructor. Here you will apply what you have learned during your academic and pool sessions, while learning practical lessons that can only be gained through real-world experience in open water 

Get Started Now.

Enroll to start Step 1 "Online academics $109.95

If you have questionsd, please contact the Dive Center:[masked]

RSVP required 

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must: 
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

• Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6

• CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store.  Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

A. SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks:

• "Instructors": F. Ventura  &  C.K. Scharf, the 

• "Facility": 1-877-SCUBA-USA",

• "Agency" : SDI" and Others": (fill in at pool), then, 

Sign and date at bottom

B. SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

C. Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session. 

_____________________________________________

Complete packages, starting at $799 

• Regulator with Octopus

• BCD

• Analog Gauges

^ Months to Pay ZERO INTEREST *

*Subject to terms of credit agreement

results.description:
“3 And I set my face unto the Lord God, to seek by prayer and supplications, with fasting, and sackcloth, and ashes: 4 And I prayed unto the LORD my God, and made my confession , and said , O Lord, the great and dreadful God, keeping the covenant and mercy to them that love him, and to them that keep his commandment; “ (Daniel 9:3-4; KJV)

Please join us for “Prayer for our Nation,” hosted monthly by The Daniel Team, the Prayer Ministry of the Christian Party of America. The “Prayer for our Nation” conference call is the second Thursday of every month at 8:30 PM eastern (7:30 central).  The Daniel Team is led by Luis Chiang.   You do not need to be a member of the Christian Party to participate in the prayer conference calls or the other monthly conference calls for the Christian Party.   If you would like to become a member of the Daniel Team, please send an email to [masked] requesting to join the prayer ministry.  Thank you.

For more information about the Christian Party of America, go to www.ChristianPartyonline.com.  And Please like us on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Christian-Party-of-America/198905400159491

Prayer Objectives:

1.  True repentance, in the hearts of our citizens, which manifests itself in our daily lives.

2.  The healing and restoration of families in America.

3.  The restoration of Biblical principles employed in the ruling of our nation from the local to the national level.

4.  To teach the Church to maintain this righteous life so that once America is restored we will continue to teach the Body (including our children) to maintain godliness in our personal and public lives.

Prayer Strategies:

1.  We need to search our hearts and ask the Lord to reveal to us any sins that may be preventing Him from fully answering our prayers. (Joshua 7:10)  Once revealed, we need to confess our sins to Him (and repent of them) and, if appropriate, to those whom we offended.

2.  We need to assume the sins of the nation on ourselves; just as Daniel did for the sins of the nation of Israel (Daniel 9).

3.  It is absolutely crucial that in all these endeavors that prayer be our primary focus.  We need to rely on prayer (Jesus) as the foundation for everything that we do.  In addition, prayer teams need to be set up that will pray before, during, and after all events, etc. in order to bath in prayer everything that we do.  These prayer teams will be the “heavy lifters” who will be moving heaven and earth for us as we fight to regain our nation.

4.  We should follow (among other prayers in the Word), the prayers of repentance and requests for restoration that we find in the Bible, as we pray for our nation.

Prayer Focus:

1.  Jesus is the only way and the only power that will enable our nation to turn around (2 Cor 7:14). We need to focus on Him and to trust in Him alone, as we confess and turn from our sins; that He will tear down the strongholds of the enemy in our nation and in our individual lives. “When the enemy comes in; like a flood the Spirit of the Lord will lift up a standard against him.” (Isa 59:19). We must not trust in any tactic, procedure, or whatever in order to overcome the devil (who is behind all of the evil that we see around us). “For our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the powers of this dark world and against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms.” Ephesians 6:11-13

2.  We need to ensure that we stay focused.  The enemy (Satan) will try different tactics against us, e.g., to get our focus off of that which is most important and to either divert our attention on that which is least important and/or try to get us to do too much.  He will probably try to bring division amongst us.  My guess is that it would be through misunderstandings, hurt feelings, etc.  We must be aware of this up-front, expecting the attacks and to realize that the attacks are coming from the enemy and not from what we can, e.g., see with our natural eyes.

Prayer Tactics:

1.  We need to find appropriate Scriptures to stand upon to bring before the Lord as we pray individually and corporately.  It is crucial that we not follow a hard fast cook book approach; even one that is based on the Bible.  We need to know what the Scriptures say and then to allow the Holy Spirit to use what He’s taught us to do or to pray those things that He brings to mind or puts into our hearts to do.  For example, don’t have the “Hail Mary” prayer approach, e.g., I always have to pray this way or to pray these prayers in this exact order.

2.  The Church needs to be actively involved in politics and other social endeavors such as education, health care, the legal system, etc. (if even just knowing what is going on). In politics, the Body should then intelligently and with Christ-like love contact their representatives making their viewpoints known.  These godly leaders need to then rally the Body perhaps at local auditoriums, stadiums, etc. in order show the Church the truth about how our nation began and how the Church was actively involved in all facets of social life for the first few hundred years of our pre- and post-national existence.  The Body needs to learn that we must stand on what God’s Word says and to fight for what’s ours (just as the Israelites entered the Promised Land, fought huge giants, and won). 

Finally, remember:

2 Chron 16:9 “For the eyes of the Lord range throughout the earth to strengthen those whose hearts are fully committed to him…”

PREPARATION FOR PRAYER-STUDY MATERIALS

Repentance from Idolatry

All the sins described below are the symptoms of a bigger sickness, which is denying God as our creator and not glorifying him and acknowledging him as the supreme ruler of the universe. Rom 1:29 states “All Unrighteousness” stems out from the root of idolatry (Rom1:23). So, fornication is not a sickness, it is one of the symptoms of idolatry, covetousness is not a sickness, it is another symptom of idolatry, etc.

It is very important to focus our prayer efforts on this first cause of sin, which is ignoring God, suppressing the truth, and replacing the Creator by the created. God and truth are self-evident, but we choose to rebel against it. What we need is to repent from that.

Studying the nature of repentance would help tremendously in our efforts to pray and intercede for people because repentance is the key to come back to God and be healed.

Rom 1:18  For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness;

Rom 1:19  Because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God hath shewed it unto them.

Rom 1:20  For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, even his eternal power and Godhead; so that they are without excuse:

Rom 1:21  Because that, when they knew God, they glorified him not as God, neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations, and their foolish heart was darkened.

Rom 1:22  Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,

Rom 1:23  And changed the glory of the incorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man, and to birds, and four-footed beasts, and creeping things.

Rom 1:24  Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts, to dishonour their own bodies between themselves:

Rom 1:25  Who changed the truth of God into a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed forever. Amen.

Rom 1:26  For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections: for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature:

Rom 1:27  And likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another; men with men working that which is unseemly, and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet.

Rom 1:28  And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge, God gave them over to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not convenient;

Rom 1:29  Being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers,

Rom 1:30  Backbiters, haters of God, despiteful, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

Rom 1:31  Without understanding, covenant breakers, without natural affection, implacable, unmerciful:

Rom 1:32  Who knowing the judgment of God, that they which commit such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but have pleasure in them that do them.

Here’s an example of what causes repentance:

Let’s pray that America focus on the much that we have, so our hearts is filled with thanksgiving for his goodness towards us, and our hearts lead us to repentance.

Rom_2:4  Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?

Let’s pray that the end result of America’s tribulations, the recession, the aging and health deterioration of Americans, the financial distress, etc. work for our good, changing our hearts and drawing closer to God.

2Co_7:10  For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.

Let’s pray that America realize that God wants every American to be saved and not face judgment. Let’s pray that our pastors emphasize the human responsibility in determining our final destiny

2Pe_3:9  The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.

Other observations on the word Repentance

The word repentance is used in connection with God, as well as with man. When it is used in connection with God, it is usually positive. God never repents to do good for his people. God repents himself from exercising judgment and punishment on his people.

Let’s pray that God will change his mind executing the punishment that we deserve.

Num_23:19  God is not a man, that he should lie; neither the son of man, that he should repent: hath he said, and shall he not do it? or hath he spoken, and shall he not make it good?

1Sa_15:29  And also the Strength of Israel will not lie nor repent: for he is not a man, that he should repent.

Psa_110:4  The LORD hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

Psa_135:14  For the LORD will judge his people, and he will repent himself concerning his servants.

Jer_18:8  If that nation, against whom I have pronounced, turn from their evil, I will repent of the evil that I thought to do unto them.

Satan is the God of this world. He endows his faithful servants with power to promote sin from the top down. In that sense, it is very important to know that sin is not based on grass root strategies; it is a highly organized well-funded push strategy.

Blindness comes from Satan.

Let’s pray in the Name of Jesus and bind Satan’s power, rebuke his authority, and order him to take away his hands off America. Let’s pray that the spiritual veil be torn and people be able to see what’s evident.

2Co_4:4  In whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of them which believe not, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine unto them.

Joh 12:40  He hath blinded their eyes, and hardened their heart; that they should not see with their eyes, nor understand with their heart, and be converted, and I should heal them.

The realization of our sinful nature comes when we get in contact with God the Holy Spirit, and his different manifestations. In that sense, we are also empowered to expose sin because the Holy Spirit dwells in us and we can testify of him through our actions.

Let’s pray that God produces growth in us, and the works of faith that glorify Him “in us” serve as testimony that he lives. Let’s pray that the Holy Spirit be poured over America, so people be able to experience his conviction and turn away from idolatry.

Joh 16:8  And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:

Isa 6:5  Then said I, Woe is me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips: for mine eyes have seen the King, the LORD of hosts.

Luk 5:8  When Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus' knees, saying, Depart from me; for I am a sinful man, O Lord.

Let’s pray that we Christians devote our time reading the Word of God, so he continues the process of sanctification and purification. Let’s pray for zeal for his word, and that God appoints servants with the task of preserving the word of truth so the undiluted message is extended to the next generation.

Joh 17:17  Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.

The realization of our sinful nature comes when we get in contact with God the Holy Spirit, and his different manifestations. In that sense, we are also empowered to expose sin because the Holy Spirit dwells in us and we can testify of him through our actions.

Let’s pray that God produces growth in us, and the works of faith that glorify Him “in us” serve as testimony that he lives. Let’s pray that the Holy Spirit be poured over America, so people be able to experience his conviction and turn away from idolatry.

Luk 5:8  When Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus' knees, saying, Depart from me; for I am a sinful man, O Lord.

Joh 17:17  Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.

Excerpts from the Book of Daniel (Chapter 9):

 “…3 So I turned to the Lord God and pleaded with him in prayer and petition, in fasting, and in sackcloth and ashes.

4 I prayed to the LORD my God and confessed:

“Lord, the great and awesome God, who keeps his covenant of love with those who love him and keep his commandments, 5 we have sinned and done wrong. We have been wicked and have rebelled; we have turned away from your commands and laws. 6 We have not listened to your servants the prophets, who spoke in your name to our kings, our princes and our ancestors, and to all the people of the land.

7 “Lord, you are righteous, but this day we are covered with shame—the people of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem and all Israel, both near and far, in all the countries where you have scattered us because of our unfaithfulness to you. 8 We and our kings, our princes and our ancestors are covered with shame, LORD, because we have sinned against you. 9 The Lord our God is merciful and forgiving, even though we have rebelled against him; 10 we have not obeyed the LORD our God or kept the laws he gave us through his servants the prophets. 11 All Israel has transgressed your law and turned away, refusing to obey you.

“Therefore the curses and sworn judgments written in the Law of Moses, the servant of God, have been poured out on us, because we have sinned against you. 12 You have fulfilled the words spoken against us and against our rulers by bringing on us great disaster. Under the whole heaven nothing has ever been done like what has been done to Jerusalem. 13 Just as it is written in the Law of Moses, all this disaster has come on us, yet we have not sought the favor of the LORD our God by turning from our sins and giving attention to your truth. 14 The LORD did not hesitate to bring the disaster on us, for the LORD our God is righteous in everything he does; yet we have not obeyed him.

15 “Now, Lord our God, who brought your people out of Egypt with a mighty hand and who made for yourself a name that endures to this day, we have sinned, we have done wrong. 16 Lord, in keeping with all your righteous acts, turn away your anger and your wrath from Jerusalem, your city, your holy hill. Our sins and the iniquities of our ancestors have made Jerusalem (America) and your people an object of scorn to all those around us.

17 “Now, our God, hear the prayers and petitions of your servant. For your sake, Lord, look with favor on your desolate sanctuary. 18 Give ear, our God, and hear; open your eyes and see the desolation of the city that bears your Name. We do not make requests of you because we are righteous, but because of your great mercy. 19 Lord, listen! Lord, forgive! Lord, hear and act! For your sake, my God, do not delay, because your city and your people bear your Name. ”

Excerpts from the Book of Ezra (Chapter 9):

After these things had been done, the leaders came to me and said, “The people of Israel, including the priests and the Levites, have not kept themselves separate from the neighboring peoples with their detestable practices, like those of the Canaanites, Hittites, Perizzites, Jebusites, Ammonites, Moabites, Egyptians and Amorites. 2 They have taken some of their daughters as wives for themselves and their sons, and have mingled the holy race with the peoples around them. And the leaders and officials have led the way in this unfaithfulness.”

3 When I heard this, I tore my tunic and cloak, pulled hair from my head and beard and sat down appalled. 4 Then everyone who trembled at the words of the God of Israel gathered around me because of this unfaithfulness of the exiles. And I sat there appalled until the evening sacrifice.

5 Then, at the evening sacrifice, I rose from my self-abasement, with my tunic and cloak torn, and fell on my knees with my hands spread out to the LORD my God 6 and prayed:

“I am too ashamed and disgraced, my God, to lift up my face to you, because our sins are higher than our heads and our guilt has reached to the heavens. 7 From the days of our ancestors until now, our guilt has been great. Because of our sins, we and our kings and our priests have been subjected to the sword and captivity, to pillage and humiliation at the hand of foreign kings, as it is today…

10 “But now, our God, what can we say after this? For we have forsaken the commands 11 you gave through your servants the prophets when you said: ‘The land you are entering to possess is a land polluted by the corruption of its peoples. By their detestable practices they have filled it with their impurity from one end to the other. 12 Therefore, do not give your daughters in marriage to their sons or take their daughters for your sons. Do not seek a treaty of friendship with them at any time, that you may be strong and eat the good things of the land and leave it to your children as an everlasting inheritance.’

13 “What has happened to us is a result of our evil deeds and our great guilt, and yet, our God, you have punished us less than our sins deserved and have given us a remnant like this. 14 Shall we then break your commands again and intermarry with the peoples who commit such detestable practices? Would you not be angry enough with us to destroy us, leaving us no remnant or survivor? 15 LORD, the God of Israel, you are righteous! We are left this day as a remnant. Here we are before you in our guilt, though because of it not one of us can stand in your presence.”

5.  Pray that the Lord will rise up godly pastors (or Church leaders) who will agree to work together to preach and teach on preparing the Church, e.g., to first of all pray and fast for our nation in small and large gatherings (at work during lunch hour, at home, in parks, at church, at social gatherings, etc.) around our nation; asking the Lord to have mercy on America (as we, as Christians confess our sins of idolatry, ambivalence, etc. to Him.  Also, these leaders should teach of the need for the Church to be actively involved in the world (to be the salt and the light of the world).  But, everything - absolutely everything should be focused on love; the Father’s agape love being shown to the world.  “A new command I give you: Love one another. As I have loved you, so you must love one another.  By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you love one another.” (John 13:[masked])

As an example of a godly leader raising the awareness of God’s people to gather together in repentance, is Ezra:

Excerpts from the Book of Ezra (Chapter 10):

“While Ezra was praying and confessing, weeping and throwing himself down before the house of God, a large crowd of Israelites—men, women and children—gathered around him. They too wept bitterly. 2 Then Shekaniah son of Jehiel, one of the descendants of Elam, said to Ezra, “We have been unfaithful to our God by marrying foreign women from the peoples around us. But in spite of this, there is still hope for Israel. 3 Now let us make a covenant before our God to send away all these women and their children, in accordance with the counsel of my lord and of those who fear the commands of our God. Let it be done according to the Law. 4 Rise up; this matter is in your hands. We will support you, so take courage and do it.”

5 So Ezra rose up and put the leading priests and Levites and all Israel under oath to do what had been suggested. And they took the oath. 6 Then Ezra withdrew from before the house of God and went to the room of Jehohanan son of Eliashib. While he was there, he ate no food and drank no water, because he continued to mourn over the unfaithfulness of the exiles.

7 A proclamation was then issued throughout Judah and Jerusalem for all the exiles to assemble in Jerusalem. 8 Anyone who failed to appear within three days would forfeit all his property, in accordance with the decision of the officials and elders, and would himself be expelled from the assembly of the exiles.

9 Within the three days, all the men of Judah and Benjamin had gathered in Jerusalem. And on the twentieth day of the ninth month, all the people were sitting in the square before the house of God, greatly distressed by the occasion and because of the rain. 10 Then Ezra the priest stood up and said to them, “You have been unfaithful; you have married foreign women, adding to Israel’s guilt. 11 Now honor[a] the LORD, the God of your ancestors, and do his will. Separate yourselves from the peoples around you and from your foreign wives.”

12 The whole assembly responded with a loud voice: “You are right! We must do as you say. 13 But there are many people here and it is the rainy season; so we cannot stand outside. Besides, this matter cannot be taken care of in a day or two, because we have sinned greatly in this thing. 14 Let our officials act for the whole assembly. Then let everyone in our towns who has married a foreign woman come at a set time, along with the elders and judges of each town, until the fierce anger of our God in this matter is turned away from us.” 15 Only Jonathan son of Asahel and Jahzeiah son of Tikvah, supported by Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite, opposed this.

16 So the exiles did as was proposed. Ezra the priest selected men who were family heads, one from each family division, and all of them designated by name. On the first day of the tenth month they sat down to investigate the cases, 17 and by the first day of the first month they finished dealing with all the men who had married foreign women.”

Distinguished gay historian and visual artist Jonathan Ned Katz has invited members to see an exhibition of his art at his West Village studio.  Katz will provide refreshments and talk briefly about his art and his work in LGBT history. See jnkArt.com to learn about Katz's artworks and OutHistory.org for his historical work.  Katz's first solo show was curated by noted art historian Jonathan David Katz (no relation) at the Leslie/Lohman Museum of Gay and Lesbian Art, New York City (February 2013).

We will meet at the Stonewall and go over together.  If you're taking the Greenwich Village tour, this would be a great follow-up, but please reserve separately; the event is open to people who are not taking the Greenwich Village walk as well.

The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the fundamental of life energy within. 

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include...


30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

This event is officially hosted by The Rise, NYC. They host morning workouts every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings. See them on meetup here:


http://www.meetup.com/The-Rise-NYC/


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."

results.description:
You guessed it I am from Miami! Let's go to my hometown and vegan it up! We will be staying at the Wakhisi house and spending one or two nights in a hotel on the coast or in the keys.


We will be be visiting different vegan restaurants, farmer's market, BBQing, laughing, cooking, beachin' and just hanging out in the sun!

Cost of trip is down to $690 and it will be 100% vegan!!!! It is literally all inclusive, room stays, food, drank, recreation, rental car, gas you name it! It's covered :D

**Preference given to those who have had accurate RSVPs.

Deposit of $250 due April 20th.

To pay click here to paypal.com. Click send money, and send money to [masked]. You can use a card or your paypal balance to pay.

Questions and answers below:


What?:
I will be accepting 6 folks (preferably 4 women and 2 men for rooming situation but this can be adjusted) to attend my first annual Miami Vegan Getaway! If too many folks are interested Preference will be given to those who have had accurate rsvps and great participation.


Why?: It is very rare that a vegan retreat accommodates a diverse group of folks like us much less black people! Let’s getaway and not have to worry about what to eat!


Where?: We will mostly be staying at Mama Wakhisi’s crib in Miami (Cutler Bay Florida). We have three extra rooms, 5 beds and an air mattress. We have two patios, large back yard, BBQ, and anything else you may need for your comfort! We will spend one or two nights at a resort on the coast or in the keys depending on the deals at the time. When: We will be traveling the Friday August 14th - Tuesday August 18th


Who can come?: Anybody who has attended one of the previous meetups or one of the meetups coming up. Also anybody who loves to get away, be in the sun, and just have a gosh darn good time! All ages welcome :D. We will be cooking too so bring your aprons! Of course you are welcome to do as you please but if you are not vegan it will be politely asked that you stick to vegan food on the trip :D.

Payment Timeline:
RSVP (Non refundable)
$250 deposit to secure your spot by Monday 4/20 Tickets will be purchased Tues 4/21
$200 Due May 15th
$150 Due June 1st (to finish paying Hotel and secure car rental)
$90 Due no later than August 1st

Be sure to fill out this form:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1ci7oC4zO9m6oIKUL_a2hVWijAU76bt2TQeWzy-TUC9g/viewform?usp=send_form
results.name: Miami Getaway in August! $690 All inclusive with Flights

Get ready to learn the best gluten free spots in the city! Finally a fun tour for those of us w/Food Allergies! (Dairy Free options also available) 

More info and tickets here - https://goo.gl/bjuvY2

results.description:
The plan:

We will be hiking slow and steady pace although this is a easy breezy beginner hike. Please note that the trail is rocky and hilly only 3 miles to the lake, a total of 6 miles with a refreshing swim @ lake welch at the halfway point.

What to bring:

Be sure to bring some food, plenty of water, insect repellent, sunglasses, poolbuey, kickboard,  paddles someone please bring a water polo ball.

The weather: 80 degrees

The distance: 6 miles

Meet at the boat launch

(Heals down @ (10:00) is already a late start so no waiting

Note: directions maybe rather Hokey Mcstokey, the meeting place, Sebago boat launch is 2.5 miles North of Reeves medow visitor center.

After the Hike:

We can grab a bite and a drink somewhere in town

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT

results.description:
Futurism NYC is proud to bring you our friend Debra Anderson McGrory. We have observed this documentary from it's inception. A lot of cool panels have been coming out of our Future of Optics panel at Adorama, this is another. Debra and her husband Hugh who was on our Optics panel have been advising and helping us every step of the way.  

Event Description:  

Director Debra Anderson presents a behind the scenes of the making of In\Formation, a two part (25 min) immersive documentary investigating the new medium of virtual reality and creative use of the technology to build empathy and new forms of storytelling. Explored through 3D 360 degree stereoscopic VR, the project documents VR pioneers during the 2015 Tribeca Film Festival through a deep dive into their projects, motivations and speculations. Directed by Debra Anderson and produced by Hugh McGrory, In\Formation is a datavized production, in association with EEVO. It is available for free download or streaming for the Samsung Gear VR powered by Oculus, August 2015

This seminar will be two (2) sessions of ninety (90) minutes each
Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.
Biography:


Debra Anderson is Founder & CSO of datavized, an immersive design studio focused on virtual reality and data visualization. A Producer/Director specialized in digital storytelling and media impact, she builds data-driven and researched based approaches to immersive experiences. Her directorial debut is In\Formation, a two part immersive documentary shot in 360 degree stereoscopic VR. She is a consulting producer on award winning projects at the intersection of VR, journalism, neuroscience and gaming including The Enemy and SoundSelf. Debra founded the innovation consultancy Culture Shock in 2007; presented groundbreaking interactive works with NFB at Sundance New Frontier, Tribeca Storyscapes and curated arts/tech projects at Volta Art Fair NY & Switzerland. She designed and instructs the first Big Data: Consumer Research survey course at The New School for Public Engagement
results.name: SEMINAR: Stepping Inside VR with Debra Anderson

results.description:
Central Park is a three dimensional work of art with the intended effect of “refining and elevating people’s spirits.” Come explore the souther section of the most visited public space in all of the United States and connect your understanding of it with the monuments that define the spaces we cover on this tour.

Itinerary:
• Grand Army Plaza
• Doris Friedman Plaza
• Central Park Zoo
• The Mall
• Bethesda Terrace and Fountain
• Strawberry Fields
• And Much More

Reservations:
Please RSVP. If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:
Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins by the Pulitzer Fountain in front of the Plaza Hotel (between 58th & 59th Sts. and 5th Av.) map here. Tour concludes on Central Park West and 72nd St). map here.

Cost:
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You do not have to pay this. Your guide is compensated with your gratuities. Monetary contributions are collected anonymously at the end. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

Central Park is a landmark to remember. Connect your memory of it to works of art that will be there for time immemorial.

results.name: The Art and Culture of Central Park

results.description:
Classes are created for those with physical disabilities, aliments, recovering from surgery, Seniors OR who are seeking a gentle practice to restore the body and mind.
Classes will include poses and methods that will allow students to increase muscular strength, endurance, flexibility as well as stamina, lung capacity and overall wellness. While experiencing the positive effects Yoga has on the mind-body connection. We will practice our asana's (postures) with the use of a chair. Students can either remain seated through the session or stand and use the back of the chair while standing. Asana's are expressed both ways,so the student can find the expression that works best for their needs.

Postures are modified into variations designed to fit each individuals needs.
Classes will be held in an atmosphere that is extraordinary, surrounded by beautiful stain glass windows inside the actual church. That will complement the tranquility and peace of our practice.These classes have no bearing on religious beliefs and are open to all.
Please join me at The All Saints Episcopal Church 2329 Victory Blvd. Staten Island, N.Y. 10314.

Mondays and Fridays 11:00 am. 

Class fee is $12, or $10 for seniors.
results.name: Chair Yoga Class

results.description:
Director Debra Anderson presents a behind the scenes of the making of In\Formation, a two part (25 min) immersive documentary investigating the new medium of virtual reality and creative use of the technology to build empathy and new forms of storytelling. Explored through 3D 360 degree stereoscopic VR, the project documents VR pioneers during the 2015 Tribeca Film Festival through a deep dive into their projects, motivations and speculations. Directed by Debra Anderson and produced by Hugh McGrory, In\Formation is a datavized production, in association with EEVO. It is available for free download or streaming for the Samsung Gear VR powered by Oculus, August 2015. Joining Debra for a segment of the seminar will be Alejandro Dinsmore, CMO of EEVO.

Alejandro Dinsmore, a young entrepreneur in the VR space, is currently the CMO of EEVO, the premier streaming and distribution platform for high quality virtual reality film. His interests in VR began as a neuroscience major at Vassar College where he worked on an academic review that synthesized the last 10 years of VR research. Alejandro has worked closely with several producers and creators in the VR space and has been involved in many steps of the production pipeline, from concept to distribution. He believes VR film is a new and promising frontier for telling stories and sharing experiences that would not be possible in other mediums.

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Living in a city where one is constantly ‘on’ and looking to do more and more, a workshop that will recharge you and open you up to tap into a practical way to refresh every day, so you can do more of the things you love doing.

at the center

What do you get when you combine a guided tour of the city with a professional photography lesson? Come find out!

 We will put you in the shoes of a professional travel photographer as our pro photographers guide you on a walking tour around New York City. Your guide will ensure you see and photograph the very best NYC has to offer as you explore both the well-known landmarks, and the hidden photo spots around the city. 

 Not only will you see the sights through the eyes of a travel photographer, you'll quickly become one yourself as our local pros teach and guide you on how to achieve postcard-perfect photos at every stop.

Host: Steven R, Bain & Co

Topic: Successfully Navigating the MBB (McKinsey, Bain & BCG) Hiring Process

Friday 14th August. 1-2PM EST. 

Invite with dial in information will be sent directly once you are signed up. 

WELCOME! These new weekly webinars are intended to help students network with consultants at a variety of firms to help boost your networking activity. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------

This Webinar Series Is For You If:

• You are a student at a non-target school, where not many consulting firms recruit – so you have limited networking opportunities

• You are starting to build your consulting network and would like a way to quickly and easily meet consultants from 10 different firms

• You’d like the opportunity to ask all your questions about networking, the recruiting process, interviews, case study prep, your resume and more  directly to experienced consultants

• You’re in a profession other than consulting right now and would like to break into consulting

NOTE: We record every webinar and send out the recording to everyone who attends, so don't worry if you miss it, you'll still get the chance to submit your questions and watch the recording.

For more details or to sign up for the whole series visit: 

https://theconsultantlounge.com/ultimate-consulting-networking-webinars

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

 

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Thank you Tracy for a wonderful start to the day. Amazing calmness capturing everyone's energy on the class. Look forward to attending the next on-line class. Thank you." - B.J

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

FOR DETAILS OF ALL UPCOMING 'MEDITATION 101 LIVE' SESSIONS PLEASE CLICK HERE.

Follow Meditation 101 Live on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.

There's a diversity of high quality art in the streets that surround the infamous Gowanus Canal. This walk highlights the most interesting art studios and spaces, placing them in context with their unique environment. . . a 150 year old industrial waterway inching towards recreational use. Property developers are making moves following the opening of the new Whole Foods Market in the center of the neighborhood, and they utilize art in surprising ways. 

More info and tickets here - https://goo.gl/3q5R9f

results.description:
Invites you to attend a special screening of

HEALING

presented by

Directors Guild of America and The Australian Director's Guild

Incl. Q&A with director Craig Monahan

Starring: Hugo Weaving, Don Hany, Xavier Samuel, Mark Leonard Winter, Anthony Hayes, Jane Menelaus, Tony Martin, Robert Taylor, Justine Clarke,Dimitri Baveas, Laura Brent, Tony Briggs and Richard Stables

Written by Craig Monahan and Alison Nisselle

Directed by Craig Monahan

Friday, August 14

DGA NY Theatre 

110 West 57th Street New York, NY 10010

3 PM

REGISTRATION ESSENTIAL*

Please RSVP to[masked] or  

[masked]


*Please do not to register unless you are reasonably certain that you will attend. Though cancellations are sometimes unavoidable, please let the DGA know by 2pm on August 13 if you are no longer able to attend

FOR MORE EVENTS IN NYC: JOIN OUR NY CHAPTER MAILING LIST

</a> <a href="https://youtu.be/T5HH19nG21Q">

</a>

https://youtu.be/T5HH19nG21Q

ALL THAT YOU ARE SEEKING IS SEEKING YOU

After 18 years in prison, Viktor Khadem has almost given up on life. For his final months, he is sentenced to a low-security facility where officer Matt Perry has established a unique program to heal broken men by giving them responsibility to rehabilitate injured raptors. Against all odds, Matt takes on Viktor as his number one test case and introduces him to Yasmine, a majestic wedge-tailed eagle. If these two can take each other, anything is possible. Inspired by true events, Healing looks at the potential of the system to rehabilitate, to heal. 

<a href="http://www.healingthemovie.com">www.healingthemovie.com


AiF Gratefully Acknowledges Our Generous Supporters

results.description:
Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 4:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
THIS IS YOUR CHANCE OF A LIFETIME

 to see ~100 shooting stars an hour,  Hike down to a series of beautiful waterfalls, have a midnight bonfire and BBQ and go on the wildest adventure !

Hiking at Midnight to the Top of the Mountain ( 1 hour hike) to see a Meteor Shower? Shooting Stars?  Making a Big Bonfire? Waking up the next day and sliding into a WATERFALL?

When in your lifetime are you going to get a chance to do this all in one weekend?  Also, if you even know me a little bit, there will be some fantastic suprises!  All those who went last year liked it so much, we did it twice in one month!  Almost everyone returned!

______________________________________

We did this trip last summer and it was the best trip we have ever done ALL these pictures are actual pictures of Fit and Fun from the last two years of trips.


No OTHER GROUP can put together one EVENT WITH SO MANY OUTDOOR ADVENTURE ACTIVITIES in ONE WEEKEND!

YOU WILL ONLY FIND THIS AT

FIT AND FUN ACTIVE SINGLES!

THE BEST OUTDOOR ADVENTURE SINGLES GROUP IN NYC !


 

 

 

We only have 12 spaces  IN THE

"Woodstock or Bust Hippie Van"

RSVP NOW to Reserve your Seat !

 


Why? CHECK OUT OUR AGENDA

***Midnight Friday, Hike up to the top of a Mountain

Make a BONFIRE, Drink a glass of Wine or Beer, Pina Colada's or Mojito's

and watch shooting stars streak across the sky.  UP TO 100 shooting stars per HOUR***

If you have never ever seen a shooting star, you can only imagine 100 shooting stars per hour! BBQ and Bonfire on the Mountain top at Midnight to go along with the Festivities!

_______________________________________________________

*****Saturday Morning After having a big homemade country breakfast in a great

Saugerties NY restaurant and then we will be hiking

DOWN to the Waterfalls to a secluded and private natural Pool

(commonly known as a Water Hole) and enjoy hiking the nature paths

swimming in the Natural  Fresh water Clean Pool,

ROCK SCRAMBLING....good for beginner, intermediate and EXPERT

THIS IS A ONCE IN A LIFETIME TRIP THAT YOU WILL NEVER FORGET !

There will be many surprises on this trip such as..hmmm maybe i should keep them a secret? Here are some of them :-)

CIA ( CULINARY INSTITUTE of AMERICA) restaurants and Beer and Wine Festivals.

Music Festivals, Celebrities, and more! ALL IN ONE WEEKEND IN THE CATSKILLS.

***************************************************************

LODGING:  $145.00 for two nights Friday and Saturday (That's only $72.50 per night, per person)

 Its a Cabin in the Woods, Two beds per cabin, Hot Shower, Clean new mattresses, Air Conditioning, Etc

..Its not the Trump Towers, so don't expect room service!

Transportation:  $50.00 pp round trip for transportation (Hippie Van, see photo)LOL

to the Catskills (over 100 miles each way)

Leave Manhattan 4:30pm Friday Afternoon and return to Manhattan by 6pm that Sunday

(a location will be determined after all RSVPs have paid in Full)

**********************


What you will need: Please buy a headlamp.  Flashights have to be carried and you might have your hands full.  We bring food, beer wine and other items up to the mountaintop. WE WILL SHOP FOR FOOD WHEN WE ARRIVE IN WOODSTOCK NY. DONT BRING ANY FOOD WITH YOU OTHER THAN FOOD YOU NEED FOR THE 3 Hour Ride to the Catskills!

Low Cut Hiking Boots or really good trail running shoes, and Water/Beach shoes for walking in the river (google ; water beach shoes, they look like fishnet top with rubber bottom), Bug spray, Sun tan lotion, Sun hat, waterproof rain jacket, lightweight clothing, women should bring/wear sports top/sports bra while hiking, it will be 80 degrees at night and you will be carrying your beer, wine and food to the top of the mountain, and bring a bathing suit as it will be 80-85 degrees during the day.

Oh yes, You need a medium sized backpack. NO HARD CASE LUGGAGE, softpacks only!

THIS IS A MODERATE /Tough LEVEL HIKE.

You should get practice HIKING in APRIL, MAY< JUNE AND JULY if you want to make this hike in AUGUST.

IF YOU HAVE an INJURY to your back, neck, ankle...

or...if you are not able to walk up a hill with a backpack for 1 mile,

IF YOU ARE:  Afraid of the dark, obsessed with spiders, cant get along with other quiet relaxed easy going people, like to complain about everything, afraid to adventure into the wilderness at dark, dont like to laugh and have fun, then maybe this trip isn't for you!  :-)   :-)

Hike up to the top of a Mountain, Make a BONFIRE, Drink a glass of Wine or Beer

and watch shooting stars streak across the sky.***

PAYMENT IS DUE when you RSVP.  via paypal.


*********************************************************

1.  ***PAYMENT OF $195.00 is payable via paypal

2.  ***NOTE WELL:  THIS IS A RAIN OR SHINE EVENT.

3.  *** We are going whatever the weather may be: Please read;

We will be going no matter what happens: even if it is very sunny, its raining cats and dogs,  lightning STRIKES your house, Hurricanes, Earthquakes, Government Shutdowns, MTA Strikes, Locust Invasions, You broke one of your nails right after going to the nail salon, your mom didn't wash and dry your dirty socks and underwear, your boyfriend dumped you for your best friend, and so on!  :-)  We are still going!  :-) :-) 

**************************************************************

Hiking, Swimming, Sliding, Jumping, Rock Scrambling,

Shooting Star Gazing and midnight bonfires all in one great Weekend.

LIMITED TO ONLY 14 YES RSVPS ( 12 in the VAN )

Sign up fast, or miss your chance.  Ring or Ride, You Decide.  The bus of adventure will leave with you, or leave without you.

George

results.description:
Our first of visits to places such as comic,art, and book stores to check out the content, art books, comics, magazines, and etc.

How this works is we'll meet at the store and browse around for a bit and then afterwards we will find a nearby venue to chill at with the group and discuss anything interesting we've seen or found at the store, as well as discuss our  art and interests as imaginative illustrators. 

Haven't personally been to this spot before but I heard it has a mixture of books, graphic novels, and magazines that are in English and imported in Japanese. So it sounds very interesting and exciting to check out.

Future places we will check out include Forbidden Planet, Midtown Comics, Barnes and Noble, as well as anywhere else anyone would like to suggest, hope to see you there!

results.description:
What day is today? Why, it's bring the pain Friday! It is once again time for us to ... Dodge. The. Ball.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of dodgeball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game in which players on two teams throw large balls at each other while avoiding being hit themselves. That's it. And no athletic skill is necessary!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using with a few modifications: Dodgeball Rules

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be dodging and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Dodgeball for Grownups (Co-ed)

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!


• Permit Disclosure: We have the permit.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine

(Leader- Ray Ray)

(co-leader- Francisco)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME - 5.45PM!! 

• Game starts at 6pm sharp .

• Rules explained at the game.

• Location: We're playing outdoor at Riverside Park @ 101st street in.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

<a href="http://www.playsoccer2give.com/games/refund-request"></a> If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
I will be inside the Central Park West entrance lobby at 5:30 P.M. with a MEETUP sign. Pay-what-you-wish hours are 6 P.M. to the building's closing at 8 P.M.

We'll be seeing - - -

The Hirschfeld Century: The Art of Al Hirschfeld

Al Hirschfeld (1903–2003) brought a distinct style to celebrity drawings, making his work instantly recognizable —to be “Hirschfelded” was a sign that a performer had arrived. Now for the first time, nine decades of Hirschfeld’s work will be on display at the New-York Historical Society in The Hirschfeld Century: The Art of Al Hirschfeld, a multimedia exhibition organized in partnership with The Al Hirschfeld Foundation and in conjunction with Alfred A. Knopf’s publication of curator David Leopold’s groundbreaking book on the artist. The exhibition of over 100 original works includes many highlights from Hirschfeld’s prolific career with a special emphasis on the New York Times—where he was a contributor for over seven decades. Come see the art that defined New York popular culture and made the 1900s The Hirschfeld Century. We will likely have time left over after going through the Hirschfeld gallery. To see other current exhibitions at the Society, click here:

http://www.nyhistory.org/exhibitions/current-exhibitions
results.name: Visit the New-York Historical Society on Pay-What-You-Wish Friday Evening!

results.description:
For beginners and experienced meditators.

Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Based on traditional Buddhist teachings, it has become an increasingly popular practice, as it generates both concentration and a deep understanding of the nature of our connection to ourselves and others.

This is a drop-in event, and pre-registration is not necessary. We're offering it on a donation basis, and request each participant to contribute between $10 - $20 to support this and other initiatives led by The Interdependence Project. 

Please visit http://theidproject.org/events/2015/06/05/metta-meditation-group for details. 

Please note that our space is not wheelchair accessible and can only be reached by climbing two steep flights of stairs!
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM) Group - Every Friday!
