results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Ticket to Ride and Settlers of Catan are among the oldest) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

Note, we will be sharing a hotel bathroom key, so please do not return it to the bar until the evening is over.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk toward the back of the lobby, we'll be on the raised section on the left.

Let's meet and enjoy some sweet moment after a stressful week! 


We'll meet at Lumpia on 50 Greenwich Ave. to try on their Halo halo and the Filipino-inspired spring rolls. 

http://www.lumpia-shack.com/

We'll then walk to 137 7th Ave South, for the famous Burrata cheese ice cream 

http://dominiqueanselkitchen.com/

Um...around 7pm, we'll walk to Pier 45, Christopher St. to enjoy a Free Jazz performance by Baby Soda Jazz Band and watch the sunset along Hudson River. 

http://www.hudsonriverpark.org/events/baby-soda-jazz-band1

After sunset, if you're still craving for more dessert (like I do), we can check out Francois Payard Bakery for their macaron ice cream sandwish and some French pastry

results.description:
Weather: Hello Guys and Gals! Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.
Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.
results.how_to_find_us: Court number/location will be announced in comments upon arrival.

results.description:
Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer
Between Houston and 1st Street
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation Group

This event is sponsored by The New York Social Network and a dozen of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those registered. There will be over 50 people participating.  If you have any questions please contact the event host Dave Cervini at [masked].

You must pre-pay for this event so we know how many museum passes to get.

Love art? Hate art? Just don't understand art? It doesn't matter, because you're sure to have fun with our MOMA Scavenger Hunt. 


There is no better way to go see this  artwork than with dozens of new friends!  You'll have a chance to team up with others and set out through the halls of the museum looking for clues to answer questions, have picture challenges and be a bit silly.  Along the way you will see artworks from Van Gogh, Monet, Dali, Matisse, Warhol, Pollack and more!

The group will meet at Old Castle Pub for cocktails.  Upon check-in we'll group people together into teams (and have a drink).

What to wear: Most people will be coming from work so business casual.  Following the tour we will gather back at The Old Castle Pub for food and drinks. Nothing too fancy!

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

Time: Registration: 6:pm-6:30pm Each team will have one hour to complete the hunt.

Level: First timers to I do this all the time

Can I come alone?  Yes 95% of those attending will be coming on their own.  We'll team you up with other fun people.

What's included?
- Admission to MOMA
- A fun way to visit the museum

- A unique way to make friends

-Private room rental for registration and after hunt reception

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network

WWW.NEWYORKSOCIALNETWORK.COM

and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP’s below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending. (We have a 3 flakes and you’re out rule). If you have any questions regarding this or any of our events please contact Dave Cervini directly at

[masked]

or call[masked]

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

group.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Cristina Rodríguez

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
Only up to 10 participants per group. We'll have two groups running at the same time.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and John Estrada from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over twelve years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. John is a dynamic instructor from Colombia with a good sense of humor and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues in Colombia and the rest of the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!

results.description:
In this session, we will focus on the other language widely use for Data Science : Python. We will learn how to use the Pandas package to quickly reshape data (join, aggregations, etc) and the machine learning SciKit learn package to generate predictions. We will use our new skills to submit to the Caterpillar Kaggle challenge.

Pierre and Henri (data scientists at Dataiku) will be there to help you with Python and machine learning in general (eg: why gradient boosting trees, why take the log of the target, how to make a clean cross validation scheme, etc ... ). 

PREREQUISITES: you should have some very basic skills in Python. It would be better if you have installed a version of iPython notebook or Jupyter. Please take a look at the challenge topic as well: https://www.kaggle.com/c/caterpillar-tube-pricing 

UPDATE: There is an iPython notebook which we will use during the session at:

http://www.dataiku.com/blog/2015/08/05/iPython_Kaggle.html


Please have a look at it before arriving to the session.
results.name: Work on a Kaggle challenge:  Caterpillar

results.description:
Getting honest answers about what's actually in our food isn't always easy. As a result, most of the time we have little information about what's in our food, and when we do have the information, we don't have the education to be able to actually interpret it. 

This class is about everything you ever wanted to know about how to read nutrition labels and make healthier food choices. We will walk you though the questions to consider when you are food shopping so that you know you are making healthy choices, rather than just guessing or being influenced by words that sound healthy. 

We will go into depth about: 

- the most important factors to consider when making food choices 
- healthy sugars
- how to determine the best juices 
- recipes
- what ingredients to stay away from 
- what labels are meaningless and which ones to pay attention to 

Contact with any questions. Looking forward to seeing you there!
results.name: How to Read Nutritional Labels 101

If you’ve ever been curious about what’s really going on in Harlem after dark, this is the walking tour for you!

INCLUDED: A great night out in Harlem with someone who is part of the uptown scene. You'll visit 3 hidden jazz haunts for hours of live music. Along the way you'll make stops throughout the tour to see and hear about Harlem's storied past and current scene. Music charges at 3 clubs, and transportation charges are included.

HISTORY: You'll learn about the Apollo, Cotton Club, Savoy Ballroom and Minton's Playhouse, which all played pivotal roles in the development of jazz and brought the world's attention to Harlem during the Prohibition Era and beyond.

AUTHENTIC: Your jazz guide knows all the neighborhood's most intimate juke joints (i.e. local hang outs), and will share the insider’s view with you. You'll relax and enjoy the scene at at least two clubs, (but most tours visit three), for a great variety of swinging live jazz while avoiding the tourist traps. INTIMATE: To get the authentic feel for the neighborhood, this is a subway/taxi/walking tour that is limited to the first 8 people to sign up (exceptions can sometimes be made).

TAILORED ITINERARY: Your jazz guide will be checking around to put together the best tour for each given night, based on the most talented performers that night in Harlem's Best Clubs -- among them:

Tickets: https://goo.gl/QIocV8
20% Off: HISUMMER

Finding right roommates and right brokers are very important and as hard as finding great apartments. 

Do you like looking for roommates, brokers and apartments only online? Nowadays, it's easy to search online but can you trust them?

If you think you just keep on looking at fake advertisements, don't waste your time and just come join in this event!

- Looking for roommates or subtenants instantly and efficiently

- Looking for renters (Yes! Brokers are welcome too :)

- Sharing any information regarding renting apartments in NYC

                                                     or.....


Living with strangers is a bit awkward, but let's drink together and get along first!

Taking influences from European and African roots, the movement is a synthesis of Contemporary dance, Hip hop culture and African rhythms. 

https://d3mjyf8rb023qs.cloudfront.net/api/file/BYMUIQ9zTd6MKyD13qfG

Each class will be explored in depth to enhance and develop the dancers fluidity, physical awareness and a true passion to perform. 

The work will allow you to improve creative and technical skills with live rhythmic music ; performing exuberant floorwork through to vigorous dance movements, ensuring that the dancers leave a signature spatial mark.

Poundo’s class encourages dancers to approach the movement with technique, fluidity, risk, weight, respiration and athleticism. While pushing the boundaries of the body, we’ll be using the technique paths to explore new ways to move through emotional and organic intentions. 

Tickets: https://goo.gl/KdwPdr 
20% Off Code: HISUMMER

results.description:
Friday Japanese/English Language Exchange

Join us for 2 hours every “Friday Japanese / English Language Exchange!" In this event, you will get to learn about English and Japanese as well as socialize with other members! If you would like to practice and learn more English and Japanese, then this is your event!

毎週金曜日２時間実施される金曜日、英語日本語語学交流会にぜひお越し下さい！イベントでは日本語と英語を学ぶことはもちろんのこと、他のメンバーさんとの交流も楽しんで頂けます。

 

<strong style="font-size : medium">Details:

Lessons: Varying levels of Japanese and English lessons are given at multiple stations, focusing on aspects such as grammar, listening, and conversation.

Language Exchange: After the lessons, we have a free exchange for people in both languages.

詳細:

レッスン：文法、リッスニング、会話などに焦点をおいた日本語、英語のそれぞれのレベルに合わせたレッスンが受講できます。

語学交流会： レッスン後、両語学による自由な交流会をになります。

Time:

Every Friday, from 6:45pm to 8:45pm

Entrance fee: $5.00

 

<strong style="font-size : medium">Location:

Chelsea Studios

151 West 26th Street 6th Floor New York, NY 10001

Ask for Chelsea Studios!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

If you arrive before 6:30pm, please wait downstairs. An organizer will be waiting with a sign and will bring you to the classroom when we are ready. If you arrive after 6:45pm, check in with the guard, and remember to bring a form of ID. Go to the 6th floor and look for us there!

Don't forget to bring a notebook!

Here are some pictures from our latest session!

 

 

Thank you!

Japan Cultural Appreciation Group・日本文化友会

Contact / お問い合わせ先: [masked]

Website / ウェブサイト:

http://www.jcagny.org


Follow us on Facebook:

http://www.facebook.com/groups/317147851698725/

***         Late Summer Harvest with Arlene Ward         ***

It's almost over, and there is so much you still can cook.  This menu reflects on some simple and easy to do dishes that depend on garden fresh ingredients.  The market is full of beautiful choices for preparing a meal for company or family!  It's time now to try a few newer and lighter selections! 

Full Participation:  $75.00 each ~ We'll learn how to cook and prepare the menu below for 1-2 hrs ~ Afterwards we'll sit and enjoy the meal together! Feel Free to BYOB to enjoy while we cook ;) and eat :)


                      ********        Menu        ********


• Saute of Sausage and Peppers in Red Wine

• Parsley and Basil Pesto with Green Beans, Potato, and Trofie Pasta

• Skewered Mixed Grill Swordfish, Shrimp and Halibut

• Shucked Sweet Corn and Tarragon

• Roasted Eggplant and Cherry Tomatoes on Grilled Bruschetta

• Cauliflower and Olive Salad

Plum and Rhubarb Tart

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No Permit but field is usually available for us at this time.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- JJ)

(Co-Leader- David Toro)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

results.description:
Beginners' Workshop begins at 6:30 pm. Live music! Great energy! Great friends!

Contra Dance is a traditional American folk dance which requires no prior dance training or experience—if you can walk, you can Contra Dance.  Traditional Contra Dancing is done with "Ladies and Gents" but at Gender Role-Free Dances we dance whichever role we like and with whomever we like!  Our monthly dances are open to everyone, regardless of sexual orientation, gender expression, dance experience and number of left feet. It's great fun and great exercise!


Our caller for August will be Sue Gola and the band is Off‘n Ensemble.


Join us after the dance for socializing at the Village Den around the corner at 11th St. and Greenwich Ave.

For more information, check out our new website: www.villagecontra.org or our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/villagecontra/

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!


• Permit Disclosure: We have the permit.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine

(Leader- Ray Ray)

(co-leader- Francisco)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME - 5.45PM!! 

• Game starts at 6pm sharp .

• Rules explained at the game.

• Location: We're playing outdoor at Riverside Park @ 101st street in.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

results.description:
NYSC Open Circle

At:  208 W 29th St Rm 201, New York, NY
(between Seventh & Eighth Avenues)

Come and join our shamanic community in a sacred celebration of Spirit. Learn the basic techniques of core shamanism as you journey to meet your Spirit Guides and Power Animals. Deepen your shamanic practice through drumming, chanting, and movement at our monthly Shamanic Circle.

Please bring a drum or a rattle, a pen & notepad, and a bandanna. You may want to bring a pillow, blanket to use when we journey.

Suggested donation $20


By subway take: N, R, Q, to 34th Street station or #6, & #1 to 28th Street station.

*****************************************************************


The core NYSC group has been practicing healing and journeying work every week since 1997. We work and study with a wide range of powerful indigenous and Western shamans from around the world.

NYSC MISSION

NYSC promotes and supports a shamanic community in New York City. Through our regular gatherings and workshops with shamans from around the world, NYSC seeks to promote earth-honoring living in ways that foster environmental, social and spiritual balance.

Looking ahead, our vision is to establish the New York Shamanic Center, the home for all of NYSC's events, activities and gatherings, including an Annual New York Shamanic Film Festival.
results.how_to_find_us: www.nyshamaniccircle.org
results.name: Shamanic Open Circle and celebration of Spirit

Tickets Here! https://goo.gl/BsyYks

Have you ever wanted to create a painting on Canvas but lack the know how or tools to do so? This class is for you, Picasso! Each new artist is walked through, step by step a pre-selected painting. Each artist receives a 16x20 canvas and all supplies and materials. Everyone is encouraged to add their own spark to their painting!

I patiently help all of our artists as we break down each selected painting to make it easier for everyone to achieve results. All beginning artists are able to leave the day of the class with their very own paintings. Hang it on your wall, give it to a friend or make it a special gift - the choice is yours! Small snacks, beverages, wine and/or beer are welcomed during our classes. Lets have fun and get creative!

Tickets: https://goo.gl/nK6dKC

20% Off Code: HISUMMER

This class will open your taste buds to the many types of beer out there, peeling back the myth that it is only for frat boys and sports fans! From fruity, juice-like lambics to citrus flavored sours to golden lagers, beer isn't just a fizzy, somewhat bitter adult beverage. With more variety than wine and a broader range of flavors, you'll be surprised to learn that YOU may be a beer lover after all! Each class is 1 hour and we personally tailor your flight (4 tastings) to what you like to eat/drink. We will also buy you a pint of your choice! This interactive class is perfect for date nights, beer lovers and novices alike, bartenders, and anyone (over 21)! By the time you leave, you'll have discovered a new type of beer unlike anything you've ever tasted! Tickets: https://goo.gl/nK6dKC

20% Off Code: HISUMMER

results.description:
French Canadian thriller directed by Xavier Dolan.  

After the sudden death of his lover, Guillaume, Tom (Dolan) travels from his home in the city to a remote country farm for the funeral. Upon arriving, he’s shocked to find that Guillaume's family knows nothing about him and was expecting a woman in his place. Torn between his own grief and that of the family, Tom keeps his identity a secret but soon finds himself increasingly drawn into a twisted, sexually-charged game by Guillaume’s aggressive brother, who suspects the truth. 

First three members who RSVP will receive a pair of tickets to Tom at the Farm, courtesy of Amplify Releasing, longtime supporters of my meetups.  Theatrical run begins August 14.  Date above may be incorrect.

results.description:
Thank you to everyone who came to our last Game Night!  It was heaps of fun and conquest!   :)

We hope you join us on our next Game Night for a chance to meet tons of new people, play some great games, and drink a few beers. And make sure to invite your friends! We'll have Jamaican/Caribbean dominoes as well. This is one of our favorite strategy games and we would love to share it with the experienced and inexperienced alike.

In addition to dominoes, we will have Settlers of Catan, King of Tokyo, BANG!, Cards Against Humanity, and others. If you'd like to bring your own games, there will be lots of people who like to learn new games.  And again, all are welcome!

Also make sure to bring some cash for a donation.  Though donations are not required, if you are able to donate we suggest $5 for gaming and $5-10 if you're drinking and gaming. Organizing this is 100% volunteer and all the money goes to this MU page, refreshments, and renting the space.  

We do not provide food, but there are lots of take-out and delivery options nearby.

See you there!!

results.description:
It's been 3 years since the old gang fought the Five Animals, The Time Beast, and rescued Hermel's sister and Yellow Clay Village from Black Patch's Brigands.   They've spent their time happily farming and raising families, selling umbrellas, starting the Rockafella Sulfur mine outside of town, and enjoying the growing prosperity of Yellow Clay.

But as always, things change.  The growing prosperity has come at a cost.  The peaceful rural life that Hermel so loved has been increasingly disrupted by strangers bringing brawls, theft, and now perhaps even murder.  The town council has been unable to stem the tide of troubles, even as the Treasury's coffers have been filling up with gold.   The Rockafella Sulfur Mine seems to have become both a blessing and a curse to the town.

Furthermore recently rumors have it that strange sounds (howlings?) are being heard at night from across the Wild Moors to the west.  Worse yet, several children have vanished in the dead of night ... whisked away from their beds while their hard working parents slept.  A crowd gathers at the Emergency Meeting of Town Council eager to hear what is to be done!

Elthos RPG is an experimental RPG utilizing light-weight mechanics for fast story-oriented play.  We have a couple of open seats for new Players.  The previous Game Test Stories will give you some idea of the nature of the Elthos World, and what kind of adventures one might expect in it.  You're welcome to join in the fun while seats remain open.  To inquire just send me an email and I'll respond asap!

:) Mark
results.why: Its fun!  Especially if you like light weight systems with an emphasis on story, but plenty of tactical elements to make the whole thing a great game.
results.name: Elthos RPG (Experimental) - Yellow Clay Village Campaign

results.description:
Hey all. Hope everyone is having a good summer so far. I actually nearly missed out on all the Restaurant Week goodness! For the last day of it, we'll be going to Haru Sushi, a renowed Japanese place! More info here:

http://www.harusushi.com/


PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS PLACE HAS SEVERAL LOCATIONS. WE WILL BE AT THE ONE NEAR UNION SQUARE. If you've never done Restaurant Week, it basically operates like this: It's now $38 for dinner, which does NOT include tax and tip (some people think tip and tax is included)  However, for that $38, you have to select items from a special pre-fixe menu specifically for Restaurant Week. If you want something that is not listed on the Restaurant Week menu, you will be charged a la carte and it could cost more. You will get three or four courses-soup or salad, an appetizer, an entree and a dessert for that $38. The purpose of Restaurant Week is so that you get to try out places you may not ordinarily go to and the establishment increases their business, so it's a win, win. 

Please only RSVP if you are sure you can go. Everyone will be responsible for their own expenses. Hope to see you there!
results.how_to_find_us: By the bar!

We focus on short, challenging poses, ranging from 30 seconds to 5 minutes (plus a few 10-minute poses). This is to help artists of all levels to focus on the gesture behind the pose. Artists must bring their own materials: charcoal, pens, watercolors, gouache, pencils, and newsprint or sketch pads are ideal, but feel free to experiment with any media you wish to bring!

Spoke the Hub @ Gowanus Arts Building

295 Douglass Street (at 3rd Ave.)

Studio B, Third Floor

Buzzer 5 or 6

Brooklyn NY 11217

Closest subway is the R at Union Street. Atlantic/Barclays Center is 15 minutes walking distance.

Ring the buzzer and we'll let you in. Go to the back of the hall and up the stairs to the third floor.

See you soon and happy drawing!

Have you ever wanted to create a painting on Canvas but lack the know how or tools to do so? This class is for you, Picasso! Each new artist is walked through, step by step a pre-selected painting. Each artist receives a 16x20 canvas and all supplies and materials. Everyone is encouraged to add their own spark to their painting!

I patiently help all of our artists as we break down each selected painting to make it easier for everyone to achieve results. All beginning artists are able to leave the day of the class with their very own paintings. Hang it on your wall, give it to a friend or make it a special gift - the choice is yours! Small snacks, beverages, wine and/or beer are welcomed during our classes. Lets have fun and get creative!

results.description:
Aligning Subconscious Beliefs With Conscious Desires: Video and Dr. Jay Kantor

If there is a conflict between your conscious desires and subconscious beliefs, guess which aspect of the mind wins?

You have probably already experienced the answer to this question - the subconscious mind certainly can prevent you from obtaining what you say you want.

So then, how do we get the cooperation of the subconscious mind? How can we talk to it and be certain that we're being heard?

Tonight’s program is an introduction to Psych-K (Psychological Kinesiology) which is a means for altering subconscious beliefs to support the attainment of our conscious desires.  We will watch Rob Williams introduction to Psych-K, including his demonstration of one of the processes used to balance the mind.

Join us Friday, Aug. 14, for this informative program which will start at 7:30PM.
results.name: Aligning Subconscious Beliefs With Conscious Desires: Video and Dr. Jay Kantor

Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

Because of the demand, I have also scheduled this walk on Saturday, September 5th. I probably will schedule it a third time.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John, who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photo. Thank you again.

Description: The Temperance Movement in the 19th Century was the roots of Prohibition in the 1920s and early 1930s.

By 1830, the average American consumed nearly three times as much alcohol as we drink today and alcohol abuse (primarily by men) was wrecking havoc on some families. The Temperance Movement, which had many women in its ranks, first urged the moderation of alcohol  and then ultimately complete prohibition of alcohol. Later during Prohibition, the manufacture, transportation and sale of alcohol was illegal; however, there were many "side effects" of Prohibition, including the many speakeasies (illegal drinking spots) that popped up. These speakeasies had unmarked doors that led to "intoxication rooms" with velvety interiors. Mayor Fiorello LaGuardia, a NYC mayor in the 1930s and 1940s, once said, "It is impossible to tell whether Prohibition is a good or bad thing. It has never been enforced in this country."

On this walking tour, we will look at some of the symbols of the Temperance Movement in the 19th Century as well as talk about Prohibition speakeasies and the rise and fall of Prohibition in the 1920s and early 1930s. We'll stop outside of four or five faux speakeasies. If we can, we will go inside two or three of these faux speakeasies, including one site that was an actual speakeasy during Prohibition.

This is a walking tour with much commentary. We'll be walking about 2 1/2 miles. There will be plenty of stopping at points of interest. If you don't like a lot of stopping, then this type of walk is not good for you. The tour lasts about 2 1/4 hours.

Below is an old photo of a slogan for the Temperance movement in the late 19th century. This photograph was taken in Thomas Edison's movie studio at West Orange, NJ. (Source US  Interior Dept., Nat'l Park Service, Thomas Edison Nat'l Historic Site)

Below is an article from The New York Times, August 26, 1887. This was about a Prohibition camp meeting in the Village of Sing Sing.

(Source MCNY [Nathanial Currier & James Merritt Ives ,1874])


Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.


Meeting Time: The meeting time is (after dinner) at 7:15 PM.

Meeting Place: The meeting place is outside of the entrance to Barnes & Noble Bookstore at 33 East 17th Street, which is between Park Avenue South and Broadway. Before the walk, restrooms are available in Barnes & Noble.

Below is outside of the entrance to Barnes & Noble Bookstore at 33 East 17th Street.

Transportation: Take the 4, 5, 6, L, N, Q, or R subway train to 14th Street and Union Square and then walk north to Barnes & Nobles.

Finishing Time/Place: This walk will finish about 9:50 PM at Norfolk Street and Delancey Street on the Lower East Side.

Rainy weather cancels this walk. Therefore, if it is raining, or the forecast is for rainy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice Friday. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

These were Prohibition agents dumping alcohol in the street during Prohibition. (Source The New York Daily News, circa 1920s)

These were children scrambling to scour up alcohol in the street after it was dumped by Prohibition agents during Prohibition. (Source New York Daily News, circa 1920s)

This was Old Man Prohibition hung in effigy from a flagpole as New York City celebrated the end of Prohibition with the repeal of the 18th Amendment. (Source NYPL [Irma and Paul Milstein Division, 1933])
results.name: History of the Temperance Movement and Prohibition - Walking Tour (August 14)

Come join this wonderful on going FRIDAY EVENING co-ed (men and women) Yoga Class 7:15-8:15pm.  This is an adult yoga class for all ages and levels (if interested in children's yoga, please contact me).  Beginners are welcome and encouraged to join.  NO gym membership required.  Reiki is part of the entire class, however specifically given to each person during the quiet beginning of the class (meditation and centering) and at the end of the class during Savasana (the final pose). Each person receives Reiki during the entire class.  If you have a mat, you can bring it.  If you do not have a mat, I have some to share.  Please visit

www.CliftonYogaNJ.com

for more information or you can email through this meetup group or at [masked]. Text or call (email and text are fastest) directly (862) 621-9642.


Your first class is $10.  Future classes are sold in groups of 4 classes for $40 (still $10 per class).  NO gym membership required.  If you miss a class, you do NOT lose the class- it just stays in your account for future use :) but expires one year from purchase.  This is a wonderful class that builds upon your connection to your inner voice, connects you to your inner wisdom and divine consciousness.  You will build strength, flexibility and peace of mind... come join our group! :)

results.description:
Join a bunch of singles from multiple meetup groups as we casually stroll along the Coney Island Boardwalk. 

After the walk, we'll catch the fireworks at 9:30 and then go grab a bite and/or some drinks. 

Check out the photos from previous Date Walks. We always have a great time and you will meet a lot of people!  

We'll meet at 7:30 PM in front of Nathan's Hot Dogs in Coney Island

The walk will start at EXACTLY 8 PM. If you are late, you will miss us. Do not be late.

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing in front of Nathan's Hot Dogs in Coney Island then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. You can call me if you want at [masked] 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend / non-awkward + the host, Beau is always there to make introductions. It’s really easy to meet people. 

Closest Subway: D, F, N, Q to Coney Island

Pace: The pace of this walk will be super casual.

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date.

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer

• Discover the Secret of God’s Love

results.description:
The Place:

Located in NY's East Village, GG's is a neighborhood restaurant at its core, helmed by a partnership devoted to an exceptional food, beverage, and hospitality experience.

GG's takes New York style pizza, from a classic deck oven, to a full dining experience.

Menu is here:

http://static1.squarespace.com/static/53dfebaee4b0f2394fee0a6f/t/5543bd67e4b08ca26f754513/1430502788828/gg-web+dinner+0501.pdf


As always:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

Every Friday we have a causal gathering of open minded souls, who
want to learn from Bhagavad Gita, the Vedic wisdom, and incorporate
in to their life. We will be learning various fascinating topics
like karma and reincarnation, Who am I, What is the real purpose
of life? Who god is? material life, Consciousness, etc.

Mantra meditation is the process of bhakti yoga consisting of
hearing and chanting the names of the lord on the beads, followed by
melodious music to invoke lord's mercy. This practice has a powerful
heart opening effect, which can be best understood through direct
experience. Come, relax in a warm and friendly atmosphere. Listen/observe
or just chant with us or sing your heart out! Questions, personal
realization, and discussion about the application of spiritual
practice are welcome.

Free Home made vegetarian/vegan dinner
(prasadam) served.

Admission to each meetup is free.
Donations for meetups expenses are welcome.

1. Please RSVP. Location given on the phone.

Tickets: https://goo.gl/DGDK3J 
20% Off Code: HISUMMER

What is hoop-dance? 
Hoop-dance is a growing movement practice merging play, dance, fitness and creative expression. This unique form of movement meditation and dance develops balance, grace, strength and flexibility. Research shows it can be effective in integrating right- and left-brain functioning, relieving stress and anxiety, and encouraging growth of new neural pathways. 

Class Description: 
Fridays 7:30-8:30pm 
5 Week Course

https://d3mjyf8rb023qs.cloudfront.net/api/file/JOahYEdMQ2KK2zGH48rZ

Tickets: https://goo.gl/DGDK3J 
20% Off Code: HISUMMER

This class will increase your energy while strengthening and toning the entire body. You will learn various arm and body hoop-dance tricks and how to tie them together into creative routines - all the while burning calories and increasing flexibility. The flow of movements made with the hoop allows our mind and body to become better connected. It allows us to increase our awareness and generate an appreciation for the body and its capabilities. Set in a sunlit studio and surrounded by tunes you've requested, you will leave class feeling invigorated and stress free! All levels.
results.name: Learn to Hoop-Dance!

You will learn various arm and body hoop-dance tricks and how to tie them together into creative routines - all the while burning calories and increasing flexibility. What is hoop-dance? 
Hoop-dance is a growing movement practice merging play, dance, fitness and creative expression. This unique form of movement meditation and dance develops balance, grace, strength and flexibility. Research shows it can be effective in integrating right- and left-brain functioning, relieving stress and anxiety, and encouraging growth of new neural pathways.

results.description:
Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ!  We, some members of the church body, have set up this Bible study event to help bring the Gospel light into the lives of people. That is the reason why some Mennonites families left peaceful lives in PA and moved into NY. We have Bible study 1 to 2 times a month and prayer meetings 2 times a month, all scheduled on Fridays. We appreciate when you show up on time as we  always have a short prayer at the beginning of our meeting and then we  read together from the gospel of John.  Then we study into many details, answering questions, pulling parallel verses from all the Bible, and discussing meanings.  We like to make applications to the scriptures that are practical for our lives today.  At the end we have a closing prayer and time to get to know each other better. The event is absolutely free and we do not anticipate any donations or anything like that. Please reserve your place ASAP if you are planning to attend. The space is limited.

Here is a sample of some of our study materials. It published in "Files" under "More"  http://www.meetup.com/Brooklyn-Prayer-Bible-Study-Meetup/files/ 


In Christian love,

     Tim

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing in front of Nathan's Hot Dogs in Coney Island then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. You can call me if you want at[masked] 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend / non-awkward + the host, Beau is always there to make introductions. It’s really easy to meet people.

Pace: The pace of this walk will be super casual.

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date.

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 


Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

results.description:
Open level class. Any level student can practice, taking the postures to a more challenging experience. Beginners are welcome, postures can always be modified to suit the individual. As always, listen to your body, take the postures to were it feels right for you and have fun! This class builds upon Basic  yoga postures, continuing our growth. Students always have the option to take this class where they desire... from a basic level and build foundation or to more challenging postures and flow techniques. It all depends on the individual and what their body needs ! Its an open field  for exploration and discovery.

 Breathing techniques focused upon during practice to connect the body and mind with the breath. Power Yoga builds muscle strength from the core outward, tones the body, creates endurance and stamina. Great for over all health. Breathing techniques calm the mind and ground the self.

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and  guided meditation after class going deeper into chakra balancing.
results.name: Yoga - Open Class

results.description:
NOTE!   Friday August 14th, I'll be eating dinner at Gila's Nosh at 6 pm.  (1 block from Reflections).  Join me before Connection Lab/Games Night for delicious family style meal!!!

---

Are you craving deeper connections in your life?

Do you want to experience more awareness/presence in your day to day life ?

Do you ever have the feeling that you could be enjoying richer more authentic interactions with people?

Sometimes creating profound connection is as easy as looking just beneath the surface with whoever we are with, at any given time and simply being more present with what actually is.

Join us at Reflections Yoga for social games that invite us beneath the surface and into a deeper experience of ourselves and others.

Authenticity Games are a fun, highly-interactive partner and group exercise that explore ways of seeing, connecting, appreciating yourself and others at a deeper level. They are a safe and structured way for us to go beyond small talk and beyond superficial appearances.

It’s an opportunity for us to have fun and celebrate with great people who are also wanting to explore what’s possible in connection.

Join us for some fun relational games, socializing, and snacks

Bring a friend, or come alone and meet some awesome new people.

When we celebrate and explore what makes each of us unique, we often end up realizing just how much we all have in common.

Games Night begins at 7:30 pm and will wrap up around 10:15 pm - we generally visit, eat, socialize, do acro-yoga, and hang out in cuddle-piles after the games wrap up. Hope you'll plan on lingering with us.

TO PAY IN ADVANCE: http://relatinggames.eventbrite.com/

Payment:
$30 at the door
$25 in advance Reflections Yoga
227 East 24th Street
between 3rd and 2nd

(NOTE - the address for Reflections on Google Maps and Reflections' mobile site have not been updated to indicate the NEW location on East 24th Street)


For updates on authentic relating events in New York, join our Meetup or Facebook groups

http://www.meetup.com/Authentic-Relating-NY

https://www.facebook.com/groups/authenticrelatingnyc/

For more information on games nights, visit www.authenticworld.org/games-night.

Every Friday we have a causal gathering of open minded souls, who want to learn from Bhagavad Gita, the Vedic wisdom, and incorporate in to their life. We will be learning various fascinating topics like karma and reincarnation, Who am I, What is the real purpose of life? Who god is? material life, Consciousness, etc.
Mantra meditation is the process of bhakti yoga consisting of hearing and chanting the names of the lord on the beads, followed by melodious music to invoke lord's mercy. This practice has a powerful heart opening effect, which can be best understood through direct experience.
Come, relax in a warm and friendly atmosphere. Listen/observe or just chant with us or sing your heart out! Questions, personal realization, and discussion about the application of spiritual practice are welcome. 
Free Home made vegetarian/vegan dinner (prasadam) served

Admission to each meetup is free. Donations for meetups expenses are welcome.

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Friday evenings in Long Island, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and a systematic study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanskrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that finished by around 8:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and twenty minutes.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 9:20, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about twenty minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Suggested Donation to attend each meetup is at least $5.

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities litigation.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

Join a fun group of NYSN members and friends as we take a step back in time in one of NYC's most exclusive nightspots; The Carnegie Club.  The Carnegie Club is a magnificent space that's both grand (25-foot ceilings with a mezzanine) and intimate. It provides a uniquely Gothic backdrop with a hand carved 18th century bookcases filled with a wide assortment of leather-bound titles and a stone fireplace all of which is offset by plush, contemporary  furnishings. Offering an elegant and stylish atmosphere.  We will have a special section reserved for our group for socializing then great live music from Barry Bryson and the Stan Rubin Quartet.  The Carnegie Club is also one of the select few clubs in NYC that you can still enjoy legal tobacco in.  What to expect:

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$

If you wish to join you will need to prepay as spaces are limited.  Please use this link: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cigars-cocktails-live-jazz-tickets-18105759815

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$

-About a dozen members and friends casually gathering for cocktails and conversation.

-Some will smoke cigars, (other legal tobaccos okay too) . Carnegie is well ventilated.

-Food is available

-You will be responsible for only your food and drinks on separate checks. 2 drink minimum.

-You may bring your own cigars, no cutting fee.

-The $10 includes music and reservation charge only.

Dress: Business casual/lounge

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will come on their own

What if I don't smoke and just want to enjoy the music? Not a problem

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
The New York Times declares The Imbible is "the best Fringe deal!" 
"Remarkably compelling!" raves Time Out New York! Four Stars and Critics' Pick! 
The Huffington Post proclaims The Imbible is "an absolute must-see!" 

Tickets: https://goo.gl/0l3OCt 
20% Off Code: HISUMMER

https://d3mjyf8rb023qs.cloudfront.net/api/file/mpLMr3MSp2M4sqoEPOtw

The drinks are on us as you join world-renowned mixologist and raconteur Anthony Caporale for a boozy romp through the history of spirits and cocktails in this critically-acclaimed new play with drinks and music. 

Combining Anthony's encyclopedic knowledge of beverage history and decades of bartending experience with his legendary skills as a storyteller and entertainer, The Imbible treats audiences to a completely original and thoroughly enjoyable evening of theatre. 

Playing in an authentic New York speakeasy that was actually used as a meeting place by the notorious Tammany Society, The Imbible sweeps audiences along a 10,000-year journey through history and across the globe accompanied by craft cocktails and the vocal stylings of The Backwaiters acapella group! 

Sit back and enjoy the music and drinks while Anthony holds forth on the history and science behind alcoholic beverages, traces their economic and political impact on our cultural development, conducts live demonstrations of brewing beer and distilling spirits, guides the audience through cocktail tastings, and - like any good bartender - keeps his guests laughing throughout the night. 

3 craft cocktails are included. 

Tickets: https://goo.gl/0l3OCt 
20% Off Code: HISUMMER
results.name: Mixology Comedy Show (Free Drinks)

group.name: BEST CLUBS in NYC - FREE DRINKS every night!

results.description:
RSVPs open 3 days prior to event. PAYPAL payment required to RSVP.

Friday Night Meetups begin at 8pm and end at 10:30

This evening is for Beginners-to-Intermediate. Perfect for folks new to the group. RSVPS open at 12:30 noon on Tuesdays! 

Come out, get a great workout and make new friends!!

NEW NEW NEW NEW !!!!!

-On serves only one REDO will be granted per player per game on first serve. (Can hit any obstacle (except lighting) and ball cannot be going out of bounds on sides) After a successful serve(s), no redos! (Beneficial to players waiting to sub in)

- NO REDOS on ceiling obstacles only on WIRE (less arguing, will speed up games)

-If each team fouls they both will cancel each other and a redo will be played immediately 

-No Net touches top or bottom (For Safety of all players)
results.how_to_find_us: Wooden door outside and to the right of the main lobby entrance.
results.name: Friday Beginner/Intermediate Volleyball

results.description:
Description:

Bachateame Mama is the biggest regular Bachata Night in the Tri-State Area! Every Friday of the month !

RSVP and prices: You must RSVP on Meetup before 4 pm on the day of the event. and Mention Salsa New York at the door for the reduced admission

General admission $12

Salsa New York Member: $8 for ladies and $10 for gentlemen


8.30 to 9.15pm: Bachata Lesson

9.15pm: Dj Alejandro will be playing Bachata and some Salsa, Merengue and other latin Rhythm !!
results.name: NEW !! Bachateame Mama ( Bachata Night)

results.description:
Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every week we go to someone's apt, park, or bar.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee 

[masked]
results.name: Drinking With Atheists (DWA) Friday Weekly Meetup

results.description:
Life Bliss Meditation Weekend Program

"Nithya Kriya Yoga"

Complete with your Past and Rewrite Your Future

A Weekend Meditation Program Conducted by Living Enlightened Master Paramahamsa Nithyananda

Want to go beyond your current limitations? 

Whatever you want in life,...Health, Success or even Enlightenment...you can get it only when you treat the entire being – not just parts of you. You need a way to understand all the dimensions of human existence, clean all the layers that hide the true you, and find every corner where limitations can hide!

Here’s some good news…

There is a BRAND NEW meditation program personally conducted by H.H. Paramahamsa Nithyananda! In this workshop, he will reveal:

• Five (5) layers or Koshas or human existence • 5 compelling sessions to peel away layers of your false & self-limiting beliefs.

• How to realize the true joy, fulfillment, and potential you have inside

• Experience powerful healing and completion as Nithyananda takes you on a step-by-step journey through cleansing the “5 Koshas”, (energy layers of the body) as described from time immemorial in various ancient Vedic texts and yogic scriptures!

Benefits of cleaning the Koshas:

• Going beyond all fears, especially the fear of death • Gaining clarity of purpose and aligning our desires

• Healing of negativity, pain and suffering

• Feel excitement and enthusiasm for life

• Feel the love & belonging with the cosmos

• Feel complete healing, rejuvenation and new hope for greater achievements!

(Friday - Sunday evenings)

results.description:
Queens, NY-based AMERICAN BOLERO DANCE COMPANY will present the second and last installment of its Summer 2015 "TABLAO FLAMENCO" series again at The Chian Federation in Astoria on Friday, August 14th at 8:30 PM. Established in 2008 by Company Founder and Artistic Director, Gabriela Granados, Tablao Flamenco is an ongoing series of monthly showcases that features live Flamenco and other kinds of Spanish dance and music performed by world-class artists from New York City and abroad. Presented like a cabaret, where guests can order and enjoy food and drinks during the show, Tablao Flamenco re-creates the experience of being in one of Spain's flamenco nightclubs (or 'tablaos') but for the NYC audience. Don't miss a fantastic night of exhilarating performances by:

GABRIELA GRANADOS, dancer
PALOMA RÍOS, dancer
ALICIA BLUMENFELD, dancer
ISABEL DEL DÍA, dancer
BARBARA MARTÍNEZ, singer
AURORA REYES, singer
BASILIO GEORGES, flamenco guitarist
CRISTIAN PUIG, flamenco guitarist
PAUL JARED NEWMAN, Spanish classical guitarist
and the BALLET ESPAÑOL de GABRIELA GRANADOS.

LOCATION:
The Chian Federation, 44-01 Broadway (at 44th Street), Astoria, NY 11103. By subway: R or M to the 46th Street station.

ADMISSION:
Adults $25; Seniors (65 years & up) and Students (with valid school ID) $20; Kids (under 17 years) $15.

PLEASE NOTE:
Food and drinks provided by CF Catering available to order - not included in the ticket price.
There is assigned table seating.
Venue opens at 7 PM for ticket sales at the door, and seating.
Food and beverage service starts 8 PM.
Show begins at 8:30 PM.

TICKETS AND MORE INFO:

Brown Paper Tickets:
Online - ABDCTablao8-14-15.BrownPaperTickets.com
Phone orders (24/7)[masked]

American Bolero Dance Company:
www.AmBolero.com
(718)[masked] or (917)[masked]

The Summer 2015 “Tablao Flamenco” series is made possible (in part) by the Queens Council on the Arts, with public funds from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs, in partnership with the City Council, and with funds from the Decentralization Program, a regrant program of the New York State Council on the Arts with the support of Governor Andrew Cuomo and the New York State Legislature and administered by the Queens Council on the Arts.
results.name: TABLAO FLAMENCO - 2015 Summer Finale, August 14th @ 8:30 PM

I'll repeat the Google Wallet instructions for those unaccustomed: 
-Download the Google Wallet app on your phone. You'll have to have a gmail account to register your username with this service if you don't already have gmail (in that case create a gmail account first... I did the same thing awhile back just to use this service)

- Create a 4 digit PIN to sign into Google Wallet. Then you'll be on the app homepage. -The left button says 'send money'. Click it and you'll have a screen where you can input a name or email address. My email address for this is [masked] .

-Once you input my username you'll see the screen where you type in the dollar amount. Once done, click the gray 'next', then the blue 'review' button in the upper right corner. -This takes to a confirmation screen. If anything looks off just click the left button on the upper lefthand side to go back a page. Otherwise, you confirm it and click send. Done! An icon will appear in your notifications area letting you know it's sent to me.

From now on, every event will not require a payment to rsvp on this page, I will check the rsvps daily to make sure everyone followed up - any issues message me on here and we will figure it out. Please work with me and send the payment when you register for the event... after this first set up it will take ten seconds each week. If you register and don't pay within 24 hours i'll reach out to you and then have to open the spot back up.. work with me here please, that would not be fun!

*** Added: In the notes section of the payment, please leave your name if its not evident in the email account used! Thanks

results.description:
Do you know your reefer rights?

We are a cross-disciplinary coalition of radical artists, social media experts and grassroots organizers from the Occupy Wall Street community of NYC who have teamed up with drug policy experts from the Empire State Chapter of the National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws (NORML) to become the militant wing of the marijuana legalization community of NYC. 

Governor Cuomo's Compassionate Care Act is a deadly insult. Progressive leaders in Albany like Senator Liz Krueger tells us that it will be at least another half decade before her Marijuana Regulation and Taxation Act will have a chance of passing the senate floor. We find this unacceptable.

Meet Up with us every Friday night for some free appetizers courtesy of Open Cannabis and free education on how to safely stay high and get by without getting busted while we organize and creatively fight for legal recreational cannabis in NYC.

results.description:
EVENT TYPE: Dining


http://asiadecuba.com/templates/default/en/images/logo-b.png?6

DESCRIPTION:

Located at 415 Lafayette Street and under the culinary leadership of Executive Chef Luis Pous, Asia de Cuba makes its long-awaited return to New York City.  Representing the perfect culinary marriage of Latin and Asian ingredients, techniques and flavors, the innovative menu is sophisticated yet whimsical, and above all, fun.  The newly updated menu consists of five main sections: Ceviches, Small Plates, Salads, Wok and Plancha and features an extensive selection of hand-crafted cocktails, built on classic formulas, that draw inspiration from Asia and Cuba and mirror the approachable and tropical nature of the food. Chef Pous, who grew up and trained as a chef in Cuba, intertwines his heritage and experience with Jeffrey Chodorow's original vision.  The new menu represents Chef Pous’ interpretation of what Asian-influenced Cuban food would be today if Cubans had been able to innovate and evolve their cuisine over the past 50 years, when they did not have access to the range of global ingredients which had been available to the rest of the world.

Renowned designer Rafael de Cardenas created the interior for Asia de Cuba. Evoking the hazy, seductive feeling of Havana's gloried nightlife past, the restaurant's interior is a contemporary reflection of Asia de Cuba's unique personality and legacy.

MENU:


http://asiadecuba.com/new_york/3292/adcnysummerrw_dinner2015

FOOD GALLERY:

• Wagyu Char Siu Beef Short Ribs

• Palomillo Salmon

• Ropa Vieja of Duck

• Tha Beef Salad

RESTAURANT GALLERY:

http://www.yelp.com/biz/asia-de-cuba-london

results.description:
Tix link


https://www.ticketfly.com/purchase/mobile/index/896263?utm_medium=api

T.U.N.E. proudly presents an epic and historic Trance night for the ages on August 14th in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, NY. Trance legend & the artist with as many monikers as anyone else takes to the decks for a 4hr extended set spanning 20 years of Trance. ( almost its entire existence) The man known as MIKE/Push, formally Push, M.I.K.E, and Plastic Boy will deliver a set that we will be talking about for a long time. Its an honor for us to have the Belgian born Trance DJ/producer headline our night. 

Mike Dierickx born in Antwerp, Belgium in 1973 ( currently residing in Queens, NY) has been producing and Dj'ing since 1992 and has as many releases and remixes of tracks that rival anyone in the Trance world. M.I.K.E. is responsible for some of the most iconic and influential tracks in the history of electronic dance music. Fresh off his acclaimed World Citizen album earlier this year T.U.N.E & Schulz music group are delighted to bring you M.I.K.E./Push.

It has been a while since M.I.K.E. has headlined an event in NYC and he is as excited as we are to put on a stellar Trance performance for us. M.I.K.E. /Push cemented his legacy long ago with the tracks we all remember & love such as Strange World, Universal Nation, The Legacy, Till We Meet Again, Sunrise at Palamos, Silver Bath, Intruder and Chocolate Infusion; He is going to bring the feels. His remixes of Troy - Phoenix From the Flame Ft. Sinead O'Connor, Cygnus X - Orange Theme, Robert Gitelman - Things 2 Say and many, many more have shaped the Trance scene over the years. There is no question we are in for a special treat for this event!

M.I.K.E./Push currently hosts his own weekly radio session called Club Elite Sessions on Thursdays from 4-5PM on 

http://www.di.fm/shows/club-elite-sessions

. 

A longtime friend of Coldharbour Recordings and SMG founder Markus Schulz, M.I.K.E. Push has contributed to the latter's 2013 city compilation project, with Before Dawn starring on Buenos Aires '13. He is also set to make his mark on the Coldharbour label, with new smash The Motive pencilled in for release through winter and Astrolab for Spring 2015. His new collaboration with Rank1- Juno has that deep progressive melodic sound that is so prevalent in most MIKE/Push Tracks. 

His website with all his links and info can be found at


http://www.mike.be/

Also on deck for T.U.N.E. at this event is Monoverse. He is one of Trance's rising stars and a NYC favorite. His sensational progressive style has brought him great success in the last two years, with several productions and remixes including a track called Kheira that Mike Squillo and Mir Omar did a wonderful remix on. His new track called One way to LA was just recently featured on Armin Van Buuren's ASOT 715 and got the very coveted title of "Future favorite" for that weeks show. Monoverse also just recently got his debut at EDC NY at Met Life Stadium on Saturday May 23rd to the delight of many of his peers and he delivered an outstanding performance.

Monoverse The DJ/Producer, Santos Torres the man hails from New Jersey and is the founder of the very up and coming label Amped Artists. He also airs every other Monday at 10am on 

http://ah.fm/


We cant wait to have this very talented Trance artist let loose and mix his very unique style. Its a pleasure for us to have him Co-headline the event.

http://ampedartists.com/

https://soundcloud.com/monoverse

Our opening Dj for the night Dave Barbera has a very diverse array of styles. he is proficient at opening as he is at closing. He has also CO-Headlined once at Pacha NYC in 2014 and has played at other well known NYC clubs such as Cielo and Webster Hall. He has opened and closed for the likes of several big name Djs in the past including, Will Atkinson, Thomas Datt, Super8 & Tab Manuel Le Saux and is comfortable doing either.

Dave Barbera another NJ native born in 1989 has had a Passion for electronic dance music since he was a little kid and it spilled over into him wanting to take his passion into Djing. he has been mixing and perfecting the craft for several years now. He is always a good asset to any party he plays at.

https://www.facebook.com/davebarberamusic?fref=ts

https://soundcloud.com/davebarberamusic
results.how_to_find_us: Pre meetup socializing will take place at the ore bar at 277 graham ave at 915 pm my contact  number is 3473252462

results.description:
***This is the same location- just out the back doors under the lights! Beautiful turf field provides for some beautiful soccer.  Full field - back up to 22 players!!

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.

results.description:
The Whippets look forward to putting on our first road race  But we need YOUR HELP in order to create a great experience for our friends and teammates.

We need volunteers for setup, timing, registration, course marshalling, finish line, cleanup, refreshments, etc.  You are welcome to BOTH volunteer AND also run -- just let us know what you are planning to do.

The approximate schedule for the day, which is subject to change:

7:00 -- begin setup

8:00 -- open registration

9:00 -- start race

10:30 -- finish cleaning up -- head to after party nearby!

We will follow up with you to provide more information about volunteering duties and to ask you to confirm your attendance.  For now, please RSVP to this event if you are able to help us. Thanks!
