results.description:
MTA is offering special package deals and one of them is the Montauk Lighthouse (http://web.mta.info/lirr/getaways/longisland/montauklighthouse.htm).
I'm planning to go there on Saturday (Aug 15) and you are welcome to join!
Montauk is the easternmost point of Long Island. It's famous mostly for its beaches, the Lighthouse and the sharks (unfortunately I doubt we would see any :) ).
The Montauk lighthouse was designated as a National Historic Landmark in 2012 and it's the fourth oldest active lighthouse in the United States. Besides the Lighthouse we would also see the Montauk Village and the Gosman's Dock.

Meeting time, place and transportation:
Meeting at 7:30AM on Saturday, August 15 at Long Island Rail Road Penn Station tickets booth. I will provide my phone number to those, who decide to attend.
It's possible to take the train also from the Atlantic Terminal (Brooklyn) and Woodside (Queens), in such a case we could meet at Jamaica, as it's necessary to switch to the Montauk train there anyway.
If you are interested, please make sure you buy the tickets in advance! And make sure you ask for the Long Island Getaways "Montauk Lighthouse" offer.
It takes around 3 h to get there from NYC. We could leave Montauk either at 5:35 PM or 7:33 PM (on the same day).

Cost:
The package costs 49 USD and it includes:
- Discounted round-trip rail and bus transportation to all locations
- Admission to Montauk Point Lighthouse

You are responsible for bringing food/drinks for yourself. There will be restaurants around, so we could stop somewhere for lunch.

Hope to see you there :)
results.name: Meet me in Montauk!  (or simply "Montauk Lighthouse trip")

results.description:
Tandem Hang Gliding

We are returning to have tandem hang gliding with Hangar 3 one more time. We have been to Hangar 3 each of last two years and it was certainly a blast! Also, it will be peak foliage season at the area.

Hang gliding is an air sport in which a pilot flies a light and unmotorized foot-launchable aircraft called a hang glider (also known as Delta plane or Deltaplane). Most modern hang gliders are made of an aluminium alloy or composite-framed fabric wing. The pilot is ensconced in a harness suspended from the airframe, and exercises control by shifting body weight in opposition to a control frame, but other devices, including modern aircraft flight control systems, may be used. In the sport's early days, pilots were restricted to gliding down small hills on low-performance hang gliders. However, modern technology gives pilots the ability to soar for hours, gain thousands of feet of altitude in thermal updrafts, perform aerobatics, and glide cross-country for hundreds of miles. The Fédération Aéronautique Internationale and national airspace governing organizations control some aspects of hang gliding. Learn more here...

The morning will start with a safety briefing and instruction, and you will be towed in a tandem hang glider to 2,500 ft above ground with an 'USPHA' rated tandem instructor at your side, then release to fly freely like a bird and land safely on wheels.

They video each flight with an on board camera. (Video costs additional $40)

For more info about hang gliding, click the link to Hangar 3

Tandem Sailplane (Glider)

Ever want to fly or glide a plane without an engine. Here is is your chance. The introductory rides give you the opportunity to fly with an FAA certified commercial pilot or instructor. We will be doing basic trainer glider. A rugged single engine tow plane will tow you to approx 2500 feet above ground level (AGL) where you will pull the release and experience free flight!

For more info about glider, click the link to Valley Soaring

Depart Date: August 15th Saturday; Please arrive 15 minutes earlier.

Depart 7:30 AM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map)

Depart 8:00 AM: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of West 43rd St. & 9th Ave, New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Depart around 2:30 PM & expect to be back in NYC at 4:00 PM and Flushing at 4:45 PM

Cost (Tandem Hang Gliding): Early Birds $209 with $79 deposit (includes BBQ cook out & transportation) for first 6 spots or 14 days in advance; Afterward, Regular $229 with $99 deposit; Bring balance of $130 cash on the event date. Video CD costs $40 additional. Bring $5 cash tips for the instructor.

Cost (Tandem Glider): Early Birds Introductory Ride $99 (includes transportation) for first 3 spots or 14 days in advance; $129 for Early Birds High Performance Ride. Afterward, Regular Introductory Ride $109; $139 for Regular High Performance Ride. Bring $5 cash tips for the instructor.

Buy Ticket Here: http://aug2015tandemgliding.eventbrite.com/ You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) Your spot is NOT confirmed until your payment is received.

Weight: 40-240lbs

Items to Bring: Comfortable cloth, sun-glass, sun screen, & camera

Amenities: Picnic tables, swing set, large chess set, and lots of fresh air

FREE BBQ: Hamburgers, grilled chicken, hot dogs, bottled water, and Gatorade. 

Included: Certified guides, tandem hang gliding or tandem glider, instruction, FREE BBQ, & luxury round trip MB Sprinter transportation from NYC.

Maximum: 15

Refund Policy:

* $20 processing fee if cancelled 3 weeks prior to the event date;
* Refund 50% of event fee if cancelled 10 days prior to the event date;
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show; however, spots can be transferred to your friends with $20 processing fee.

Note: There are waiting time between turns, so feel free to bring somethings you can do during off time. Suggestions: volleyball, frisbee, cards and board games.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

results.description:
Come join us for a Fun-Filled day in the Adirondacks!

WE WILL MEET at the St. Hubert's Parking area on Ausable Club Road just off Route 73. Click Here for the Google Satellite View

Our plan pending good weather will be an out and back to Colvin and Blake Mountains passing Indian Head in both the morning and afternoon sunlight. It will be a long day and the group will be expected to move at a decent pace of at least 1 mph uphill and 2 mph on level or downhill terrain.

http://www.lakeplacid.com/do/hiking/mount-colvin

http://www.lakeplacid.com/do/hiking/blake-peak-0


Distance: Approximately 18 miles

Hiking Pace: up to 2.0 mph

Estimated Hike Time: 10+ hours

Difficulty: Intermediate - Rocky Terrain, steep Ascents and Descents some of which may require the use of Ladders


Current Weather Forecast:  Partly Sunny with a high of 72 degrees



RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Shoes with good grip

• Gaiters

• A Backpack - with Raincoat/Windbreaker

• Hiking Poles

• Related maps, a compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, Lunch, First Aid, Headlamp, Sun Protection, Bug Spray, etc.


RELATED MAPS:

Adirondack Park - Lake Placid / High Peaks Trail Map #742

After our hike we will have the option of heading over to the Baxter Mountain Tavern for some Dinner, Drinks and Desserts!

Baxter Mountain Tavern & Grill

10050 NYS Rt. 9n


Keene, NY 12942

Phone[masked]

Website http://www.baxtermountaintavern.com/home.html

Nestled in the heart of  New York States historic Adirondack Parks High Peaks region, just 2 miles off the main route to the Olympic village of Lake Placid, you will find a memorable dining experience. The Baxter Mountain Tavern is a real Adirondack gem, a rustic restaurant featuring classic American cuisine with a warm family atmosphere. Since the doors opened in 1997, owner Dave Deyo has greeted the public with a welcome alternative to the hustle and bustle of urban life.

Located in Keene, home to over 30 of the regions highest peaks and minutes from several trail heads, the Baxter Mountain Tavern is a popular and picturesque spot. Pull up in a Adirondack chair on our spacious outdoor deck with glorious mountain views for cocktails and relaxation with friends. During the colder months, curl up on comfortable fireside couch with a locally brewed Lake Placid Ale. 


WHERE TO STAY?

I will be driving up early Friday and staying the whole weekend at:

Schultes Family Lodge
5866 Cascade Road
Lake Placid, NY 12946

Phone:[masked]

Website: http://www.schulteslodge.com/

For a cheaper place to stay I would also recommend checking out some of the area Hostels which include:


Tmax-n-Topo's Hostel
5046 Cascade Road
Lake Placid, NY 12946

Phone:[masked]

e-mail: [masked]

Website: http://www.tmax-n-topo.com/

or you also might want to check out:

Keene Valley Hostel
Jake & Robin
1755 NYS Route 73
PO Box 541
Keene Valley, NY  12943

Phone:[masked]

e-mail: [masked]

Website: http://www.keenevalleyhostel.com/home.html


Adirondack Hiking maximum group size limitations:

• A group size limit of 15 people for day hiking is in place. Any group larger than 15 must split up (by no less than 1 mile) into smaller, self-sufficient groups that satisfy the size requirement. These groups shall not congregate into one large group at trail junctions, rest stops, lunch breaks, etc.

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER

Waiver of liability

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader- This is YOUR hike.

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

HOW TO RSVP...

results.description:
When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

We invite you to come and experience how meditation can happen effortlessly with a little attention to our very own breath! The free session will include light yoga, breathing techniques and relaxing meditation and will be led by one of the volunteers of the Art of Living foundation.

 

Art of Living Secaucus Center

Phone: <a>[masked]</a>

Twitter: https://twitter.com/#secaucusaol
Web: http://www.artofliving.org/us-en/secaucus

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

results.description:
Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

venue.name: George Washington Bridge Temporary Bus Terminal

results.description:
Time for another Palisades trail run! This run will start at the bus station, go over the bridge, up the Palisades Long Path and back.

I’ll be running at a 10 minute/mile pace and turning around at the Park Headquarters (19 miles round-trip from the bus station). Every pace and distance is welcome, but be prepared to run on your own if you can't find someone who matches yours. Other notable turn-around points include the State Line Cafe (25 miles round-trip), Alpine Lookout (16 miles round-trip), and the Greenbrook Sanctuary (13 miles round-trip). 

Note that if you turn around before the Park Headquarters, you might be looking at up to 13 miles between water sources. Please make sure you plan your hydration accordingly!


If you would like to meet up with us on the New Jersey side, find us at the trail start just over the pedestrian bridge at 9:00am. Please indicate this in your RSVP.


Here’s a map of the trail. The Long Path is marked “A” on the map and is marked with aqua blazes. Please familiarize yourself with the trail map before coming to the run.

Here's a list of landmarks along with their distance from the start on the NJ side.


I’ve also made a Google Map that shows the trail along with several points of interest, including restrooms and places to get water. This map is approximate - do not rely on it for navigation!

As always, please view the group's About page and make sure you understand your responsibilities as an event participant.
results.how_to_find_us: The George Washington Bridge Bus Terminal is closed for construction. We will meet at the trailer on Ft. Washington Ave. that is serving as the temporary bus station.
results.name: Palisades Long Path Trail Run

venue.name: PORT AUTHORITY BUS TERMINAL SOUTH WING BY THE COMMUTER STATUES

results.description:
10 miles at a moderate pace to brisk pace. Mostly level terrain with a mild hills and a short range of up and down rock steps. Hike passes through elements of the Long Path by State-Line, Tall Mountain State Park and Piermont, New York. Optional pizza snack by returning bus. Bring lunch/water.

MEET: no later than 8:45AM at the Port Authority Bus Terminal, South Wing, by the white commuter statue. Bus departs at 9:15AM, One way to Closter Dock Road, NJ bus 9A gate 220 arriving at 10:00AM.
Directions: Purchase O/W ticket with leader for bus arriving 10am. Bus also available at George Washington Bridge Bus Terminal at 9:40am, platform 20. Call leader to check hike data, and for schedule or driving info. Joint hike

Leader: Marvin Malater [masked] 


Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for paid annual Shorewalkers members, $3 for non-members, visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.
results.name: Closter Dock Road to Piermont: Palisades

results.description:
Details:

1 game (7 v 7) : Two halves of 30 minutes each with a break in between

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.)  Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances.  We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation:

We'll play rain or shine.  We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

results.name: CLOSTER DOCK ROAD TO PIERMONT PALISADES

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Saturday Morning Outdoor Yoga

results.description:
We will be hiking on the Horse Pond Mountain, Stonetown, Lake Sonoma, and Hewitt Butler Trails in New Jersey underneath the Greenwood lake airshow which begins at 12:30 PM. This hike will be classified as Moderate to Strenuous.  It is the rockiest, most rugged hiking in the state of New Jersey.  I am thinking 6-8 miles.  With possible shortening or extension of the route.

For details on the airshow...go here: http://greenwoodlakeairshow.com/id2.html

We will hike the morning, bring a swim suit, we may get wet at lake Sonoma and do our first search for turtles, and then later have an extended stop at the best vantage point we can find and watch the airshow  (2 or 3PM)  somewhere near the water tanks at the top of the Jungle Habitat park.  We will be close to the trailhead at this point and those who want to leave early can.  the show ends at 5pm.

Part 2:

This also happens to be the week that the Eastern Painter turtle eggs start to hatch.  After the airshow, those who want turtles, swimming and meteors, we may grab a quick bite to eat at the West Milford Diner, then we will visit Green Turtle Pond in Hewitt.  (this will require a brief walk or car shuttle up a dirt road that goes directly to the pond)  But there are LOTS of turtles here.  Bring a swimsuit, binoculars, flashlight or headlamp, and probably bug repellent.  Lastly...this very same day, it is the tail end of the perseid meteor shower. (we may get lucky with this.)

Baby turtles are attracted to light, they may follow the sun, the moon or a flashlight. If the moon is reflecting off the water they may just naturally go where they need to. Bring a flashlight if you plan to attend part 2.

Don't forget to print yourself a "TURTLE GUIDE" and bring it:  (see link below)

http://www.state.nj.us/dep/fgw/ensp/pdf/turtles.pdf

Ideally: At the end of the day, wouldn't you like to soak it up, in a swimming hole, while looking for turtles and watching meteors? I know I would!  Part 2 is totally chill!

To pull off part 2, I will need an idea of how many drivers are going to be on this hike.  Please let me know if you are a driver and how many you can take.

Recommended apps for this hike:

1.  Flightradar24 for IOS....   http://www.flightradar24.com/apps

2.  Plane Finder for Android...

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.pinkfroot.planefinderfree&hl=en

3.  Skyview for IOS...  https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/skyview-free-explore-universe/id413936865?mt=8

4. Star Chart for Android...

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.escapistgames.starchart

5.  Turtles of the world for IOS...

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/turtles-of-the-world/id424806942?mt=8

There are a few points I need to make about this hike:

1. It is a work in progress and this description will be updated as we get closer to the event.
2. If it gets cloudy enough that we can't see the meteors, part 2 of this hike might be cancelled.
3. If we do have a part 2 to the hike you can feel free to leave early after part 1 if you want to.
4. Hiking boots are mandatory. Anyone not wearing them will be turned away at the trailhead. (!)
5. This is a rain or shine event. 

6.  Trail map...  http://www.nynjtc.org/product/north-jersey-trails

7. As with all of my hikes.  If you're on a schedule or in a rush to be somewhere else, this probably isn't your hike.  


What to bring:

Trail map, 3 liters water minumum, Lunch, pack a large one, backpack, hiking boots, Camera, flashlight, binoculars, bug repellent, swimsuit, hand towel, or towel.

Trailhead  GPS<a href="http://www.nynjtc.org/glossary/term/750"></a>  Coordinates      [masked],[masked]   

Driving Directions

Take Skyline Drive to its northwestern terminus at Greenwood Lake Turnpike (County Route 511). Turn right and continue for 5.3 miles, crossing a causeway over the Monksville Reservoir and passing the historic buildings of the Long Pond Ironworks to the right. Park in a large parking area on the left (south) side of Greenwood Lake Turnpike, opposite East Shore Drive.  Drivers....wait here as there is a short shuttle to the burnt meadow trailhead from here.

PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION            Bus     

Take the 7:30AM or earlier New Jersey Transit #197 bus from Port Authority Bus Terminal in New York City to the trailhead, at East Shore Road and Greenwood Lake Turnpike.  I could not find the stop number, so let the bus driver know where you are getting off!  Bus People!  No worries.  We will be waiting for you at the bus stop!

If you are doing a plus one, or plus two...  Please have your guest join meetup, join our group, and join this activity!  We need this for security purposes (photo identification), and to keep our group viable and growing.  Please note: member dues are optional, it's not about money!

Last update: 8/14/15
results.name: 2 part hike: Those Daring Young Men & Their Flying Machines,Turtles, and Meteors

results.description:
**INDOOR, FUTSAL OR SNEAKERS**  

                               NO CLEATS or PLASTIC STUDS!

         NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED PICKUP SOCCER GAMES 

                                      @ RIVERSIDE Park!

                             See our page on Facebook!:

                        ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RQxq4zYJDFg

DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

We'll play 3 simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check your email or our meetup message board on friday night or before 12.00pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

Riverside Park at West 107 & 108 Street

Take the 1 RED Line Train to Cathedral Pkwy an walk two blocks down, to 108th Street and Riverside Dr.

The field is down the lower level near the river. You can easly access the field from 108th Street. Remember, the field is not visable from the street level, you have to walk down the stairs from Riverside Dr & 108th Street. and you will see the newly renovated fanced-in soccer field next to the river.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to a local bar for brunch and a Pint or Two.

                                        Lion’s Head Tavern


                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

                                           (212)[masked]

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

Have an expensive DSLR or mirrorless camera, but are still stuck using it in "Automatic" mode? Learn how to control your camera like a pro at the Love Your Camera - Intro to Photography workshop. 

 This photography course has benefit both to the beginner who is struggling to find the 'ON' switch, to the experienced film photographer looking to make the transition into the world of digital photography. If you're unsure about aperture, shutter, white balance, the histogram, raw vs jpeg and pretty much anything else about your camera, this course is the ideal introduction to your digital camera and stepping stone into beautiful photography.

results.description:
Meeting Place: Outside the courthouse near Foley Square Rest Stop. Courthouse is a glass building with with signs labeled "United States Court of International Trade".

We would like to bicycle this route as its a lot faster to see everything than walking. There are limited free bike rentals at rest stops but likely you have to show up super early to get 1.

With nearly 7 miles of open streets, 5 rest stops and a seven-block-long art installation in the Park Avenue Tunnel – there is plenty to explore at Summer Streets. And remember, everything at Summer Streets is free!


Summer Streets is part bike tour, part walking tour, part block party—a great time for exercise, people watching, or just enjoying summer mornings. Passersby are weclome to participate in arts and crafts workshops, listen to musical performances, learn to salsa dance, eat healthy snacks, climb a 25' climbing wall, soar through the sky on a 160' zipline and explore a 179 years voice tunnel.

Held between 7:00 am to 1:00 pm, Summer Streets extends from the Brooklyn Bridge to Central Park, along Park Avenue and connecting streets, with easy access from all points in New York City, allowing participants to plan a trip as long or short as they wish. All activities at Summer Streets are free of charge, and designed for people of all ages and ability levels to share the streets respectfully.

Foley Square Rest Stop
-Zipline: The 165' long zipline will return to Summer Streets this year. Zipline Line Participant Information Zip Line is first come, first served.
-Parkour: The Movement Creative will provide demos on using our streets and the surrounding infrastructure as spaces for healthy exercise and fitness.
-free bike rentals. A total of 50 bikes will be available at this rest stop.

SoHo Rest Stop
-REI Adventure Zone The popular 25’ tall REI Climbing Wall returns this year. In addition, the following vendors will offer different interactive demonstrations: Merrell, Nuun, Saris and Thule. The inflatable Merrell Hill Climb invites participants to try on Merrell shoes and test their skills. Saris will provide the opportunity for participants to ride on a virtual course using a stationary bike, in addition to a complimentary bike valet station. Thule and REI are partnering to provide mobile bike tech support throughout the route.


Midtown Rest Stop
-Whole Foods City Picnic The following vendors have confirmed participation at this year’s Whole Foods activation: Whole Foods, Applegate Farms, Daiya, Honest Tea, Steve’s Ice Cream, Organic Valley, Nature’s Path, Gardein, Chia Co., Sweet Leaf Tea and Morningstar Farms. Each vendor will offer free samples throughout the day. In addition, Seeds in the Middle, NY Coalition for Healthy School Food, and Food Fight will present unique, interactive healthy eating demonstrations.
-CitiBike Information & Education Learn to Ride Classes for Kids and Adults by Bike New York Free Bike Repair by 5 Borough Bike Club
-free bike rentals. A total of 50 bikes will be available at this rest stop

CLICK HERE FOR MORE
http://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/summerstreets/html/route/activities.shtml

results.description:
Is Your Daughter The Next Oprah?

The Long Island Girl Talk Program (L. I. G. T.) would like to invite your daughter to participate in free one day workshop to be held on Saturday, August 15th, from 9:00am-4:00pm at Nassau Community College's North Annex Building. This program is specifically designed for young women ages 13-18 with an interest in the media.

Intensive lectures and production work will provide participants with a window of opportunity to learn directly from our distinguished staff and explore careers in journalism or broadcasting. They will have an opportunity to share innovative ideas and diverse perspectives while initiating new friendships and connections. If you are interested, please ask for one of our brochures.

Breakfast and Lunch will be served.  Parental consent is needed in order for the girls to appear on television, so you must accompany your teen inside of the building when you drop her off.


The program targets girls in Freeport, Hempstead, Roosevelt and Uniondale School District, but exceptions will be made for outstanding candidates. Space is limited, so if you know a young woman who might be the next Oprah, please email [masked] or contact Ms. Elaine P. Smith at[masked], Director of Recruitment and Community Outreach, by August 13, 2015.


This workshop is sponsored by Macy's Department Stores, African American, Latino, Asian and Native American Faculty Association of Nassau Community College & Long Island Motion Picture Arts Center & Museum.

results.description:
Thanks to the kind folks at The Trust For Governor's Island, the Drone User Group have been invited to fly over the island.

After consideration and discussion, we agree that this is *not* a flying event for beginners. If you feel that flying in potential high winds in a very restricted and monitored area is not what you are up to, please don't make this event your proving ground.

We encourage beginners to come and learn from our more experienced members. Anyone that has been to our fly-ins knows how helpful and friendly we are.

We will be maintaining a 200ft ceiling with a radius of 250m. The monument area at the northern tip is a National Park and prohibited from being overflown. There will be a mandatory aircraft geo fence check on the Manhattan side prior to boarding the ferry.

If your aircraft does not have the ability to create a ceiling and perimeter via GPS, it will not be permitted to fly on the island.

Operators must show safety officers their settings of 200ft ceiling and 250m perimeter in order to board with a drone.

National Model Aviation Day is also August 15th - what better way to celebrate it!  Here is a link with more information - donations go to The Wounded Warrior Project: NationalModelAviationDay.org
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the Ferry Terminal at 9:15 sharp and we'll depart on the 10am ferry
results.name: (or): National Model Aviation Day on Governor's Island

results.description: Short 3 to 4 miles : slow moving: the hike sloshes up the Plattekill creek ascending > 1500’. At the canyon entrance our path ascends gently . The exit climb is up a talus of dirt and rock at 35 degrees. An all day event: leaving early for Catskills with late return. We slosh from waterfall to waterfall totaling ( 7 ). For whiles, the only path is the creek: a rock waterpark without the plastic. Colorful bare rock slabs, swimming holes, lacy cascades, lose rock in all sizes abound from rounded pebbles underfoot, to must climb around boulders bigger than dump trucks. Strenuous. Challenge: two must do scrambles. A pathless place which some may find difficult, daunting, and uncomfortable. Those with interest email [masked]. Note: The Catskill Park imposes a group limit.
results.name: Catskills:  Plattekill Clove Creek Sloash

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

The Hudson Valley Ribfest is an annual event at the Ulster Country Fairgrounds that brings together scores of pitmasters from across the Hudson Valley to show off their recipes and compete for the title of  The Best!!  Join us for this tasty day out of the city as we enjoy the amazing sights of the Shawangunk Mountains, an easy hike at Lake Minnewaska Park and all the fun at the Hudson Valley Rib Festival complete with live music, crafts tents and some of the best BBQ you will ever taste!


$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$

Please note that you will need to prepay for this event by using this link: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/hudsonn-tickets-18161527618

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$

Your day will begin with the beautiful ride up the Hudson River Train line on Metro North.  Your guide will pick you up in Poughkeepsie, NY to start you adventure!  We'll pick up a snack and head over to The Lake Minewaska/Awosting Falls Trail for an easy hike (1 hour 30 minutes)  from there we'll head to the fairgrounds where you can start digging in on some of that great BBQ! You can hang with the group or go off and explore on your own.  If there is time we will stop by a local winery.

You will be back on the 5:54 train to NYC.

Can I come alone? Yes, most of the people attending come on their own.  Our staff is great at introducing you to others at the event and keeping the conversations lively!

What to expect: 10-14 participants

What to wear: hiking shoes or sturdy sneakers

What to bring: snacks, bottled water

What is included? transportation to and from Poughkeepsie train to all attractions, festival admission, hiking fees, taxes and tips.

Not Included: Train fare (you may also drive to Poughkeepsie), BBQ samples, lunch

Admission: $75

What if it rains?  Refunds are only given if the trip is canceled due to rain.

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

Please note that you will need to prepay for this event by using this link: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/hudsonn-tickets-18161527618

venue.name: Stanley Isaacs Senior Center

results.description:
This volunteer opportunity helps a segment of the NYC population that is particularly vulnerable (our home-bound seniors) which is facing a steadily growing problem - hunger. As our city’s elderly grow older, they are more likely to have mobility limitations, while living at or below the poverty level. The elderly of East Harlem are particularly more vulnerable, residing in challenging living conditions alone, and who can no longer shop or cook for themselves.

Citymeals-on-Wheels (www.citymeals.org) raises private funds to ensure no homebound elderly New Yorker will ever go a day without food or human company. Citymeals funds 33 community-based agencies that bring weekend, holiday and emergency meals to homebound elderly New Yorkers - one of the agencies we'll be helping as volunteers.

How are we helping?

On Saturday, August 15th, we'll assist the Stanley Isaacs Senior Center Citymeals-on-Wheels program with delivery of meals to the elderly. Volunteers should wear weather appropriate clothes and comfortable shoes as deliveries are done on foot within walking distance from the meal center.  Although the weather may not always be favorable, the meals MUST be delivered as many, if not all, of the elderly in the program RELY on the meal delivery for the day.

Our Meetup

We'll meet at the Senior Center at 9:30am on Saturday for a short training, then break into small teams of 3 to 4 people to deliver the meals to the elderly.

If you RSVP, please try to be on time, or arrive no later than 9:30am, which is when we start delivery. The time commitment ends at 12pm and goes by very quickly. 

If you have any questions, running late, need more information on parking and etc., feel free to call/text Daniel at 774.275.3646.

Directions to the Union Settlement Senior Center

The Stanley Isaacs Senior Center is located at 415 East 93rd Street. The closest subway is the #6 train to 96th Street & Lexington Avenue, then walking east to 93rd street & 1st Avenue. The building is offset from the street (toward the FDR Drive), enter through sliding glass doors. The M15 bus line stops nearby, along 1st Ave.

Thanks and see you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Inside the Senior Center
results.name: Volunteer Opportunity! Citymeals on Wheels Food Delivery For The Elderly

results.description:
Field Trip - Saturday, August 15, 2015, 10 AM —Governors Island 10th Annual Jazz Age Lawn Party

The first day of this event takes place today on Governors Island. This beloved summer event attracts thousands of fans who come together to discover authentic music from the 1920s and 30s, learn the hottest dance steps of the time, frolic in their flapper dresses and glad rags, and enjoy sophisticated bites and vintage-inspired cocktails in a romantic yet playful setting. The fun begins at 11 AM and continues throughout the day. 

Located in the shadow of the modern New York City skyline, Governors Island is the oldest European settlement in New York. A former U.S. Army military base and U.S. Coast Guard station, 92 acres of the island are open to the public during the summer. A short ferry ride from Lower Manhattan will get you there to picnic, photograph and enjoy gorgeous views. To get there, take the ferry from the Battery Maritime Building (located at 10 South Street, adjacent to the Staten Island Ferry in Lower Manhattan). You can get to the terminal via subway (#1 to South Ferry; #4 or 5 to Bowling Green; “R” to Whitehall Street) or by bus (M5 Limited, M15 local, M15 SBS, and M20 to their southern-most stops).  We'll meet up around 9:30 AM at the ferry building to catch the 10 AM ferry to Governors island.  This ferry as well as the 10:30, 11, 11:30 AM are free. Later ferries cost $2 fare.  There are also ferries coming from Brooklyn.  

Check the website for schedules and other info: http://www.jazzagelawnparty.com/faq.html#faqs

RSVP at right! There is no charge for this event and with all the food there, you are on your own for meals and beverages.

results.description:
Well said Emma...  :-) 

August, we are meeting a little earlier to avoid the midday heat. There will be no changes to scheduled meetups (Sat. 8/8/15 no changes it is already scheduled),only future meetups that have yet to be posted. Expect start times around 9/9:30. 

I love to be down by the water... the winter will be here before we know it and it will be way too cold by the water :-(

Hope to see you there !!

results.description:
We had such a good time on our first water park outing that we're going to do it again; except this time it's going to be double the fun. Join me as we take a trip to Pennsylvania's Wildwater Kingdom.


We'll spend the late summer day enjoying over three dozen rides, slides and attractions, dousing buckets, spraying water, hundreds of palm trees, cobblestone walkways, water rides, and beach sand, you're instantly transported to a water park oasis where adults can be kids again.


The fun doesn't end there though; our admission fee also includes access to the adjoining Dorney Park. When the sun starts to set and we're thoroughly waterlogged, we can dry off and enjoy the park's rollercoasters and various other thrill rides.

Make sure you get a good night's sleep the night before, it's going to be a long day!


What's the cost?

$44.00 per person for an all day park pass to BOTH Wildwater Kingdom and Dorney Park Amusements if you buy in advance online. If you buy your ticket at the gate, the cost is $54.00.

Purchase your tickets online and print them HERE.

The important stuff ...

• Appropriate swimwear is required. Thong bottoms, cut off shorts, excessive buckles or ill-fitting suits are not allowed. No masks, swim fins, snorkels or shoes allowed either although you may wear aqua socks.

• No food, glass, or sharp objects are allowed to be brought into the park. You may carry in one unopened bottle of water. Storage lockers are available on site for rental.

• Check your email the evening before for last minute meetup updates.

How do I get there ...

One word--carpool. Or drive yourself. The park is about 1.5 hours from midtown Manhattan so let's hitch the horses up to the chuck wagons and get a caravan going. Use this address for your GPS:


4000 DORNEY PARK ROAD
ALLENTOWN, PA 18104


We will meet at the ticket windows @ 9:45 AM sharp! Please be on time, if you come late trying to connect with the group will be up to you and likely a herculean task in a crowded amusement park.

If you plan to drive and are willing to carpool, please post in your RSVP where you are leaving from and how many people you can carry. If you'd like to carpool with someone please post your request and where you are located. Please don't wait to be offered a ride, BE PROACTIVE and contact any drivers directly to work out transportation details. As  courtesy, passengers should pick up tolls and gas.
results.name: Not So Urban Athletics: Wildwater Kingdom/Dorney Park Adventure

results.description:
See updated Team Roster at the bottom of description

•  ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• WHAT COLOR SHIRT? CHOOSE ONE OF THESE AND Answer the question when you sign up. Look at the comments as we will announce when a color is full. 

• Yellow, Blue (not navy), Pink, White, Black, Green

• We play rain or shine!

• Sign up as a team or a free agent. 

• PLEASE ARRIVE 15 Minutes Early - 9:45AM!! First Game starts at 10am sharp .

• Round Robin - 5 x 20 minute Games Guaranteed. 

• Winners Get PS2G Surprises. 

• Big Goals 7v7 with 3 subs (every 5 minutes) 

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game. 

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2 - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers. 

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play. 

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
PADDLES UP!!  Intro to Dragon Boat Paddling.

Every Saturday we welcome new members to try out this new sport of Dragon Boating. No experience needed; coaching, training and all equipment supplied.

If this is your first time trying this sport out, the cost is free.  If you already attended our " Free intro to Dragon Boating" on May 2nd and May 9th, the cost is $10 per session.  However, the fee is applied to the season membership fee of $75 (mid season rate now) if you become a member of "Team Dragon".  Full time College or High School Student Fee is only $35.  Membership comes with unlimited Dragon Boat practices/training every Thursday 6-8pm, every Saturday 10-12am and all events hosted by the NJ Dragon Boat Club at Lake Parsippany.  The season runs from April to September.

To become a season member, go to njdragonboat.org and complete the online registration.

Come out and give it a try and get a great work out!

Expect to meet new friends and enjoy the beautiful Lake!  Please wear appropriate clothing (no jeans), footwear, and sunblock as you may get a little wet from paddling. Bring a bottle of water to rehydrate. 

Please park on the side streets and not in the boat house parking lot.

Please complete and bring this WAIVER (linked) for each individual.

In the event of inclement weather. Please check this site at 8:30am Saturday morning to see if the event is cancelled.
results.how_to_find_us: Boat house (please do not park at the boat house, please park on the side streets)
results.name: Saturday Dragon Boat Training

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

This is our 4th soccer practice in preparation for the Supporters Club Cup Tournament on 8/22 (a yearly 7v7 competitive tournament among the different supporters clubs based in NYC). The practice will probably consist of some passing and shooting drills and a scrimmage. We will look to have a final roster of about 12-15 players for the tournament, but you must attend at least 2 practices to be considered.


As you probably know, Pier 40 fields are first-come first-serve, so please arrive on time. Luke will send an e-mail to the group with our location once we have secured a field. It shouldn't be hard to find the group though.

results.description:
Events are intended for people who identify as women, which includes trans women. Our Code of Conduct applies to all events run by Women Who Code, Inc. 

Door open at 9:30AM and close at 10:30AM. Send us a message if you arrive late.

If you fit one or more of the personas below, you're our ideal attendee! 

• Working Moms

• Looking to learn about technology but don't know where to start

• Want to make a website to kickstart a business

What you need:

1. Download Text editor: 

Sublime - http://www.sublimetext.com/

2. Download Chrome: 

Chrome browser - https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95346?hl=en

3. Sign up for Github

4. Download SourceTree Git client - http://sourcetreeapp.com/

5. Download the class files - https://github.com/WomenWhoCodeNYC/HTML-CSS/archive/master.zip

End Accomplishment: By the end of the workshop, you will have built your very own one page website! 

**MUST SIGN UP HERE TO ATTEND: **

wwcnyc1.typeform.com/to/eGoARD


FAQ

Is there any resources I can go through beforehand? 

We recommend starting with these tutorials. 

Event closed? 

Events open 2 weeks in advance to ensure a higher attendance rate. Please check back 2 weeks before an event occurs to register OR follow @WomenWhoCodeNYC on twitter  for automatic tweets about event openings.
results.name: Full-Day HTML+CSS Workshop for Beginners

group.name: FREE or inexpensive things to do in New York City

results.description:
Learn to shoot 3D, or fly a kite. Members of the NYSA will teach you about shooting 3D while covering an event that's made for 3D. It's the Summer on the Hudson: FlyNYC Kite Flying Festival. Don't have a 3D camera? No Problem. We'll show you how to shoot with broadcast quality 3D cameras. You can learn about operating a 3D  camera and see your work at a future NYSA meeting. 

Event is Weather dependent of course.
results.how_to_find_us: Summer on the Hudson: FlyNYC Kite Flying Festival
results.name: Go Fly a Kite! And shoot it in 3D. NYSA open sky open house.

results.description:
Join us in Central Park for a great workout! We will be doing a mix of high intensity exercises including sprints, jumps, and others combined with awesome equipment to make the workout challenging and fun. 

The workout will be taking place on the Great Lawn or a near by open area of grass. We will be meeting at the King Jagiello statue, you can find the location through the links below. Please try to arrive a few minutes before 10:00am. I will be there with a big blue camping backpack, just look for me and come say hello. 

If you arrive after 10:00am and I am not there, come find us on the lawn. Wear sneakers, workout clothes, and bring water for yourself. 

http://www.centralparknyc.org/things-to-see-and-do/attractions/king-jagiello.html

Location on a map:


http://www.centralparknyc.org/maps/index.html?attraction=506618777

This is a free workout organized by Tamandua Expeditions (http://tamanduajungle.com/). See you out there!
results.name: Central Park Adventure Workout

results.description:
We do our summer runs in the morning, because it works better for the school, and it's also cooler in the AMs. Plus, you get to start your day off right! :)

Welcome!


If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2014 as we're not a litigious group. If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games: 1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.
results.name: Summer mornings pickup games

results.description:
Get your Fashion Collection Ready to Sell to Online & Traditional Retailers

Do you wonder if your line is ready to be seen by buyers?

Don’t have a clue what a linesheet is but heard you need to have one?

This workshop is perfect for you if..

You already have your product but don’t how to approach retail buyers

Are feeling stuck and frustrated

You don’t know how to price your product

Want to sell your designs online

Preparing for a trade show

Whether you’re selling your designs at a trade show, online, cold calling or emailing a buyer-a successful fashion business is only successful if you have sales!

MOST designers find selling their product the HARDEST part of their business.

They spend all this time, energy and money developing a collection when it comes time to sell, they just spin their wheels!

I’ve been there. It’s tough sending email after email, making countless calls, getting rejected, dealing with rude people or often, hearing nothing at all.

But you know what? They called and emailed me back!

How did I do it?

With over 15 years of fashion industry experience on both sides - buying and selling, for known brands such as Calvin Klein, Harajuku Lovers, L.A.M.B. and Joe’s Jeans along with building multiple unknown brands into million dollar businesses, I know what it takes to get your line out there! I’ll give my expert fashion industry opinion on whether your collection is cohesive, priced correctly, on trend, and fits in with your target market. I will give you specifics on what is necessary to impress retail buyers, sell your effective line effectively and get your collection retail ready!


No sugar coating here. I know it only takes one chance to make a first impression!

Here's just a few of the topics we'll cover:

· Create buzz worthy marketing materials that will grab the buyer’s attention

· Pricing your products for profitability

· Making sure your line has flow

· How to deliver that winning pitch and make that sale


· The Follow up

We'll also hold a 30 min Q&A session at the end of our workshop to cover any questions you might have!

Whether you’re an emerging designer, new to the fashion business, or a fashion student thinking of launching your own label, this workshop will give you the practical insight into what to do and what not to do in order to successfully sell to fashion buyers and e-tailers worldwide!

About The Fashion Potential:

The Fashion Potential teaches Indie, Emerging Fashion Designers and students the insider tips and tricks they need to create a successful fashion brand. We teach you about the business side of fashion the right way!

http://thefashionpotential.com

Email: [masked]

Twitter: @fashpotential

Facebook: The Fashion Potential

Pinterest: https://pinterest.com/fashnpotential/

Instagram: @fashpotential

Come join us!

When: Saturday, August 15, 2015

Time: 10:00am-12:30pm


(Q&A will take place at 12pm)

Where:

116 West 23rd Street, Suite 5 (5th floor)

New York, NY. 10011

Cost:  $35

Limited Seats are available so sign up today!

ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!


• Permit Disclosure: WE HAVE A PERMIT.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Adrian W. )

(Co-Leader- David T.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

EVENT TYPE: Clamming Party

ADMISSION COST: $12 per car

PLEASE NOTE:

• You need a Recreational Clamming License to clam in Jersey. Click on the link below to buy a Recreational Clamming License. It is $10 for Residents of Jersey and $20 for non Residents of Jersey.

• https://www.nj.wildlifelicense.com/ALS/licCtrl.php?start=1

•  If you don't want to clam you can still enjoy the beach party.


DESCRIPTION:

Island Beach State Park encompasses many miles of beach, with the northernmost of these having life guards. People can swim, surf, clam, fish, kayak in the park. The park also allows dune buggy access in the southern portion of the park. There is also a boardwalk extending from Barnegat Bay to the main road allowing boaters access to the beach. On the bayside of Island Beach State Park is an area called Tices Shoal, where boaters gather together and anchor.

results.description:
LEADER: Peter Reiner ([masked] or[masked])

RATING: B 5.5 C+

Meet 10AM at Buttermilk Falls County Park on Greenbush Rd. in Orangetown for a car shuttle to the starting point, at Nike Overlook Park. Hike along the Long Path northbound into Blauvelt State Park and back down to Buttermilk Falls. Rain cancels. Please register for the hike. TC Hudson Palisades map 109.

*   *   *   *   *   *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance:Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B-7-A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

NO SHOW/LATE CANCELLATION POLICY:
Please be considerate of event hosts/organizers and others who may want to attend an event by not being a "NO SHOW" (failing to show up when you've RSVP'd "yes") or a "LATE CANCEL" (changing RSVP to a "no" within 24 hours of an event).  If you have a history of No Shows and/or Late Cancels, we may have to bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space, in favor of those with a positive attendance history.
