results.description:
PLEASE READ THIS ENTIRE DOCUMENT BEFORE THE EVENT AND ALL UPDATES AS THEY ARE ADDED AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS EVENT DESCRIPTION

This month's fly-in is more than fun, it's civic minded. Thanks to the kind folks at The Trust For Governor's Island, we have been invited to fly over the island. What a beautiful site and with amazing backdrops of NYC, Statue Of Liberty, etc.

Ferry Service begins at 10:00a - we may be able to get some golf cart type transport on the island but don't count on it.

There will be specific parts of the island for us to fly above and around but be warned there will be other people enjoying the island while we are there. There will be a mandatory ceiling of 200 feet and no flight over the monument area of the island. 

I will be posting further info in advance of this event.

With all the negative press about our hobby/profession/passion, this is an opportunity for our group to demonstrate what safe, responsible UAS activity is all about.

There will likely be press/media there so bring your 'A' game! Also working to invite members of the NYC legislature in the hopes of influencing policy decisions.

We are the ambassadors of UAS in NYC!


PLEASE READ THIS ENTIRE DOCUMENT BEFORE THE EVENT AND ALL UPDATES


MORE INFO as of 08/03/2015

thanks for everyone's excitement, suggestions, and questions. As you might imagine this is an important event. With the recent negative press around UAS and stupid people doing stupid things with drones around JFK, the leadership team is going through some flaming hoops to ensure that we have a safe and fun event.

After consideration and discussion, we agree that this is not a flying event for beginners. Some of you have asked that very question, which we respect and are grateful for. If you feel that flying in potential high winds in a very restricted and monitored area is not what you are up to please don't make this event your proving ground.

We do encourage beginners to come and learn from our more experienced members. Anyone that has been to our fly-ins knows how helpful and friendly we are. We are also in need of volunteers to act as safety officers and software checkers. A great opportunity to get involved.

As stated before, we will be maintaining a 200ft ceiling with a radius of 250m. The monument area at the northern tip is a National Park and prohibited from being overflown. The island has several helicopter air routes running by the east, west and south and the Wall St heliport immediately due north. We request that no one fly beyond the land perimeter of the island out of respect to manned aviation.

There will be a mandatory aircraft geo fence check on the Manhattan side prior to boarding the ferry. If your aircraft does not have the ability to create a ceiling and perimeter via GPS, it will not be permitted on the island. Operators must show safety officers their settings of 200ft ceiling and 250m perimeter in order to board with a drone. 

By coincidence, National Model Aviation Day is August 15th - what better way to celebrate it!

Here is a link with more information - donations go to The Wounded Warrior Project:

http://nationalmodelaviationday.org/


UPDATED INFO 8/10/2015

Some updates on how the event will unfold:

Due to the high turnout expected we will be issuing lanyards and wristbands. Wristbands will be color coded and denote a particular takeoff and landing zone on a map that will be provided at check - in on the NYC side of the ferry. 

Check-in will be done on a first-come, first-served basis. There are a limited number of flight slots per location. A wristband and lanyard indicate that your aircraft has been checked and you are assured of at least one flight on the island. Note that we have added an hour to the event's duration to accommodate more flying.

Each flying site will be color coded and coordinate to the color of your wrist band. Time permitting you may be able to fly at another spot but only after everyone with the original color tag has flown. Your lanyard tag will be marked by safety officers to indicate you have had a turn in the air and at which station.

Actual flying sites on the island will be determined after scouting takes place end of day tomorrow.

We are currently instituting a "Snooze, You Lose" policy. You must be checked in, have a wrist band and lanyard, and be on the 10:00a ferry in order to fly at this event. This does not apply to spectators. We currently do not have the man power to have someone stay on the Manhattan side to check in late comers.

This may change based on actual turnout but this is the policy at the moment. Please do not board the next ferry with your drone expecting to fly on the island. You will experience the wrath of those that arrived early!

Please have your aircraft ready to be powered up (no props) and your smartphone app open to show your failsafe as "return to home", your altitude ceiling at 200ft or the metric equivalent, and a range of 250m. No exceptions.

IMPORTANT IMPORTANT IMPORTANT 8/12/2015

There are several factors affecting our time frame for the event:

The first ferry to the island departs The Battery Terminal at 10:00a. By the time we reach the flying site on the island - a map will be posted here beforehand and printed for your reference - it will be near 10:30.

There is an event going on in the "Old Town" section (no overflight) - a Jazz Age music festival with people dressed in period 1920's costume. It doesn't begin until noon but its certain that some of the people going to that event will be boarding the 10:00 ferry.

We currently have no mechanism in place for late arrivals. If you are not on the 10:00 ferry, please do not board with an aircraft thinking you can slip in. Wristbands and lanyards are what gets you to the flight line.

With so many operators interested in flying, we must state once again that this is not an event for beginners. Not sure if you're a beginner? Can you fly figure 8's, land "nose in", know what "nose in" means? We just cannot stress this enough. This is a high profile public event and a lot of important 3 letter agencies are scrutinizing from near and far.

We will be issuing lanyards to the first 70 operators that show our screeners (like the TSA but for god's sake leave your shoes on) your failsafe, RTH, flight ceiling and radius parameters on your control app or other interface. 

FAILSAFE - Return to home, Flight Ceiling 200 feet, flight distance radius 250 meters or equivalent.

We will not have time to help you find the screens and make the settings - please do this in advance of your arrival at the Ferry Terminal. Have your app launched and your aircraft powered without props. Be patient and kind to all volunteers. We are here for your safety and the safety of others on the island. If you're not ready we may need to send you back in line until you are.

Flight intervals have been reduced to 10 min per turn in the air. We feel that for all the effort you are making to come to this event, it is better for everyone to get a chance to fly more but not all at once. Go get coffees for everyone, hydrate, put some sunscreen on and talk to your fellow enthusiasts. We have so much to learn from one another. Revel in the wonder of it all and then maybe fly again.

There will be demarcated flight stations with traffic cones and a spectator line for everyone else to remain behind. Operators may have one person beside them for spotting or coaching but no one else may interfere with the operator while flying.

Lastly, several of you are asking - "can I go higher than 200 feet?" No.

I scouted the island yesterday afternoon and the staff are very excited to have us do what we do best. Lets be exemplary in our behavior and observe the rules we have set.

There is no overflight of the monument area where the ferry landing and old town and fort are. Maps will clearly demarcate what is out of bounds. There is and will be a tremendous amount of manned helicopter flight at altitudes that are quite low all around the island. Please do not fly past the boundary of land on the island - if you do, you will be asked to land immediately and will surrender your wristband and lanyard preventing you from any further flight activity.

In addition you will be ridiculed by your peers and referred to as "that guy" or "that girl" for the remainder of the day and shamed publicly on the internet. Seriously, don't do it. 

Please be respectful of spectators and passersby do not fly behind the flight line. 

There is likely to be press/media there. Have smart things to say, and demonstrate good aeronautical decision making by keeping distance from other craft and not traversing the entire flight area - stay in your part of the sky.

Lastly, be nice and be patient - our team of leaders and volunteers has put a lot of effort in to making this a kick-ass event for no other compensation than knowing they did their part to demonstrate their passion for UAS. 

See you there!


MAP LINK: 

https://www.dropbox.com/s/jps3w9n5cfqxm89/DUGnet%20Island%20Map%20for%2020150815_small%20%281%29.jpg?dl=0


This map indicates the path of travel to take if you want to rent a bike to get around, all roads lead to us once you get past the food truck area.

Flight stations will be set up by color code. Your wrist band indicates which station you will queue up for. Wrist bands will be numbered but does not indicate the order of flight since some will arrive after others - so once again, first come first served.

The volunteer team will do their best to get to the site first and set up - your help and patience is required.

The area marked in green is where we are permitted to base our operations.

Orange indicates high density of people expected and where food and drink may be procured. Pink is no fly monument zone. This part of the island is a national park. 

The area directly to the north of us is likely to have people in some spots especially as it gets later in the day. Please be conscious to not fly over/near people.

Lastly but not leastly, volunteers will be accepting your donations to The Wounded Warrior Project in conjunction with the Academy of Model Aeronautics. Please see the links below and make  contribution with us or online, or both.

http://nationalmodelaviationday.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/2015-Donation-Collection-Procedures-and-Guidelines.pdf

http://nationalmodelaviationday.org/

results.description:
#SUMMERSTREETS - http://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/summerstreets/html/about/about.shtml

We'll be running up and down Park Ave. The streets are ours! Along the way you can enjoy music, parkour, and some sort of Recycle-a-Bicycle Photo Booth (?).

Meetup/Hangout – 9:45 am

Whole Foods (Union Square) -- upstairs cafe. Show up a bit early to say hi, chat, and drop off any thing you don’t want to run with: jackets, bags, phones, etc. Somebody will always stay to watch the stuff.

Run – 10:00 am

Run 1 mile, 3 miles, 5 miles, or whatever you want. No pressure and no limits. Totally informal. Lots of different paces for lots of different people. Even walking speed is encouraged!

Brunch – 10:45 am

Whole Foods has ALL THE FOOD. Come get some.

What to expect: a seriously fun group of runners who definitely do not take running too seriously . We will meet, chat, RUN, stretch, chat, EAT BREAKFAST and then leave. It’s that easy. First we run, then we eat!

results.description:
TIME TO TAKE BACK YOUR LIFE!

If you are struggling to get on a healthy path or simply want to surround yourself with a like-minded people who will encourage and empower you when you need it most, then this meet up is for you.

Together we will learn, explore and experience the necessary elements to developing physical prowess, unbreakable self confidence and a lasting winning approach to fitness and healthy living.

Through my proven methods,  I will help you find and go beyond the obstacles that are keeping you from achieving long term fitness and weight loss goals. In a group setting we will share and compare our individual struggles to build a knowledge base and self confidence to finally beat our personal demons when it comes to being fit and healthy.

results.description:
Calling all biz dev peeps!

Do you guys ever get jealous about engineers going to hackathons and doing cool stuff? Well, we can do some cool stuff too. 

Enter Biz Devathon: come with objectives and leave with results. Meet at Madiba this Saturday morning for deliberation and discussion of business strategy. Then, it's straight execution the rest of the day. We'll meet back at Madiba at 8:30 pm to present our results.

If you are down to get serious and get business done on Saturday aka the Sabbath, then let's do it.

P.S. Engineers are welcome!

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

HOW TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be responsible to attend. You can pay in cash on the courts with Terry on court #5.

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

FREE Circuit Training Saturdays! A 50-minute non-stop intense workout. You will sweat off the weight, you will burn calories, you will gain muscle. All levels welcome. We vow to never give up on you. For we will do everything in our power to help you reach your goal. We operate in a judgement free zone to facilitate your comfort. We promise you will progress.

This Class consist of running, walking, floor exercise, abdominal  workouts, squats, jumprope, and much more. You always have the option to perform the modified version of any drill! This allows beginners or anyone with a minor injury to comfortable fit right in. Build your strength and endurance to perform the unmodified versions of the drill when you see FIT (pun intended :)!! All while moving to be beat of the music. Bring your family, bring your friends. 

Need further assistants locating us? Call[masked], someone will be happy to guide you! Note: We may not answer the phone during class hours!

Updated April 18th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. We use Riverside Park on Tuesdays/Thursdays and Morningside Park for the weekend games.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave) 
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!) 
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien 
[masked]


MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

results.description:
"HEAR YE HEAR YE!!!" Shouts a crier as he raises himself upon a stack of wooden crates, clearing his throat and unraveling the Scroll as the crowd silences and gathers to listen

"In Accordance with the decree of his Majesty, Emperor Eric Whitemane and Elvish High King Illithor . Through fair lottery decision, The 28th anniversary celebration of the Armistice signing shall be held in the Lush lands of Grassmere within Franciscan Empire lands!

During this time all border passing precautions shall be relaxed to allow all from far and wide to participate and attend this most joyous celebration. Heightened patrols and security shall be appointed along all Major Roads and sea route, to insure the safe passage of festival attendees.

Feats of magic from the Byzan University of Miracles, Martial prowess and friendly competitions of the stout frankish knights against the keen swodsmanship of elvish warriors. Mummers, jugglers, games of chance and fortune, Fine wares, foods, silks and treasures from across the empire, elven kingdom and beyond. All await our guests both noble and pleb at this momentous Occasion!"

Usual bit here everyone, meet at 10am try and be in kit and ready by 10.30am. We will meet outside of the bathrooms at the Seaman Ave-Isham St entrance to Inwood Hill Park. For new players the easiest way to get to the meet up location is to take the A train to the 207th street stop, exit the station at Isham street and it is a 2 minute walk from there. Important bring water we will be running around in the woods all day in the heat!

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"It's like looking into the eyes of Pure Love. I've been around meditation, acupuncture, and "Spiritual Healers" for over 20 years. In that time I've worked with several healers. Not until I had privilege of meeting Nan Ni did I experience a true healer. Having a session with Nan Ni or "Nan" is like looking into the eyes of Pure Love - the kind of selfless Love that you hoped was "out there", but didn't really expect to find. Nan has a profound sense of commitment to her patients and students. Her caring, genuine smile comes from deep within and warms you the moment that you meet her. Nan's healing, insightful ways never cease to amaze me and fill me with gratitude. Nan can look at you and know what you need. How many times was I shocked when, without my uttering a word, did she know exactly was what troubling me. I wish I were eloquent enough to express my sincere appreciation for the gift of meeting and working with Nan. Nan's answer to that would be to greet each and every person I meet with an open and loving heart. It is my hope that if you are searching for a healer and/or a meditation practice and come across these words, that you will know that you've found what you've been searching for. Thank you, Lynn" Bodhi Meditation Class Saturday March 14, 2015

"I have tried many different forms of meditation and yoga over the years. Though I have experienced some positive changes practicing over the years I never felt committed to practice on regular basis. Nan takes it to a whole other level. How and why? All I can say is you have to experience it for yourself. There is power in simplicity,love, and truth. Despite some language barriers(which are minor) You can feel her love and healing energy. Open your mind and see with a different set of eyes. I highly recommend her special Saturday classes." Michelina, Bodhi Meditation class Saturday November 15, 2014

“ My first time today. Nan is very helpful and dedicated. I enjoyed it immensely and I did experience a shift in energy. I feel more alert, relaxed and focused even as I write this testimony. I plan on attending her next class in Freeport." Michelina, Bodhi Meditation class September 17, 2014

“ Very strong healing energy tonight. I got there feeling very tired. I had stomach pain all day, and during the first meditation of the evening it got a lot better. By the end I wasn't thinking about it at all. I left full of energy. ” Pam, Bodhi Meditation class November 22, 2013

“ I didn't realize I would be reaping the benefits of Bodhi Med so quickly after attending only two classes. After my second class I felt even more relaxed. I have insomnia, but after the second session I fell asleep faster and deeper which has not happened for a long time. ” Dee, Bodhi Meditation class September 18, 2013

"I have been attending these classes for three weeks. They are amazing. Nan is wonderful! My energy level is shifting and I am beginning to experience an ongoing sense of well-being with balance and relaxation. Highly recommend!" Kathleen, Bodhi Meditation class October 25, 2013

------------------------------------------------------------------

Between May 14,2013 and October 2014 over 2,500 people attended our classes in NYC and Long Island.

The Saturday class is for a small group. Up to 8 people.

Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness

* Stronger emotional intelligence

* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation

Energize your body

Strengthen your mind

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated

* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America.

Feel free to ask Nan your personal health questions after the class.

Please arrive early for class intro/setup.

Class basic info:

* Loose fitting clothes is recommended but not required.

* Some people bring their own yoga mat for the seated meditation part. This is not a requirement as we have chairs for everyone.

* Cellphones needed to be turned off during the class.

Here is the internet link if you are interested in purchasing the meditation music used in the class.

http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1

</a> <a href="http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1"> </a> <a href="http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1"> </a> <a href="http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1"> </a> <a href="http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1"> </a> <a href="http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1"> ----------------------------------------------------------------

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

results.description:
Hey folks, let's go kayaking!!!

There is an awesome kayaking outfit in Island Park, Nassau County, which is very close to the Oceanside LIRR station and about 20 minutes from the Queens border.  They have a Marsh Eco 1.5 hour tour that will take us into some lovely marshes for a fun, lovely, and educational tour of the South Shore's islands & marshes.  We'll likely see awesome shorebirds, crabs, fish, and maybe a hawk or two!!

They supply kayaks and lifevests.  All you need to bring is lunch, water, sunblock, and a spirit of adventure!

Cost is $35, which is pretty darn good for kayaking.  We all make our own reservations for the event

Folks who are driving:  please offer a ride to folks.  Otherwise we will have to ferry folks from and to the LIRR station though I hear there is also a bus.

Make reservation at [masked]

results.description:
Join your NY/ NJ Outdoor Chapter as we hike at Harriman-Bear Mountain State Parks next Saturday! We are hiking in solidarity with some of our other Outdoor Afro team leaders as they go to the top of Mount Whitney, the highest peak in the lower 48 of the US, next week! Learn more about our national Outdoor Afro #Whitneyhiking campaign here: http://www.outdoorafro.com/2015/07/whitneyhiking-finding-your-greatest-love-of-all-in-nature/ Not only are Black people active in the outdoors, but we are excelling and defying the odds! 

On Saturday, August 15th, we will be hiking the Ramapo-Dunderberg trail with beautiful lakes and views along the way. The Ramapo-Dunderberg trail is moderate so that most people can enjoy our time together, at peace, in nature with the best of what NY has to offer, and it’s accessible by TRAIN! We’ll meet at Tuxedo Station promptly at10:30am in time to take the Harriman Shuttle bus at 10:45am. The shuttle bus is $5.00 & will bring us directly to the start of the trail. This hike goes uphill part of the way and will take about 3 hours so bring lots of water, a few snacks and a walking stick! 

check out the park here
http://www.myharriman.com/
results.name: Outdoor Afro #WhitneyHiking at Bear Mountain

results.description:
Every time we have a fencing meetup in the park, we meet new people.  Some of them are meetup members who couldn't make meetups at other times, others are just people in the park.  But they're all fun.

Cancellations are much more likely in the summer!  A meetup can be canceled because the ground is too wet, rain is predicted, high heat & humidity are predicted, or just because there aren't enough people committed to being there.  PLEASE RSVP, and come if you say you will. I will post cancellations here by 9am on the day.


To find us, enter the park via the entrance opposite the Ethical Culture School (The Ethical Culture School is on the west side of Central Park West) at 63rd and Central Park West.  The "Backup Fencing Spot" is on your right, just inside the entrance to the park.  Soccer kids have been grabbing our "Where We Fence" location pretty steadily, but to find it, follow the paved path in a large arc to your left, (It starts off heading SE and curves around to NW).  The "Where We Fence" location is on the hard packed dirt under the trees. 


We have a very limited amount of equipment to lend. We're willing to share, but if you have your own equipment, please bring it.

It's also a good idea to bring water!

A more detailed map of where we fence in Central Park is here:

https://maps.google.com/maps/ms?msid=212152258049056562883.0004db7dc1516e1da7244&msa=0&ie=UTF8&t=m&z=17&vpsrc=0

If you're having trouble finding us, call my cell[masked]  It's a good idea to have my cell handy in case we are forced to move.

I look forward to fencing you!

- Mike

results.description:
About 9 miles total walking. We will spend about 4 hours on the island, first touring Fort Jay and Castle Williams and then walking the island and viewing the Jazz Picnic. We will break for lunch on the island; bring your lunch or try the food trucks. About 5 miles total walking on the island.

Then, we will take another (free) ferry from Governor's Island to Pier 6 in Brooklyn Bridge Park and walk along the Brooklyn Heights Promenade to Brooklyn Bridge Park at Pier 1, walk under the Brooklyn Bridge and past Jane's Carousel, then walk across the Brooklyn Bridge back to Manhattan, ending our walk at City Hall Park. About 4 miles total walking from the ferry to City Hall.

Feel free to join us just for Governor's Island and take the ferry back to Manhattan on your own. If you do not want to walk across the Brooklyn Bridge you can join us as we walk to the bridge and catch the subway in Brooklyn.

MEET: at 10:30 a.m. at the Battery Maritime Building located at 10 South Street, adjacent to the Staten Island Ferry Terminal and take the 11:00 (free) ferry to Governor's Island.

LEADER: Tom Bergen[masked] [masked]

Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for paid annual Shorewalkers members, $3 for non-members, visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.

results.description:
10-a-side. 2 teams, 60min+ game. Pls arrive early, to warm up and be ready to start at 10.45am.



ALL players need to bring a white and black t-shirt and  ball.

If there are extra players we'll sub, or play 10v10. It's a large field and some players may need the option to sub. If you're a dedicated goalkeeper let us know. Not suitable for beginner level or inexperienced players.


****************************************************************

DETAILS:

• Played in a friendly environment. Pass the ball have fun.


• No rough tackles or play. Players are expected to bring a positive attitude, no screaming at/or berating team mates.


•  BRING A BALL. If you hit a ball into the river, you'll need to replace it!  If there aren't any dedicated goalkeepers playing, we rotate in goal every 5 mins.


• No metal cleats. Only turf or molded cleats.


• If you arrive late, pls wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow, and it's not fair to those that arrive on time.


The payment goes toward field permit, equipment and meetup fees.


See you at the pitch!


Note: The is a 2/3 regulation size field with full size goals. Not suitable for beginner level or inexperienced players.

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Tudor City Park is one of the quietest, most relaxing parks in the city. In addition to the park itself, there is exquisite architecture all around, and a view overlooking the UN on one side and the Chrysler Building on the other. The park is shady and perfect for a hot August day.

We'll meet at the entrance to the southern half of the park, on Tudor City Place. This is between 1st and 2nd avenue, between 41st and 42nd street. Basically, walk east on 41st street from 2nd Avenue and you'll see us.

Any problems on the day of the event, I can be reached at [masked]. 


Looking forward to sketching with you!

What makes our Meetups different from other art groups and classes? There's no instruction, but we like to share our work, and chat and be inspired. Share tips and learn from people in a casual environment where all levels of artists are welcome! Don't be shy to ask anyone anything!

• We sketch for a bit, usually 45 minutes or so, and then get back together and share our drawings, and then sketch again, etc. There's usually time for 3 or 4 sketches.

• Feel free to bring any media you like to work with - pens, pencil, watercolor, pastel, small sketchbook or large paper, iPad, whatever suits you.

• We hand out nametags so everyone can meet one another!

• We take photos to share on the site later. Bring your camera!

• Please take care to make sure we do not leave any trash behind. Please also leave any dogs at home; they tend to knock over the artwork. Thanks. 

• This Meetup is FREE and everyone at all skill levels is welcome!

In case of rain, I will let people know early in the morning if it is canceled, and then reschedule for another day.

How does the Wait List work? If the event is full, rsvp to be added to the Wait List. If someone from the regular list cancels, the first person on the Wait List is automatically bumped up to regular attendee.

Please note that if you add a comment below it will spam everyone with an email, so please use your judgement.

results.description:
Join us as we explore what was once the playgrounds of all things gang and mob related on this 2.5 hour walking tour. Stroll through historic downtown neighborhoods as you peer into their dark past. Visit famous sites of killings, movies, and infamous crimes. 

 Peer into New York's dark past and uncover hidden secrets when you visit places ruled by some of the city's most powerful gangs and mobs. Head to Little Italy, once the heart of a tight community of Italian immigrants, to hear stories about mob activities and visit notorious spots. You’ll also explore the little-known history of the Chinese migration to New York, and the dominance of dangerous street gangs and underground opium dens, as well as the ruthless gangs in the infamous Five Points area, and what became of them. Along the way you’ll stop to see historic sites, sample the local fare and discover hidden stories waiting to be revealed.

RSVP HERE!
results.name: Discover the Gangs and Mobs of Old NYC on a Guided Walk

results.description:
Do something GREAT this Summer!!


Take Acoustic Guitar Lessons in Central Park
Free Group Lessons Saturdays, May 16th to October 17.


You will learn to read notes, chords and play songs you know and love.  You will have the opportunity to learn:


• Basic info about the guitar
• To read and play chords
• To read and play Rhythm
• Techniques for using the pick
• How play finger style.
• What you learn can be applied to Rock, Blues, Folk, Country,
   Jazz, Classical
• Plenty of new songs


Anyone can attend and you don't need to attend all the sessions.  A new breakthrough approach, allows each session to be complete even for people who have no experience playing the guitar.  Note: You must RSVP by 9pm on Friday the day before the meetup is scheduled. After 9p.m., registration will be closed.

And after the lesson (12:30 - 1:30p.m), hang out and network with  people, or go check out the sights in the Park!!

WHAT TO BRING:

• Bring your own guitar for these lessons
• Bring a portable music stand if you have one
• Also bring a 3-ring binder and a pencil


OPTIONAL DONATION: The lesson is FREE.  However, your voluntary $5 or  $10 donation help to offset the cost of making the free lessons available to you.



IN CASE OF RAIN:
If it rains, or there's a threat of rain (including if there is rain the night before or in the early morning and the ground is left soggy), we will have the meetup at an indoor location; check the meetup group announcements for update if looks like rain...the alternate location we will meet at is:

The Sony Public Atrium (pictured below)
550 Madison Avenue, NY, NY  10022
Enter on 55th Street, and look for the guitars gathered near the Starbucks to the right of the entrance.

Remember: please update your RSVP if your plans change and you are unable to make it.  If something changes the day of the meetup, please let me know by phone or text at[masked]-1031.
results.name: Acoustic Guitar Lessons in Central Park - Free!!

results.description:
New York’s heartbeat originates in the Midtown section of Manhattan. This vibrant and large territory is home to many world-class institutions and organizations that set the global pace in terms of business, entertainment and other cultural elements. Come explore the sights that define the character of this always awake section of the greatest city on earth.

Itinerary:
• Times Square
• Bryant Park
• Main Branch of the New York Public Library
• Chrysler Building
• Grand Central Terminal
• The Waldorf Astoria Hotel
• Rockefeller Center
• And Much More

Reservations:
Please RSVP.If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:
Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins on Bryant Park (on the Southeast 42nd St. and 6th Av.) map here. Tour concludes at Rockefeller Center map here.

Cost:
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You do not have to pay this. Your guide is compensated with your gratuities. Monetary contributions are collected anonymously at the end. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

results.description:
Join us as we explore what was once the playgrounds of all things gang and mob related on this 2.5 hour walking tour. Stroll through historic downtown neighborhoods as you peer into their dark past. Visit famous sites of killings, movies, and infamous crimes. 

 Peer into New York's dark past and uncover hidden secrets when you visit places ruled by some of the city's most powerful gangs and mobs. Head to Little Italy, once the heart of a tight community of Italian immigrants, to hear stories about mob activities and visit notorious spots. You’ll also explore the little-known history of the Chinese migration to New York, and the dominance of dangerous street gangs and underground opium dens, as well as the ruthless gangs in the infamous Five Points area, and what became of them. Along the way you’ll stop to see historic sites, sample the local fare and discover hidden stories waiting to be revealed. 

RSVP HERE!
results.name: Discover the Gangs and Mobs of Old NYC on a Guided Walk

results.description:
This is going to be my 4th (or 5th, but who's counting) trip this summer to this very inspiring sanctuary. It will also be the last one, as I'm going on a long trip after that.

Each one of my visits so far was very different and so this coming one.

We'll meet at the sanctuary's office at 11 am,pay the $10 minimum donation (or more) and then start the tour a few minutes later.


After the tour we'll have Large vegan BBQ meal (included in the tour fee/donation)

After the meal, we'll drive about 20 minutes to Appalachian Trail Parking , Wantage, NJ 07461.

We'll do a short hike of about 1 hour. It can take 30 min, but we'll take our time after the meal. The hike is on rocks, so you need your hiking shoes.

At the end of this short hike, we'll have an amazing view of the High Point monument.


Then you have 2 options, you can hike another mile to the monument. And maybe even go up (it's a lot of stairs). Then come back to the view point.


Those of you who wants to skip the extra 2 miles, and those of you that will go to the monument and back, will continue from the view point for a swim in a local pond. The place has restrooms, coffee shop and a vegan ice cream.

After spending some time at the pond, we'll hike back to the car (about 30 minutes) and drive back home.


See you there.

PS. for more pictures visit: https://www.facebook.com/events/854919637934882/
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet at the office of the sanctuary, if you're late you can catch us on the tour
results.name: Visit Skylands Animal Sunctuary + Vegan BBQ + Swimming + Hike to High Point

group.name: V Rock! The Hoboken + Jersey City Vegetarian + Vegan Meetup

results.description:
This is it -- your *NEW* regularly-occurring opportunity to get more hands-on time hacking F#!

We'll be featuring a coding dojo every month (and in time we might transition to progressive development projects). But it's also an open invite for anything and everything F#. Want to contribute to some great open-source F# projects? C'mon down! Want to gather feedback on an upcoming presentation topic? That's cool, too. Simply want to discuss F# code with other like-minded individuals? Gotcha covered.

We'll be meeting for 5 hours on a Saturday in DUMBO (that's in Brooklyn, for those of you in Jersey). So, feel free to only drop in for a little while, or stay the entire time.

*Note: dojo's will be run from noon until 3 PM.*

We'll provide internet and electricity (and maybe even snacks). You bring a laptop, a power cord, and a desire to code! Let's do this.

(Big thanks to the New York Foundation for the Arts for the use of their awesome space!)

results.description:
We're heading into the doxie days of summer!

Join us for some cool fun at our favorite outdoor dog run - White Plains Bark Park! As usual, there will be treats and fun for all. Plus, one cool doxie will win a prize in our special raffle drawing!

Please note the earlier-than-normal time of 11:00am. This is to avoid the afternoon sun and heat. If it gets too hot, we'll either make it even earlier in the day.

YOUR CONTACT INFO

Please check your e-mail and the Web site in case there are last-minute changes to this Meetup. This is especially true as we head into summer because the weather can be unpredictable. If you would like to be notified by phone, please send a contact number. Remember, if you don't hear otherwise, the Meetup is on at the scheduled date/time. Or you can call Nick at[masked]-7040.

DIRECTIONS

From 287 East:
- Take Exit 8W for Bloomingdale Rd/Westchester Mall Pl (mall entrance will be directly ahead of you at end of ramp)
- Turn RIGHT at light at end of ramp onto Bloomingdale Rd
- Make next RIGHT onto Westchester Ave
- Make next LEFT onto S. Kensico Ave, at corner of Mobil and BP gas stations
- Make first RIGHT onto Brockway Pl - just past the car wash and before Best Friends Pet Care
- You will be driving past some auto body shops. Continue to follow the road around a couple of bends. The park will be on your right just beyond an overpass and across from a baseball field (field #2 of Delfino Park).

From 287 West:
- Take Exit 8 for White Plains/Westchester Mall Pl
- Merge onto Westchester Ave, continue straight about 1/2 mile
- Turn RIGHT on S. Kensico Ave, at corner of Mobil and BP gas stations
- Follow directions above from S. Kensico Ave.

If you have any questions, please call Nick's cell phone:[masked]-7040.

results.description:
Liebe Familien, liebe Freunde:

Our Uptown Sommer Fest is a wonderful opportunity to combine a family weekend pic-nic with meeting other families from our community and top it off with a performance in German by the Galli Theater NY.


It is free, please bring blankets and food/beverages and games and have a blast meeting other families!


Our goal behind this Sommer Fest is to create an opportunity where you can make new connections and friends.


Also: The actors and directors of the Galli Theater will be there after the performance to introduce their new program "Freunde des Galli Theaters", very much in the tradition of the European Stadttheater where you can simply decide to join the closer circle of a theater without any extensive commitment.


Please let us know if you have any questions.

[masked]

Ganz herzlich, PLEASE DO RSVP!!!

Eure

Barbara Rellstab

Rellasspielhaus.com; liederundgeschichtennyc.com

results.description:
Howdy Benders!  Hope your week is productive.  Sending out a reminder about our session this Saturday same time same place. As the weather changes, it is the perfect opportunity to drag yourself out of bed and unto your yoga mat. When I first wake up and my bed feels so good I have trouble getting out of bed. But then I remember how stressful by my work week was and how imperative yoga is to detoxing my body and aligning my mind and spirit. We owe it to ourselves to feel great! Start investing in yourself by treating yourself right. I can't tell you how many times I didn't feel like doing yoga but how great I felt afterwards.

Think about how you have an opportunity to do yoga in a community setting, meet like-minded people, and support a local business at the same time!

I would like to continue the yoga and would love to see more benders. Please take advantage of this opportunity because it may not be here for long. See you on Saturday. Namaste.
results.name: Bronx Beer and Bend Yoga

venue.name: Tabernacle Of Prayer For All People Inc

results.description:
Click the link below to purchase tickets to this event: 


http://nyadventureclub.ticketmob.com/event.cfm?id=108035&cart

Join New York Adventure Club on Saturday, August 15, for a special access tour at Loew's Valencia Theatre, one of the New York Metropolitan area's five "Wonder Theaters". This 3,000+ seat movie palace, built in 1929, is considered one of the most impressive architectural masterpieces in all of New York. 

Our behind-the-scenes experience will take us through the historic lobby, hallways, balconies, and stage by members of the Tabernacle of Prayer for All People, who have maintained the building since 1979. If we're lucky, we might get to see the atmospheric ceiling in action with its hundreds of flickering lights representing a starry night.


Afterwards, we'll grab a bite to eat in the neighborhood!

*A portion of your ticket will go towards supporting the Tabernacle of Prayer for All People and maintenance of Valencia Theatre.*
results.name: NYAC Experience: Special Access Tour @ Loew's Valencia Theatre

results.name: Rockaway Park Beach Hike and Swim

results.description:
Let's do something different for the kiddies this summer.... Watchung/Mountainside have beautiful grounds for kids to take a short hike, bird watch, and use magnificent playgrounds!
The easy red trail is .2 miles and good for pre-schoolers. (Please hold onto your kids and use bug spray as there may be poison ivy off the trail. ) Also, no strollers allowed on the trail. We can get a trail map @ noon when the indoor activities open, but the trail is open from dawn to dusk. Let's meet at the trail @ 1130 am and we can head to the picnic tables and eat lunch together afterward. There are playgrounds within a 5 min. walk with those picnic tables. The 2 newly renovated playgrounds are huge for young and older kids. Feel free to bring your own food. :)

This is a free event, however the center does take donations. 

The indoor attractions include: a museum, among bird attractions/ feeders, etc.
There are tons to do both inside and out at the grounds so let's have a fun day with the kids/families while we all explore nature together!
results.name: Children's nature trails and outdoor fun for all ages!

results.description:
ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!


• Permit Disclosure: WE HAVE A PERMIT.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- David T. )

(Co-Leader- Jefferson)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.
results.name: SATURDAY Summer Special $5 - 11:30am Soccer @LIC (2x7v7 game) for PS2G

results.description:
Join us on Saturday, August 15th at 11:30am at 16th street park's amphitheater in Bayonne, NJ... Where Chris and Anthony will be hosting a 2-hour meetup discussing, Happy Habits For Optimized Living, practical exercises for reducing stress. Along with 2 SUPER fun surprise summer activities involving grass, sun, and water balloons!


And just to give you an inside scoop of what you're going to learn, you're going to discover:

- How to break bad habits and develop new habits that ensure you achieve your life goals.
- How to create a compelling life vision that empowers you to get out of bed everyday, supercharged with high energy and laser-like focus.
- How to reduce your stress in a matter of seconds.
- How to reprogram your mind for success.
- And much much more!

It doesn't matter if you're a guy or girl, we invite you to join us for an amazing experience, where we'll all be growing together and embarking on one hell of an adventure.

Spread the word, bring a friend with you, and we look forward to seeing you soon!

Central Park is the most popular of parks for foragers. Because of its varied habitats and the combination of wild and cultivated, native, and exotic plants, Central Park is a great place to forage, even in the winter and early-spring. Here are some of the species we'll be finding:

In the Ramble, we'll be finding large stands of field garlic, with mild-flavored onion-like bulbs, plus the tender young leaves, which you use like chives.

results.description:
Central Park is the most popular of parks for foragers. Because of its varied habitats and the combination of wild and cultivated, native, and exotic plants, Central Park is a great place to forage, even in the winter and early-spring. Here are some of the species we'll be finding:

In the Ramble, we'll be finding large stands of field garlic, with mild-flavored onion-like bulbs, plus the tender young leaves, which you use like chives.

The bland leaves of lesser celandine, magical in the way they remove the bitterness of dandelions (and other bitter greens), also in season, will be at their peak, and the leaves of goutweed, which taste like parsley, only better, will already be growing.

The season's first sweet-and-sharp daylily shoots will be popping up along the embankment of the reservoir—a treat for all.

Reserve Here!
results.name: Learn How to Forage in the Heart of the Urban Jungle - Central Park Edition!

results.description:
Book-Club-Summer Reading- E Squared by Pam Grout. Nine Do-It-Yourself Energy Experiments that Prove Your Thoughts Create Your Reality

The nine experiments, each of which can be conducted with absolutely no money and very little time, demonstrate that spiritual principles are as dependable as gravity and as consistent as Newton’s laws of motion.

These are the spiritual experiments you can prove in E-Squared:

1. There is an invisible energy force or field of infinite possibilities.

2. You impact the field and draw from it according to your beliefs and expectations.

3. You, too, are a field of energy.

4. Whatever you focus on expands.

5. Your connection to the field provides accurate and unlimited guidance.

6. Your thoughts and consciousness impact matter.

7. Your thoughts and consciousness provide the scaffolding for your physical body.

8. You are connected to everything and everyone else in the universe.

9. The universe is limitless, abundant, and strangely accommodating.

Among other things, it teaches people how to drop poundage by doing nothing but changing the focus of their thoughts.

Hi Ladies, I have been hearing about this book for a while and Im excited to try out her experiments! Hope you will join in! Our book discussion will be at the end of the summer to give us all plenty of time to rest and read! What else is on your summer reading list? Enjoy, Laura

www.LauraMadrigano.com

(This is a Free meetup event)
results.name: Summer Reading-E squared by Pam Grout

Who ever said down home Southern food can't be made vegan has not been to this cooking class. Jenné Claiborne is going to teach you how to make some amazing southern staples without using an ounce of butter, pork, or any other animal product. This Georgia native has been a professional vegan chef for three years, and making southern food vegan has been a joy of hers for even longer. We won't be using any mock meats in this class, rather relying on whole foods to do the job. 

In this class you'll learn how to make: 

Creamy Mac & "Cheese" 

Perfect Smokey Collards

Spicy "Crab" Cakes

Strawberry Shortcakes 

More info and ticket here - https://goo.gl/l2ArRL

results.description:
Join us for Paella Saturdays at De Espana in SoHo. 

Only a couple of these left before the end of the summer. 

August 15 Paella Valencia - Mixta 
August 22 Seafood Paella – Marinera

How it works: the chef at the store makes one giant paella in the late morning. They start serving around 12:30 - 1pm (pretty much as soon as the paella is done). 

You must purchase your paella ticket at DeSpana around 12-12:30pm (last time we were there, they sold out of the 1pm paella by 12:30, and we had to wait for the 2pm paella service(which is not always guaranteed to happen - they tell you if there will be one or two services once you get there).

Our Group Members typically meet at De Espana sometime between 12:30 - 1pm.  If you get there first, grab a table - seating is first come first serve basis. 

Despana will open bottles of wine free of charge (but only the ones purchased from their next door wine store). They will also provide wine glassess.  Or you can purchase a glass or wine or a beer at the store. 

Hope to see you at this one, as this will be my last one for the summer. 

Best

Nina
results.name: Paella Saturdays @ DeEspana (SoHo) - August 15

results.description:
Hike @ Massapequa Preserve

5+ Miles Flat Terrain around 3 hours

WE THEN HEAD TO LOCAL BEACH!!!

Directions:

EASILY ACCESSIBLE VIA LIRR

Take LIRR from Penn Stn or Atlantic Terminal to Massapequa Train Station!

Sunrise Hwy to Broadway, Massapequa (a traffic light and a diner are on the corner). Go NORTH under the RR trestle. At the light, turn immediately right. Look for CVS.

Park @ LIRR Station!

HIKE around a Beautiful Preserve!

Warmer Weather ==> Awesome Hiking Time!

PLUS ... a Healthy - Positive - Afternoon

Talk, Network, Mingle!
Feel positive, Feel Free and good about yourself!
Enjoy the breeze, the calmness!

Multi-Meetup Combined Event


In order to Defray Organizational Costs, contribution of $2 suggested.


Bring some water, Bananas or Granola Bars, Bug Repellent & Sunblock.

Please Don't Forget the Positive MOOD

AND YOUR CAMERA

AFTER PARTY !!!  AFTER PARTY !!!  AFTER PARTY !!!

After the Hike, we could (optionally) pick up some Food (maybe Sandwiches) and drive to Beach for Beach Picnic!!! Please bring your beach accessories. 

Those taking LIRR can car-pool with us.

Please check this page before departing for the Hike For Weather or other general Updates!

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Liability Waiver

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in Front of CVS by the Massapequa LIRR Station
results.name: Hike - Massapequa Preserve THEN Beach !!!

results.description:
Come out and "Get Dirty" harvest food & farm chores at La Finca Del Sur Farm in NYC!   


Greetings Cooking NYC Meetup Members!  Long time, no see :)

Not exactly a 'cooking' meetup - but we're still experiencing food - from the ground up!

Join us this Saturday (8/15) for a fun-filled day of farm chores with foodies and urban farming enthusiasts throughout the city at La Finca Del Sur Farm. ( Just a 5 minute train ride from midtown Manhattan on express 4/5 train)

La Finca Del Sur is one of the largest urban farms in New York City!  2.5 acre urban farm oasis overflowing with tons of sun and fresh air!   

Saturday's highlight activities: Spreading mulch, harvest vegetables, How to Compost , Learn about cold weather crops,  How to lay down cardboard to suppress weeds, landscaping basics and much more!

Light refreshments and drinks will be available! 

Date: Saturday, August 15, 2015,  TIME: 12 noon - 3pm 

All rsvps will receive my cellphone # closer to the date or just walk inside the farm and ask for Gina

Directions: Fast and easy commute - Take the 4 or 5 express train to 138thST/Grand Concourse. Walk out the station – Farm is located across the street, behind the cul de sac and fence.
results.name: "Get Dirty" Mega Farm Work Day at La Finca Del Sur Farm! Farm chores, food & fun

results.description:
Fajing literally means to ‘emit strength’. In this school, we focus in ‘whole-body strength emission’. In the area of self-defense, this is of major importance, since one wants to hit an attacker as hard and as fast as possible, and incapacitate him/her within three seconds, in order to save our lives; while maintaining internal equanimity and control. However, most people respond to life-threatening attacks with only the strength of their arms or legs, as opposed to the strength of their whole bodies. Therefore, our responses to attacks are significantly hampered, and our chances of survival get drastically minimized.

Erle Montaigue’s Fajing Quan System of Fighting and Healing is the system of training created by Erle Montaigue, the founder of the World Taiji Boxing Association, in order to develop true whole-body fajing, the method of movement through which we engage every joint in our body in perfect coordination in an explosive manner, delivering full-body strikes into our opponent (think about how much you weigh, as opposed to only the weight of your arm or your leg). 

This desired response is achieved by accessing our reptilian brain, which has been sophisticated through one’s training, and operate from it in the event of an attack, as opposed to operate from our cerebral cortex/human brain, which processes information slower by trying to understand logically what is happening. Our reptilian brain acts only on reflexes, which are deeply engrained in our nervous system; so our training will come out just as another learnt reflex, like muscle memory.

This ability to fajing will be useful also in the healing arts, by emitting healing energy through the same method, in a soft, non-explosive way (Yin-Yang uses of a core, unique principle).

The training consist on:

- 8 Wudang Stepping Methods

- 12 Wudang Hand Weapons Drills

- Small San Sau Self-Defense Form

- One Hand Yang Style Martial Push Hands

- Entering Methods

- Internal and External Mechanics for Striking/Kicking/Punching

- Wudang Knife Forms

- Introduction to Dim Mak

Who ever said down home Southern food can't be made vegan has not been to this cooking class. Jenné Claiborne is going to teach you how to make some amazing southern staples without using an ounce of butter, pork, or any other animal product. This Georgia native has been a professional vegan chef for three years, and making southern food vegan has been a joy of hers for even longer. We won't be using any mock meats in this class, rather relying on whole foods to do the job. 

In this class you'll learn how to make: 

Creamy Mac & "Cheese" 

Perfect Smokey Collards

Spicy "Crab" Cakes

Strawberry Shortcakes

Greetings,

The USS Justice has scheduled its annual picnic for Saturday, August 15th, from noon to 5 PM at Lake Parsippany Park, Parsippany, NJ. All members of this MeetUp are invited to attend our free event.   Please be sure to RSVP if your planning to attend.

Please join us as we cook up some burgers, hot dogs and various other foods. We'll be playing various board games as well as Bocce Ball, frisbee football or any other games that come to mind. This will be a rain or shine event as we'll be having the picnic under the Pavilion located in the park.

Further information and directions will be forthcoming, so save the date now and plan for a fun day with the USS Justice.

Thank you,

Mike

Learn to draw in just two hours! Think you can’t draw a straight line? Longing to tap into your right brain? Join NYC's #1 Rated Art Class Studio in this fun and inspiring drawing class in Central Park, as YOU:

-Learn beginner's drawing techniques

-Walk away feeling fulfilled with your own drawings that will make you say, "Wow, I AM creative!"

All art supplies included. Art class meets on the Upper West Side in Central Park. 
In the case of rain, students will meet at The Art Studio NY for an indoor drawing class adventure.

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe. 


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 10:30AM


No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:


2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club Programs or activities.

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

HOW TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be responsible to attend. You can pay in cash on the courts with Terry on court #5.

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Hike @ Massapequa Preserve

5+ Miles Flat Terrain around 3 hours

WE THEN HEAD TO LOCAL BEACH!!!

Then Possibly...OUTDOOR Movie on the Beach Under the Stars

Movie Name = On the Waterfront

Movie Time = 7:45pm


Directions:

EASILY ACCESSIBLE VIA LIRR

Take LIRR from Penn Stn or Atlantic Terminal to Massapequa Train Station!

Sunrise Hwy to Broadway, Massapequa (a traffic light and a diner are on the corner). Go NORTH under the RR trestle. At the light, turn immediately right. Look for CVS.

Park @ LIRR Station!


HIKE around a Beautiful Preserve!

Warmer Weather ==> Awesome Hiking Time!

PLUS ... a Healthy - Positive - Afternoon

Talk, Network, Mingle!
Feel positive, Feel Free and good about yourself!
Enjoy the breeze, the calmness!

Multi-Meetup Combined Event


In order to Defray Organizational Costs, contribution of $2 suggested.


Bring some water, Bananas or Granola Bars, Bug Repellent & Sunblock.

Please Don't Forget the Positive MOOD

AND YOUR CAMERA


AFTER PARTY !!!      AFTER PARTY !!!    AFTER PARTY !!!

After the Hike, we could (optionally) pick up some Food (maybe Sandwiches) and drive to Beach for Beach Picnic!!! Please bring your beach accessories. 


Those taking LIRR can car-pool with us.

Please check this page before departing for the Hike For Weather or other general Updates!

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Liability Waiver

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

results.name: Hike - Massapequa Preserve THEN Beach Then Outdoor Movie!!!
