results.description:
Get on the water in NYC!  Come experience outrigger paddling for free.

This event will have outrigger paddling.  SUP paddling may be added before the event.  Check the comments field below for updates.

This event is open to the public on a first come, first served basis.

RSVPing to this meeup does not guarantee you a spot.

However, your acknowledgement helps us plan our day to make sure we get you on the water as quickly as possible!

A completed waiver is required for participation.

Click here to fill out the waiver.

We paddle rain or shine except when there is lightening.  Remember to wear sunscreen and to bring a bottle of water in the canoe to stay hydrated. You are free to wear whatever you want provided you do not mind the possibility of it getting wet. You may want to consider bringing something dry you can change into afterwards. Assume anything you bring in the canoe will get soaked and/or lost.

The novice sessions will involve a half hour introduction on the dock to familiarize you with the technique, commands and safety protocol of the canoe. This is then followed by a 30 to 45 minute session on the water.

More details can be found at: http://newyorkoutrigger.org/novices/program-description/

DONATIONS:

One final note, you may already know that we are a non-profit 501c3 educational organization and fully volunteer based. Any cash or check donations – while not required - would be greatly appreciated and go towards funding our efforts  to continue providing New Yorkers with the experience of outrigger paddling in New York City.

Any donations can be given your land training instructor.  In addition, you can donate via our website

http://newyorkoutrigger.org/members/

by clicking on the "Donate" button.
results.name: Free Outrigger Paddling at Hudson River Park's Pier 66 - Session 3

venue.address_1: Coney Island Ave. and Brighton Beach Ave.
venue.name: Brighton Beach Ave. and Coney Island Ave., Southeast corner

results.description:
We'll start by grabbing a takeout lunch or snack in Brighton Beach, at NYC's biggest and most exotic "salad" bar (far more than salads), part of a Russian mega-market. (Even if you bring your own lunch, exploring this store is an adventure.) After lunch on benches overlooking the ocean, we'll walk along the boardwalk, past Brighton and a rejuvenated Coney Island. Then we'll walk back along the shore, stop for a rest and optional swim, and view the sand sculptures, part of a big contest for amateurs and semi-professionals. (Last year's works look fantastic online!) Time permitting, we'll visit the Coney Island History Project and other neighborhood attractions in Coney and exotic Little Odessa (Brighton). Come and enjoy being on a distant planet, light years from the usual city existence.

PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING DETAILS SO YOU'RE PROPERLY PREPARED.

DISTANCE: About 4 miles.

PACE: MODERATE, NOT SLOW. If you want to stroll slowly rather walk moderately, this is not the right hike for you!

FINISH AT: Around 5 PM. But you can leave earlier, of course.

COST: $2, in part to cover Meetup's organizer fee, plus the cost of any food you buy.

TRANSPORTATION: Q train to "Brighton Beach." Consult hopstop.com, tripplanner.mta.info, or both, since each is occasionally inaccurate. Also check http://web.mta.info/weekender.html for weekend service changes on your trains.

WAITING LIST: Sign up and be patient, no matter how many are waiting. Long wait lists have totally disappeared because of cancellations, especially at the last minute. You can come if you're in the top 20 on the list (shown below the main list on the right side of this page on a computer--not an app or mobile device) at any time before the walk starts. If you can't come, no need to let me know. But please change your RSVP online. As a courtesy to others waiting for a spot, please do not sign up unless you really intend to go, rather than just as a placeholder in case nothing better turns up.
results.how_to_find_us: The corner is a big intersection east of the Q train. (East is toward the bend in Brighton Beach Ave. South is toward the boardwalk, visible from any corner. ) There's a Chase bank on SE corner & Chase ATM on opposite corner). Look for my red hat.
results.name: Brighton Beach, Coney Island, and sand sculptures!

results.description:
Waiting List: The day before an event we tend to have a lot of people drop out so do not be discouraged if you're on the waiting list--there's a good chance you'll be able to join.


Attending List: Please remember that the RSVP list closes at 5pm the day before an event. If you change your RSVP to NO after that time or are a no-show, someone on the waiting list could be left out. We take that very seriously.

Club Hours: C&B sets aside space for us from 12:30pm to 2:30pm so those are the official club hours. Everyone is free to stay longer if they wish.

First-Timers: If it is your first time at C&B, you will have to take a lesson from the range staff. If you are an experienced archer, you must at least stay for the safety portion (no exceptions, range rules). Lessons start at half past the hour so if you miss the 12:30pm, you may have to sit around and wait for the 1:30pm. Please be on time.

Public Transportation: LIRR to Hicksville and then a taxi from the station to C&B (make sure to tell them 11 Commercial St in Hicksville). The train from Penn gets into Hicksville at 11:55 am. The cab rate as of 1/1/14 is $6.50 +$2 for each additional person. Those of you taking the train may wish to post a message to the group to share a cab.

Range Costs: Make sure to mention when you pay for range time you are shooting with the NYC Archery Group to get the CLUB ONLY rates:

$7.00 for the first hour, $5 each additional hour OR $15 to shoot all day
$0.50 for a target
$11 per hour for a rental bow and arrows
$5.00 for a lesson (includes first hour)

Visit the C&B website for the most up-to-date information.

See you on the shooting line!
results.name: New York City Archery Monthly Meetup at C&B

Squats and lunges are also included. Approximately 14 million people take weekly Zumba classes in over 141,000 locations across more than 151 countries.

results.description:
I'm posting this meetup on behalf of Christine. 

"GustOrganics, conveniently located by 14th Street and 6th Avenue, is a vegan and 100% certified organic restaurant . I've been here a couple of times for dinner. I really like their food. Unfortunately, this restaurant will be closing at the end of the month. Before it closes, I would like to go one last time for brunch. They offer an awesome happy hour special called a $10 Boozy Brunch (Unlimited Drinks). They also offer a $20 Prix Fixe (Starter + Entree + Coffee or Tea). "

Brunch Menu: http://gustorganics.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/BRUNCH_TEMPLATE.pdf "

After we eat and/or drink, we can head out to the High Line. About the High Line: http://www.thehighline.org/visit

I am open to hearing any other suggestions as to what to do after GustOrganics. Please feel free to message me with any comments, questions, or suggestions on this event.

We will meet outside of the 14th Street/6th Avenue Station at 1pm. Please BE ON TIME as we will not be lingering around the restaurant. This is NOT like other meetups we've done where you can come an hour or two late and still not miss much.
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet outside of the 14th Street/6th Avenue Station at 1pm.

results.description:
We’re happy to have a special guest speaker, Diane Martin, author and publisher with Escribe Publishing Inc., at 1:30 p.m.  Diane will talk about indie publishing and answer any questions members have.


Escribe is a small start-up indie publisher. One of its authors just won an indie book award. Companies like Escribe are a new trend in independent book publishing in which both publisher and author are engaged in a collaborative effort. For more information see escribepublishing.com.

I’m anticipating this portion of the meeting will be finished by 3, unless there are a lot of questions. Assuming we’ll have an hour left, come prepared to write on an impromptu prompt, and bring work to share and discuss if desired.

I'm looking for a better location, but we'll meet as stated above unless I announce otherwise.

Also, our club is searching for a permanent home and there are sponsorship opportunities. Please pass the word along. People can contact me at [masked].

Thanks, and happy writing!
cindy

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
